text:
watching dr. ford’s testimony this past thursday made me physically sick. i watched a terrified, but very composed and credible woman relive an assault that has haunted her for the past 36 years. it hurt my heart but i felt hopeful because she was finally being heard. then i listened to brett kavanaugh speak and the republican senators speak as well and that sick feeling turned into a feeling that i couldn’t put into words. a mixture of disgust, shame, anger. this cartoon by bruce mackinnon is the closest thing that i have found that conveys exactly how i feel. 
i have made it abundantly clear that i believe dr. ford. i know many of you reading this do not. 
however, i’ve made it clear in the past that i don’t post things to change anyone’s mind. i post them so other like minded people know they’re not alone. 
i stand by that now more than ever, and i stand by dr. ford and the opposition of brett kavanaugh’s appointment to the supreme court. 📷: bruce mackinnon

text:
mindy kaling is an asian - american actress, comedian, and writer. she played kelly kapoor in the popular sitcom the office. in addition to acting in it, she was a writer, executive producer, and occasional director to the show. kaling gained wider attention for creating, writing, producing and starring in her comedy series the mindy project. in addition to her work on film and television, kaling has also written two new york times best-selling memoirs, titled “is everyone hanging out without me? (and other concerns)” and “why not me?”.
.
.
.
.

.

text:
14 year old emmett till was lynched by roy bryant & his brother in 1955 after falsely being accused of flirting & making untoward advances towards 21 year old carolyn bryant, roy’s wife.
decades later after till’s death, carolyn recanted staying that she had fabricated part of the testimony regarding her interaction with till, specifically the portion where she accused till of grabbing her waist and uttering obscenities, "that part's not true," bryant stated in a 2008 interview with historian timothy tyson.
both men were acquitted by an all white jury in 1956 & once they were protected from double jeopardy, admitted publicly they murdered this boy.
this is what #metoo hysteria leads too. this is what lack of due process looks like. this is what happens when accusers are simply believed with no evidence. rape & sexual assault are heinous & serious crimes. accusations of such against another person should be treated as such.

text:
we are living in a time of great unearthing, the unveiling of the deep darkness of this country... the things we take stands for, seek justice for, and the things we turn a blind eye to are defining our soul as a country... as citizens and as politicians. i have hope that at some point we will put our humanity above all else, above party, even above country... we are given invitations to do this every day, in increasing numbers, we must remember our humanity... the school shootings, the black children and adults killed by police, the survivors being dismissed, rapists ruling in the highest offices of our government, refuge families being torn apart, and so much more... these events are connected, these tragedies are the result of forgetting our humanity, of certain people putting their very existence above others... of old white cisgender men making the rules and running with them. it's time to wake up, now more than ever. who are we as a county? who are we as humans?

friends, this election is not just about politics, this is about our soul. we must vote these monsters out of office, we must vote for people who are going to fight for all, not just the old boys club. we've seen what these men do, we've seen what they say... their time is up. vote, vote, vote. if you think it doesn't matter... remember this is how we got here... #believewomen #believesurvivors #metoo

text_retweet:
decided to #repost my original #whyididntreport story after for some reason the #ussenate decided to proceed with nomination of #brettkavanaugh - i am a #survivor of an #abusiverelationship - i stand with #christineblaseyford and all #abuse survivors. 
in 2002/04 i was in h.s. at a private all girls school. my bf went to the boys school across the street. from day 1 he was controlling & verbally degrading when he felt threatened. but, every month i was given flowers on our “anniversary”. this made me feel special and loved. there were other reasons his grooming made me feel “special” but what 15 year old doesn’t want to walk around school all day with flowers? 
he would call & text constantly. if i didn’t answer i was obviously cheating and then the harassing would begin. 
during this time he would have me do things that i was not comfortable with....mainly sexual things in public places such as the schools bathrooms. we were caught a few times and i felt cheap and disgusting. even with the flowers. heaven forbid i didn’t do as requested, then i was told i didn’t love him and that was not acceptable to me at that time. 
did i report his abuses? nope. why, because if i had i would’ve been told it was consensual. it wasn’t. i wasn’t enjoying what was happening. that being said, because we were in a relationship i must’ve been ok with it. again, i wasn’t. i was a teenager who was afraid and felt my self worth was tied up in a football player boyfriend. 
hopefully this helps to show some why people don’t report. you better believe if he ran for office or was nominated for #scotus i’d want that story known.

text:
a real man. what does that even mean? so many boys are put down for being too much of a wuss, and not being a real man.
.
🤷‍♂️i have a wife and a beautiful baby boy so i think i know a little bit more on what it means to be a real man....at least more than the pricks at school so listen up.
.
☝️real men are kind. real men see strengths in others instead of weakness. real men recognize their weaknesses and strive to become better every day. real men seek to lift others up, not shove them down.
.
✌️chicks don't find it attractive when you are an a-hole to other kids. it actually makes you look stupid as hell (pardon my french). wanna know what girls like? they like it when they see a man who treats his mother well, and treats others just as nice. girls like to see a man who will respect others, because they also want to be respected.
.
if you feel like you're too much of a cool dude to be nice to others, then i hope you enjoy the life you are choosing....because it's gonna be a damn lonely one.
#realmen #bekind #beawinner

text:
fyi: people don’t forget who assaulted or molested them. .
especially if it is someone they know.
.
and it usually is someone they know.
.
it stays with them. forever. .
they might relive it every week or every day. .
they might repress it until many years later.
.
that’s just how it is.
.
if it has never happened to you, consider yourself lucky.
.
#ibelieveher #metoo #triggered #timesup

text:
i told a friend that this week has made me feel stuck in the past and the future, but not the present. the past: thinking about the boy who assaulted me in high school, and all the ways i want to tell my teenage self to react differently (step one: stop dating that ass! step two: tell someone!) the future: realizing the world won’t change fast enough for my baby girl to grow up not being afraid, and not needing to be afraid. so i ran ten miles really fast (anger is great for that!) and only stopped to contemplate the beauty of this spider’s web. forcing myself to feel the air on my skin and appreciate the loveliness of the present. take care of yourselves, sisters. i love you.
.
.
.
#running #marathontraining #longrun #runviews #metoo #sexualassault #womensrunningcommunity

text:
a woman who is drunk, and naked, should be able to walk into a room filled with 100 men and know that nothing will happen to her. a girl/woman should never have to worry that a strange man (or a man her parents call a friend) will put his hands on her body without her consent. a girl/woman should never have to experience an unknown/known man pulling up her clothing exposing her body. if a girl/woman is sexually assaulted she should certainly, never, ever, in any capacity, be blamed or shamed for what she endured. 
she is your daughter.
she is your wife.
she is your sister.

#ibelieveher #metoo

text: it’s been exactly 1 year since the last time i had alcohol in my body. i made the conscious decision to quit drinking when my doctor told me i had an ulcer. how does a 26 year old girl get an ulcer? by drinking $10 whiskey on an empty stomach every second of every day she’s not at work. why was i drinking so much? to drown out the emotions i felt, to numb the pain, and to dumb myself down to the level of the people i was surrounding myself with. by giving up alcohol, i gave up an entire lifestyle i had thought was “fun” and i had to give up more than just booze. i had tried to quit drinking in 2014, following a dui in 2013. but i couldn’t stick with it because i was still doing the same things, just without the booze. you can’t go to bars with your friends and not drink and not want to kill everyone there for being such drunk, bumbling idiots. there’s a good quote that goes something like “if you hang around the barber shop long enough, you’re gonna get a haircut” and i think that rings true for most things- you become what you choose to surround yourself with. if all of your friends are toxic people who are constantly miserable because they actively ruin their own lives on a near daily basis (and you do too- i was my own worst enemy when i was drinking, and it cost me dearly in more ways than one) it’s time to step back and think about what you want to surround yourself with. when i was drinking i was miserable all the time, mentally and physically. i would get the shakes by noon if i didn’t at least sip on some alcohol by then. it was like being trapped by something that wanted to slowly kill me- and for a while, i didn’t care. until i started falling apart physically from abusing my body for a decade, i wasn’t going to stop. but i sit here today because i stopped, and i’m loud about my recovery because i know how much better i feel now and i want other people to be able to feel better, too. if you’ve ever considered quitting, if your doctor has ever told you to quit, if you’re on medications that shouldn’t be mixed with alcohol- here is your sign that you’re right, you can do it, and you’ll be happier and healthier once you do. peace & love, corinne

text: @regran_ed from @seanecorn -  this is a picture of a vandalized article of my friend @karenavirginia. karena is a kundalini yoga instructor from my home state of nj.  she is also one of the brave women that came forward and accused @realdonaldtrump of harassment before the election. as you can imagine, when she went public her life flipped upside down and the hate she and her family experienced was utterly traumatic. today she posted this picture on instagram with commentary, but once again, was hit back so hard, she was forced to take it down to protect herself and family. in her post she said “i’m done holding secrets society wants held. look what happened to me when i revealed sexual assault on ‘pussy grabber’...i was threatened to death. daily. the death threats were beyond frightening. the lack of support was heartbreaking. how are we contributing to teenagers speaking up when we are afraid to reveal the truth about gurus, priests, spiritual teachers and our communities when they would rather keep secrets secret? how? we aren’t? that is why we are kicking and screaming today...”. with her permission i am posting her pic and a part of her commentary. i stand with karena and all the women who refuse to be silenced. this is not a time for passivity; for waiting for the storm to blow over. we are the storm and we’re not dissipating anytime soon. please show your support for karena by leaving her a message here or on her page. i want her to know that there is support here in the yoga community, and that she is not alone in her efforts and that her voice is welcomed, her experience believed and her spirit valued. #webelieveyou #metoo #whyididntreport #endviolenceagainstwomen #offthematintotheworld @offthemat #silentnomore - #regrann

text:
dia de los muertos @somarts oct 12, 2018 group exhibition

cynthia tom's exploring your hungry ghosts:family patterns installation.
understand your ancestral past to gain power moving forward.

from amy lam
an artistic collaboration....quote and original music written and played by amy lam, http://amygracelam.com/2016/10/29/1082/
#metoo
"i had the opportunity  to display this poem next to the visual stories of cynthia tom in her exhibit discards and variances, tales of human trafficking from a chinese american perspective. the images of cynthia’s maternal grandmother, her mother and other women on canvas are haunting. they do not tell pretty stories of migration and adaptation. their eyes speak of deception and loss and uncertainty. as i hand wrote my poem on a 10 ft. tall wall, these spirits led me into imagining the brutal chaotic world they landed upon off the beaches of san francisco. but they also showed me the visions and secret dreams they wanted for themselves, not as enslaved chinese women, but as individual human souls seeking liberation." amy lam
.
#somartsdiadelosmuertos , #ancestral #artthatheals #1890bryantstreetstudios 
#cynthiatomart @cynthiatom.art

text:
a brave woman i know sharing her soul. go follow @mrs.charland her content has been giving me goosebumps! .
.
.
i'll never forget the moment trump won. 
my eyes filled with tears as he started gloating and his wife's face turned sour and my dad sat quietly for a moment. then, he gets in my face and proceeds to bad mouth every woman politician that was against trump. he jumps up and yells and laughs like a maniac and he tells me that this was god's choice. when i ask him if it's okay to talk about women how trump talks about us, he blows it off. it's unimportant. 
he said the same exact words when i told him about how #metoo is about me...too. 
he doesn't understand why i'm upset when he makes fun of the women's march. he doesn't understand why i'm angry when he calls them names and says that they are ignorant. because he didn't know that, i am them. 
my dad...who was so glad we're done with 'that black president'. my mother...who told me about her sexual assaults but refuses to acknowledge the behavior that causes it.

you taught me how to clean and how to be a slut in the most christian way. 
the hypocrisy. 
you taught me how to be quiet. how to stay 'humble'. but you should have taught me how to think for myself. how to tell the boys that no, i don't want it. how to tell my sisters that something happened. you needed to teach me how to speak up.  but more importantly you needed to teach me how to woman up. 
but all you taught me was how to shut up. 
you told me we didn't need feminism because 'we're already equal'. but you were wrong. 
the equal rights amendment.

y'all realize that since 1972 we have been trying to get this passed....we need at least 38 states to pass it....on may 30th, 2018, illinois became the 37th state to ratify it. it's been 46 years.

you told me that i know nothing about politics. well i know now. and you were wrong. 
my body, my life, my sisters- my choice. 
not yours. not yours, ever again.

#whenweallvote #believesurvivors #womanswave #stopkavanaugh #kavano #cancelkavanaugh #believechristine #believesurvivors #ibelieveher #feminism #feminist #4thwavefeminism

text: micro expressions are a methodology used effectively in spotting deception. pioneered in the late 60’s by psychologist paul ekman, there has since been substantial research proving the detection of micro expressions as a useful training tool for law enforcement. i’ve never seen a more compelling demonstration of them than kavanaugh’s testimony. #kavanaugh #kavanaughhearings #microexpressions #supremecourt #nominations #metoo #faces #lying #truth #facialexpressions #sexualassult #fairness

you told me we didn't need feminism because 'we're already equal'. but you were wrong. 
the equal rights amendment.

y'all realize that since 1972 we have been trying to get this passed....we need at least 38 states to pass it....on may 30th, 2018, illinois became the 37th state to ratify it. it's been 46 years.

you told me that i know nothing about politics. well i know now. and you were wrong. 
my body, my life, my sisters- my choice. 
not yours. not yours, ever again.

#whenweallvote #believesurvivors #womanswave #stopkavanaugh #kavano #cancelkavanaugh #believechristine #believesurvivors #ibelieveher #feminism #feminist #4thwavefeminism

text:
#ibelieveher -
i’m not one to know what’s usually going on in the news, by choice. but the past couple of days, having this platform flooded with post after post of women rising up and sharing their voice, it was easy to be impacted by the energy. 
the libra in me that stands for justice can heavily and intensely be swallowed up by a fiery passion and consumed when i get behind a movement that i believe in. 
and i know that this is the energy that these times are needing from me, to stand up, to be a voice, for those that weren’t listened to. for those that were violated. for those that were made to feel unworthy of their no.

rape. molestation. sexual coercion. is 
is disgustingly far too common. but the conversation is necessary. this discussion is mandatory. and should no longer be hidden and made to feel shameful and embarrassed of. it’s time to heal. heal so that our future generations know better and do better. 
i can’t help but think of my son and the world he is growing in. he is being raised to know compassion and respect for all. to listen, to honor, to love unconditionally. i wonder what the world will be like for him as he gets older.. all of the women in me wants to stand up and roar with millions of others!

but i find myself witnessing in awe, of the waves that are being made. of the foundations being destroyed only to build a new. of the courage blanketing this globe.

i can only trust that the work i’ve been called to offer, will continue to be a container, a safe space, a home for those that seek to unleash their voice after lifetimes of being silenced and made to feel unworthy and not good enough.

i am here. 
i am here.
i am here.

i see you
i hear you
and 
i believe you!

#metoo
#rise

stage 3: road of trials – “the heroine begins to experience all of the stages and challenges of ego development in order to fit in with the outer world such as; getting the degree, having the exhibition, getting the corporate job, finding a partner and/or buying a house in order to fit into the culture. she has jumped through all of the hoops required to fit in. the inner journey at this stage is overcoming the myth of dependency, inferiority, deficient thinking “i’m not as good as a man” and overcoming the myth of romantic love”. .
.
.
. .
.
.
.
.

text:
ladies, a whole facet of our existence and worth is being dragged through the mud. it's not just dr. ford, but every single one of us is on trial right now. our motives, fears, intentions, decisions being judged and weighed and picked apart and found unworthy or lacking or straight stupid. 
please take care of yourselves right now. know that whatever you did following your assault was right for you at the time. and it's not your job to be the asshole whisperer. there is a difference between a man who wants to learn and a man who wants to judge, and you know the difference when you see it. you don't have to justify your actions to these people. if you're being triggered by the news, social media, or personal questions, it's okay to take a step back and do some self care. 
ladies, i don't care if we've known each other for ten years or ten days. i don't care if we've had personal beef between us or not. if you're being triggered by these events and need someone to talk to, then i'm your girl.

you've already been through hell. don't let these people force you to live through it again. 
#believesurvivors #feminist #feminism #drford #ibelieveher #believewomen #sexualassault #selfcare #imhere #imhereforyou #sisters #solidarity #respectwomen #halfthepopulation #metoo

text: “trump and the republican leaders had little choice but to ask mr. trump to order the f.b.i. inquiry after senator jeff flake, republican of arizona, first announced he was supporting judge kavanaugh, and then, in a stunning reversal, said he would not vote to confirm him without an f.b.i. investigation first. with a handful of allies in a closely divided senate, mr. flake, a conservative but an outspoken critic of the president, could determine the future of the kavanaugh nomination, and that gave him leverage over senate republicans as well as the president.” and this decision was the result of our collective efforts as well as the woman survivors, who firmly confronted sen. flake in-person. more power to women! 🙌🏽

text:
“testifying has helped me understand that one individual’s behavior and actions make a difference. that my actions are important to people other than myself. it would have been more comfortable to remain silent.” - anita hill
▫️
i don’t talk much of my own #metoo experience. never on social media. it’s different and painful and sensitive for every person who has experienced someone crossing our private boundaries. and a daunting concept for me to feel comfortable with. but i do have a few things that i’m still preparing to say. i think it’s important.
▫️
before there was #metoo, there was #anitahill. understand that anita hill, dr. christine ford, or any survivor who brings their story to the forefront at this level also makes a great sacrifice of self & safe-space by doing so. how isolating and dehumanizing it must feel when we choose not to stand with them.
▫️
1,600 men signed an ad in the new york times supporting dr. christine ford and honoring anita hill. the full page print is an homage to 1991’s ad signed by 1,600 black women who believed anita. i stand with dr. ford, just as much as with anita hill. making private pain public is bigger than yourself. it is to push back on the future ability of a toxic culture to ever allow that pain to occur for anyone else after them. it’s never to become famous—not when it’s at the expense of public scrutiny of your character for something so intimately experienced. bringing it to light is for a greater purpose.
▫️
and although it might be scary, and although i’m still finding my own words for my own pain story, i will fight to do the same in my own time. #metoo #yourstorymatters #useyourvoice #believesurvivors #believeinyourpower #ibelieveanitahill #ibelievechristineblaseyford #ibelieveher

text:
long post, so please read in its entirety. i was walking by the boston planned parenthood yesterday and there were about thirty protesters in front. i have female friends that have dealt with sexual assault or worse. i have female friends that have no insurance and go to planned parenthood for basic care - a physical, breast cancer screenings, birth control, etc. i made this sign to show humor in the face of zealotry. thirty of them...... and me off to the side. i held it up for about thirty minutes and got a very positive response. i won't stoop to confrontation with the protesters. i want to take the high road to shine the spotlight on how absurd their claims are.
.
.
the last straw for me with these protesters? a friend went in this morning and said a young woman was in tears because she was afraid to face the protesters on her way out. that's. not. right. these people are bullies. i'm going to go back soon with more signs like this to counter their hatred with humor. if you think making a 19 year old girl cry is doing the "lord's work" then you and i are reading very different versions of the bible. if you comment with hate, i will delete the comment and block you. no exceptions. 
#muaythai #mixedmartialarts #ufc #mma #kickboxing #photography #thailand #boxing #bjj #boston #glorykickboxing  #newyork #newengland #triumphkombat #lionfight #blackandwhite #muaythaigram #muaythaiauthority #onechampionship #noboundary #noboundaryfight #plannedparenthood #metoo #christianity #humor #sexualhealth

text:
#metoo #medu
“pleasantness-postings“ are not my thing, are not my job ! 
it is interesting what kind of expectance attitude #spiritually interested people do basically have. 
oh, you kind good-fellows, who have picked your being-kind as button - how dubious are you yourselves at all? 
clear words concerning victim-traitor relationships -we are calling it '#karma' - or about politics of silence or about looking-away over longtimes, you don't want to hear anything at all. actually you love the collective stonying. preferably intellectually verbal (without being endangered to...) to kiss your asses, this is not my job ! a #chögyam #trungpa, #mipham or #sogyal #rinpoche are always more favourite for me than your blabla of internet-morality. 
well, basically i love you all to eat. the lotus grows out of the mud, as all of you have already heard thousand times. and out of these rinpoches mentioned above more merits have been grown than you can ever dream.
bon voyage, dear friends, bon voyage ! 
this does not mean, that i do agree to bad failures- just to put it right. 
#abate

text:
just pubbed! an anthology of evil men 
esme oliver, author of smoke, drink, f@#k, brings us this collection of sharp new essays that crystallize – as only oliver can – the highs and lows of a woman dating in her 30s. sometimes cringe-worthy, always hilarious, this stories go beyond the run-of-the-mill rom-com fantasies and lay bare what it means to be a strong, sensitive woman who is determined not to settle for less than she deserves. oliver’s experiences, which include two separate experiences with sexual harassment – one which occurred in the u.s. senate –  bring a clear-eyed levity to the realities of being a grown-ass woman in a #metoo world.

text:
i don’t know politics but i know empathy and i know there are lots of ladies needing to hear this. i’m not one to post during these facebook war seasons but a pastor once told me that with the same passion i get mad that i need to grab the microphone. so…

1.when people are brave enough to talk about their abuse… please listen to them. i was on the receiving end of sexual abuse at an early age and i didn’t come forward with the information until almost 10 years later. not because it was an opportune time for me or because the spotlight would benefit me but because i beat out the feelings of depression, suicide, and shame long enough to say something. you may not know why someone holds onto the story of their abuse for months, years, or decades, but when they share their story please listen and love on them. that is all you have to do.  i don’t know everyone’s case but i will always first assume their intent is not revenge but healing. their intent is to release this heavy weight that steals so much from them, including but not limited to worth, confidence, security, trust. 
2.if you have an untold story i pray that the media and the pointing fingers all over the world right now would not affect you by bringing you more pain that you already carry. my biggest fear is that you see in this story your biggest fears coming to pass. you coming forth and nobody believing you and nobody supporting you. we beat ourselves up so much already by trying to make sense of it enough that makes what happened ok and therefore not a deep dark secret. i want to tell you that in my case nobody really acted at the time i came forth but god... jesus walked with me through the hard stuff, he healed me in a way only he could, and the parts of my life that were stolen from me were returned ten fold with a future that was more than i could ever imagine. i beat statistics, i beat that, that was meant to destroy me. you can too.
i love you! whoever you are, whatever your story.. i love you!

#metoo

text: we’ve all been following this. i hope it’s angered you. i hope it has clearly confirmed the patriarchal system fails to protect and value our equal humanity. i have two daughters and a son. i look at them in light of this governing failure and my mama heart spilts. fear tears at me, whispering that my daughters have a high percentage chance they’ll experience sexual assault. #metoo and my son could easily fall prey to the shame we unload on men when they don’t conform to patriarchal standards. but this is a crucial time to silence fear and face the current moment. be active in raising our children to #believewomen & to be warriors of justice, truth and love. #creativejustice #persisterhood #feminisim #boyscanbefeministstoo quote credit: @lizbohannon

text:
stage 6: the descent - “after the sense of spiritual aridity often times comes a descent. what triggers a descent? it could be the death of a family member, the end of a relationship, leaving home, the loss of a job, geographical move, giving birth or menopause. it’s a real change in one’s life. the descent is clinically called a “depression”. a time when a woman begins to reconnect with herself. feelings that were cut off in the initial separation from the feminine start to come up such as rage, sadness, grief, wandering, not knowing what comes next and the dreams at this time are very often of a dark dream woman.” .quote by; maureen murdock, author of the heroine's journey.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

text:
용기내어주신 모든 분들께 진심으로 감사드립니다.
"침묵하던 당신의 마음 속 중립은 더 이상 통하지 않는다"
.
[스쿨미투 캠페인 참여방법]
1. #스쿨미투 #metoo 해시태그와 함께 자신의 연대문장을 올린다.
2. 인증사진을 찍는다.
3. 최소 3명 이상의 사람을 태그한다.
4. 태그 받은 사람들은 캠페인에 참여한다.
.
의미있는 캠페인에 참여할 수 있게 지목해주신 @kkeneon_01 님께 감사드립니다🙏
제가 지목할 분들은 @glisten._.22 @moon_rise88 @hyacinthus_study 입니다😀
.
#스쿨미투 #metoo #withyou #우리는연대한다

text:
spring is officially here in aotearoa & a great kick-start motivator for me to haul myself all the way back onto the wagon!

it's been a rocky few months, stress levels have been soaring as we work out a new balance for our life, and those with anxiety can relate with the intense struggle it is to function when you are at full mental capacity.  as you may know i am 100% a stress smacker so i've been using this month to hone in my eating habits. i may have mulched my way back up into the mid-80's over the past 2-3 months but i am just thankful that i realised before i was back at starting point, and am already reaping the benefits of mindful eating practices.

here's to ringing in the month with a good old fashioned outdoor adventure; the first of many in this great weather. i am hands down, committed!

text_retweet:
this is what the collective consciousness of #women is up against when we tell our truth. (read below)  and @john_wineland and his words are what healthy #masculine energy sounds like. he's describing what men can courageously do for women and for men, to make it right.

it's personal and it's universal. 
if good men want to support women because our freedom is bound up in each other's freedom, do this at home and set this up in the societal structures that govern us all. 
#repost @john_wineland
• • • • •
a woman’s no has not been honored throughout the centuries. remember, for 100,000 years, women were basically property.  when she stood up to contest her shackles or lack of sovereignty, she was often ostracized, beaten, ignored, raped, tortured and left for dead.

it still happens. this collective pain still lives in the feminine nervous system and psyche. so is it any wonder why women would have a hard time saying no or sharing hard truths to powerful men who wield control over their careers? or even their romantic partner sometimes? 
your value as a masculine partner is to feel what is unsaid and to help her express and own it. you will have to feel past her words and silence into her body and breath and heart. you will need to make it safe for her to say the things she is afraid to say. the withholds, judgements, resentments or just flat out rejections that might hurt your feelings. this is how we can as men, make it safe for women to share what is in their hearts. this is masculine leadership.

text:
first and foremost i want to thank all of you from the bottom of my heart for all the  love and support i have received after my post on thursday. the last couple of days have been incredibly humbling and overwhelming. i am so grateful for each and every one of you. thank you.

i feel the need to reiterate the reasons that i shared my story. it wasn't for me. i am ok. it has been a difficult journey over these past 24 years but with much love and support from you i have made it through. i am good now. i am one of the lucky ones.

i shared my story so we can all think a little more about the world we live in. i want us all to realize these things happen in the places we don't think they happen in. they happen to people we don't think they happen to. they are done by people we don't think do them. evil in this world is rarely black and white. it is usually quite grey. believe me, i've seen it first hand. #ibelieveher #metoo
name: Aaron Nix
tweet_full:
first and foremost i want to thank all of you from the bottom of my heart for all the  love and support i have received after my post on thursday. the last couple of days have been incredibly humbling and overwhelming. i am so grateful for each and every one of you. thank you.

i feel the need to reiterate the reasons that i shared my story. it wasn't for me. i am ok. it has been a difficult journey over these past 24 years but with much love and support from you i have made it through. i am good now. i am one of the lucky ones.

i shared my story so we can all think a little more about the world we live in. i want us all to realize these things happen in the places we do not think they happen in. they happen to people we do not think they happen to. they are done by people we do not think do them. evil in this world is rarely black and white. it is usually quite grey. believe me, i have seen it first hand. #ibelieveher #metoo

text_retweet:
thank you to my mentor and friend @the_angela_gallo for bringing birth trauma into the “believe women” conversation. so many mothers have shared their stories of birth trauma, abuse and assault. however, we not listening! we are not having the conversations! we are not believed!
.
as a mother who has suffered birth trauma and had interventions done without my consent, i can testify to the lasting physical and mental impact this left.
.
i believe you dr. ford and hope that by coming forward with your story it will pave the way for extending the #metoo and #ibelieveyou movement and conversation in the birth world.
.
#repost @the_angela_gallo
・・・
please tell me why the ‘believe women’ mentality doesn’t extend to those sharing their experiences of abuse, trauma and assault in birth?
.
why? why? why is maternal care still the place where we refuse to have the fucking conversation?
.
women deserve to feel safe! 
and all women deserve to be believed when they seek out that safety!!!!
.
#metoo #ibelieveyou
.
can we please extend the solidarity to those literally losing their dignity, mental health, general well being and lives during birth and mother/parenthood?
.
when are we going to stop protecting the system and the men (and women!) inside of it, cuckholding everyone they work with into a submissive cuckhold?
.
at what stage did we normalise birth trauma and obstetric abuse? so much so that the culture allows it, expects it, glorifies it in the name of ‘you’re lucky we saved you’.
.
how is that any different from abuse and assault at the hands of men who make us believe we are to blame, that we are lucky they’ve paid us any attention because we’re disgusting and unworthy, that we are lucky they didn’t kill us because we don’t deserve to live?
.
change birth culture.
change the world.
.
i will always believe you.

text:
you will not want to miss this event! have you purchased your tickets?? .
.
#metoo, now what?
the #metoo movement has rocked the entertainment, political, media and tech worlds. bringing the conversation about women’s rights to the forefront, #metoo has become a rallying cry that spans all walks of life. it's a conversation that has now shifted to...what’s next?
.
.
join us for a discussion about how to navigate the new rules of maintaining personal relationships in a professional setting in the post-#metoo landscape. our three panel members are: .
.
renee c. dominguez ms '16 (moderator)
founder and ceo, empowered leadhership
.
.
courtney simmons '05
senior eeo consultant at at&t
.
.
kristine stanley mbv '17
women vets on point, u.s. vets/usaf retiree
.
.
zelinda welch '08
energy manager, university of southern california
.
.
registration includes program, brunch with one drink ticket, and ample time for networking.
.
.
we look forward to seeing you—fight on!
.
.

text:
tonight i’m volunteering with @gilliansplace_sc to raise awareness about walk a mile in her shoes upcoming october 13th in niagara! @valduross and i are at the @ohlicedogs game with the #wamniagara ambassadors who took the ice in their heels 👠
.
the men’s march to end violence against women holds an important place in my heart. it brings me hope to see men in our community taking a stand to raise funds and awareness for the work gillian’s place does, and to talk about the impact of domestic violence and sexual assault globally and in our community.
.
this week was heavy. so many of us saw our own stories, our own traumas, played out like a movie reel in front of us. dr. christine blasey ford is beyond brave. i cannot think of an apt word to describe the monumental courage it takes to do what she is doing. and we are all with her.
.
a loving reminder, to myself and to you if this resonates:
.
if you need to disengage, disengage. you do not need to tweet, talk about it, or pen a perfectly-worded post. it is no measure of your worthiness, strength, or "goodness" as an activist, feminist, woman, or person to be able to keep up with the onslaught of news stories about what is so deeply personal to every single one of us. .
#believesurvivors #metoo

text:
i’m a day late but here’s my weekly blog as promised 🌸 ‘in light of the conversations infecting our on and offline lives as #billcosby & #kavanaugh make headlines and we continue to find reasons not to #muterkelly, i felt like this was an appropriate #throwback for the blog.

to my survivors out there, you deserve every good thing and the basic level of decency you have yet to receive from society is- at the very least- shared among us.

this is the first time i’ve declared #metoo or #believesurvivors since these particular men began to make waves (again), not because i don’t care or because i haven’t been paying attention- but because black women never receive the level of support, amplification, empathy or goodwill that we as a society show other demographics of women.

the conversation explored in this particular blog is an in house one.

but we would all do well to reflect on who has been shouting into the void to no avail, whose movements lose sight of their very creators when they go mainstream (shout out to @taranajaneen), whose names we hashtag, the names we forget and who we choose to publicly uplift in a world where we could educate ourselves at the push of a button and restructure our organizing and ‘allyship’ accordingly.

shout out to anita hill & kimberlè crenshaw.’ from the article: ‘i kept seeing the word ‘realistic’ used in reference to her comments. as if raising boys who are not rapists was some kind of unattainable goal and the best we could do is police the attire of our women and girls in the hopes young men can keep their composure.

in any scenario when a man of any age is given the option of blaming predatory behavior on nature and not his own lack of self control we are not being ‘realistic.’ we are making excuses. 
when we, as black women, suggest that male sexuality is stronger than male self control- and provide a narrative that suggests the onus of responsibility is on women not to be raped, instead of on men not to commit rape, we are failing an entire community. 
we are giving credence to a narrative that suggests our men are nothing more than violent, hyper sexual beasts here to literally rape and pillage.’ #linkinbio

text:
emdr round 1: today i had my first session to put me on the path of healing from ptsd due to sexual abuse. we started from the beginning when i was just a little girl. my dear doctor compassionately walked me from my happy/safe/calm place to that dark world and back again. she held my hand as we uncovered feelings and memories i have trapped in my mind. shit i haven't remembered or felt in years. i couldn't have done this alone. 
35 years later, i'm back at my root where it all went wrong.  difficult, you bet.. but it is long over due. although this adventure has just begun, and i have a hell of alot more work to do, i feel a little bit more at peace already. 
as a result: i decided with each session i would treat myself for having courage. flowers to remind me life is still beautiful and a small vine to nurture and watch grow, just like me.  #emdr
#realityofabuse, #metoo, #selflove, #babysteps, #dirttherapy

text:
margot and i came upon this statue in fairmount park in philadelphia today. the unnamed statue (i didn’t see a name anyway) features a woman holding a small child to her breast and watching over another child who lay at her feet. there is also what appears to be a dead animal laying in front of the woman, whose facial expression exudes strength and determination. 
i am sure recent political / national events influenced why this work of art spoke to me as it did. i have no idea if the current nominee for the vacant united states supreme court slot assaulted dr. ford, but i do know that dr. ford exhibited incredible strength last thursday when she testified in front of the senate judiciary committee. may we all recognize the power and strength and resilience of women in this country and throughout the world.

text:
day 278. your regular reminder today, witches, of the differences in perspective and bias afforded depending on an individual’s whiteness, maleness, richness, straightness, ableness, and/or fucking born-to-ruleness. in particular, consider:
- the calm, friendly, rational, intelligent, perfect responses required of a catherine marriott or christine blasey ford or emma husar in order to have the slightest chance of being believed and taken seriously, versus the outraged buffoonery routinely allowed of a barnaby joyce or brett kavanaugh or david leyonhjelm;
- the disparaging, racist, misogynist depictions and language used to describe a justifiably emotional and otherwise personally moral serena williams versus the desperate defences by the same people of the outrageous behaviour and background of brett kavanaugh (google what *devil’s triangle* really means as opposed to what kavanaugh has claimed, if you’ve the stomach for it); - the rwnj insistence that any non-white, non-straight, non-disabled non-male must be perfectly behaved and devoid of emotion, weakness or anger to maintain credibility, yet those standards are never applied to their own representatives; and
- the remaining, incontrovertible fact that the man in this pic (no matter how fucking despicable his current behaviour) will almost certainly have the unalienable right to make life-altering future decisions about the bodies of hundreds of millions of female, brown, disabled and lgbtiqa+ humans, unencumbered by empathy and utterly validated by the complete power vested in his country’s rule of law.

fuck. this. fucking. bullshit. 
#resist

#fuckpatriachy

#growupplanetearth #metoo

text:
you don't need a microphone or stage for others to hear your message, or to be seen or heard. your message doesn't come from the words from your mouth or the thoughts from your head, it comes from your actions in your love.  burn so bright others come to see the fire within side, shine so strong darkness can't help but come alive, and love so deep others get to feel free. 
your life is your message, how you live is your voice. your actions express your priorities. i didn't need a microphone and i still don't need one to get my message across because my ears do a lot more than my voice could ever do. talk less and listen more. 
thank you so much to @coachcarolynm founder of @bringitldn for the opportunity to speak in front of these incredible souls today. empowering youth, moms and caregivers, an incredible opportunity for me to connect, and continue to help raise the vibration of radical love. 
keep shinning your bright lights beautiful humans! keep going, keep getting up when life knocks you down and keep reaching out for help 💚  i believe in you and your resilience 😌 
love you hard ~ spiritual ninja

text:
i believe you. your rage is my rage. it happened to #metoo last year, i was sexually assaulted. (to spare yourself the graphic nature of this incident, i isolated it as a comment). is that the right word for my experience? i think we’re all still finding the right words for what we went through, our varietal of nonconsensuality, because we were (un)educated that rape is a spectral force, a looming shadow ensnaring you in a dark alley. it didn't hurt. i wasn't injured. i wasn’t afraid to leave my house. i wasn’t destroyed. it wasn't what friends and lovers endured, like the one raped while walking home from a party by a stranger with a stranglehold on her throat, so thereafter no one could touch her neck while she made love. driving home from the incident, i flashed through the primary colors of victim blaming, even if they were gendered inversions informed by latent toxic masculine ideas of assumed superiority: “how could you let yourself be overpowered?” "why didn't you just give her what she wanted?" even "what did you think would happen?" as if sex is the only sensual place where all roads meet.

i share this story at the risk of nothing - not the possibility of being fired, nor the impossibility of being hired. my credibility won’t be questioned or conflated with my behavior. outfit. upbringing. no one will coach me how to position my keys like brass knuckles. no one will threaten my family. that’s my privilege as a cis-male, ensured by a patriarchal structure i benefit from but never laid a brick in, so i share this as a privilege, not a duty, since i don’t believe it’s a victim’s duty of any trauma to air it, though i admire dr. ford’s civic conscience. we are entitled to our secrets, to the ugly u-turns in our private lives, and we don’t all have to be the hero she is.

but if you feel up to it, especially men, if you want to call your senator’s office, fruitful fbi investigation or not, and tell them what happened to you and why elevating a sexual bully to the supreme court would be catastrophic to our national psyche, then now’s the time, and i’m here for you. share this post if you want. boys will not be boys. boys have to aspire to more than that.

i believe you. your rage is my rage. it happened to #metoo last year, i was sexually assaulted. (to spare yourself the graphic nature of this incident, i isolated it as a comment). is that the right word for my experience? i think we’re all still finding the right words for what we went through, our varietal of nonconsensuality, because we were (un)educated that rape is a spectral force, a looming shadow ensnaring you in a dark alley. it didn't hurt. i wasn't injured. i wasn’t afraid to leave my house. i wasn’t destroyed. it wasn't what friends and lovers endured, like the one raped while walking home from a party by a stranger with a stranglehold on her throat, so thereafter no one could touch her neck while she made love. driving home from the incident, i flashed through the primary colors of victim blaming, even if they were gendered inversions informed by latent toxic masculine ideas of assumed superiority: “how could you let yourself be overpowered?” "why didn't you just give her what she wanted?" even "what did you think would happen?" as if sex is the only sensual place where all roads meet.

i share this story at the risk of nothing - not the possibility of being fired, nor the impossibility of being hired. my credibility won’t be questioned or conflated with my behavior. outfit. upbringing. no one will coach me how to position my keys like brass knuckles. no one will threaten my family. that’s my privilege as a cis-male, ensured by a patriarchal structure i benefit from but never laid a brick in, so i share this as a privilege, not a duty, since i don’t believe it’s a victim’s duty of any trauma to air it, though i admire dr. ford’s civic conscience. we are entitled to our secrets, to the ugly u-turns in our private lives, and we don’t all have to be the hero she is.

but if you feel up to it, especially men, if you want to call your senator’s office, fruitful fbi investigation or not, and tell them what happened to you and why elevating a sexual bully to the supreme court would be catastrophic to our national psyche, then now’s the time, and i’m here for you. share this post if you want. boys will not be boys. boys have to aspire to more than that.

text:
we won't back down. 
i have been raped. i was 18 years old, on my way home after a party. at the trial the offenders lawyers asked me what i was wearing or if i had been drunk. as if clothes or my choice of clothes or drinking had anything to do with what he did to me. he even tried to kill me. yet, i am still here. because i gave everything to win the fight that night.  but ever since then every day is a fight. and i still give everything.🤘🤘🤘 i am with christine blasey ford

text:
this gorgeousness by @realfunwow in #ojai, #california. the concept of the ‘evil eye’ (or, as my italian friend calls it, ‘the malocchio’) remains so compelling to me. according to her, the malocchio comes from purposeful things like curses and stuff but also from others looking at you with envy or...[drumroll please]...men looking at you with lust. this last part was so confusing to me: swedish-canadian, the idea that my own health could be affected by a man simply looking at me made no sense. i see now that it’s not about lust so much as it is about predation. from the looks i received from men even before i had my first period, to the men who engage exclusively with my selfies and never my perspectives. it’s not just me, it’s every woman. looked at as less of a person. it takes a toll.

text: thank you to dear friend liz berry schatzlein for this response to my mom susie sexton’s latest column: "this is a beautiful quote from a column by my friend, susie sexton: 'after living well into a seventh decade, if one is prohibited from telling it like it is or was, what then might be the point of ever having lived at all?' some quotes just jump out and grab you, and this one grabbed me. it is truth, no matter what decade you're in, no matter how old you are. if your voice is stifled, privately or publicly, what is the point of it all?" https://www.goodreads.com/author_blog_posts/17379428-latest-old-type-writer-intuition-and-instincts-and-bumble-bees-oh-my ... my mom observes, “kavanaugh was surreal from the moment he took his leather swivel seat and nervously arranged and arranged and scooted and arranged his nameplate and then proceeded into his melt-downish primal over-long scream? but he is not surprising ... rather, a template for the egotistical male we have all met and often know far too well!” #trump #kavanaugh #politics #feminism #republicans #democrats #metoo #cosby #supremecourt #hillaryclinton #brettkavanaugh @lizschatzlein

text:
as a survivor of sexual assault, molestation and harassment on more than one occasion, i could not agree with this more. i never pursued justice via the legal system, because our culture currently impedes the legal system. it took me years to tell my father, it will affect my future relationships and potentially the way i relate to my future children (if i choose to have them). we allow individuals accused of assault to hold our highest offices, work in our universities and within every branch of our military!

we turn a blind eye to the struggles faced by countless americans (and survivors worldwide regardless of citizenship); our friends and family, our neighbors, americans serving their country, our doctors, nurses, our teachers and our students. what are we, as americans, saying right now to the young people i’m educating? 
we need to fix this.
#believesurvivors #metoo #sexualassault #survivor #change #ibelieveher #trustwomen #bethechange #love #support #mentalhealth #dailylifeistriggering #triggeringnews

text:
i'll never forget the moment trump won. 
my eyes filled with tears as he started gloating and his wife's face turned sour and my dad sat quietly for a moment. then, he gets in my face and proceeds to bad mouth every woman politician that was against trump. he jumps up and yells and laughs like a maniac and he tells me that this was god's choice. when i ask him if it's okay to talk about women how trump talks about us, he blows it off. it's unimportant. 
he said the same exact words when i told him about how #metoo is about me..too. 
he doesn't understand why i'm upset when he makes fun of the women's march. he doesn't understand why i'm angry when he calls them names and says that they are ignorant. because he didn't know that i am them. 
my dad...who was so glad we're done with 'that black president'. my mother...who told me about her sexual assaults but refuses to acknowledge the behavior that causes it.

you taught me how to clean and how to be a slut in the most christian way. 
the hypocrisy. 
you taught me how to be quiet. how to stay 'humble'. but you should have taught me how to think for myself. how to tell the boys that no, i don't want it. how to tell my sisters that something happened. you needed to teach me how to speak up.  but more importantly you needed to teach me how to woman up. 
but all you taught me was how to shut up. 
you told me we didn't need feminism because 'we're already equal'. but you were wrong. 
the equal rights amendment.

y'all realize that since 1972 we have been trying to get this passed....we need at least 38 states to pass it....on may 30th, 2018, illinois became the 37th state to ratify it. it's been 46 years.

you told me that i know nothing about politics. well i know now. and you were wrong. 
my body, my life, my sisters- my choice. 
not yours. not yours, ever again.

#whenweallvote #believesurvivors #womanswave #stopkavanaugh #kavano #cancelkavanaugh #believechristine #believesurvivors #ibelieveher #feminism #feminist #4thwavefeminism
name: Brooke Charland

you taught me how to be quiet. how to stay 'humble'. but you should have taught me how to think for myself. how to tell the boys that no, i do not want it. how to tell my sisters that something happened. you needed to teach me how to speak up.  but more impoantly you needed to teach me how to woman up. 
but all you taught me was how to shut up. 
you told me we didn't need feminism because 'we're already equal'. but you were wrong. 
the equal rights amendment.

y'all realize that since 1972 we have been trying to get this passed....we need at least 38 states to pass it....on may 30th, 2018, illinois became the 37th state to ratify it. it is been 46 years.

you told me that i know nothing about politics. well i know now. and you were wrong. 
my body, my life, my sisters- my choice. 
not yours. not yours, ever again.

text:
i've finally decided to answer "the call !!" a vision of a womens ministry that i had last year has finally turned into a reality!! #girltalk is the newest addition to my ministry. it's not about music at all.. it's about encouraging women to be strong, powerful, self loving and god serving! •••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••• i have been planning and working my little tail off!! today was the day!!! with everything that's been going on in regards to womankind, i decided to honor a few amazing women that have lived through the worst but came out of it better! this was my first event, it was packed!!
•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••• what a celebration!! we laughed, we cried, we ate, we encouraged each other and we found our strength! we've been silent for too long.. it's time for us to use our voices!! •••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••• well, i guess i'll be adding "speaker" to my bio now... #girltalk #girltalklive #laticecrawfordministries #nopulpitsthough #yet #mystory #ourstory #metoo #timesup #superwoman #newventures #differentplatform #samegod #weekendgetaway #womensconference

text_retweet:
#believesurvivors
#repost @frizzkidart
・・・
today's affirmation art: all survivors are brave. all victims are brave. 💛 those who share their stories of surviving sexual violence/intimate partner violence are brave, but those who may not be able to share their stories or don't want to are also brave. no survivor/victim is cowardly and it's their choice what they want to do with their story. you may also wonder why i chose to include the word "victim." not everyone who experiences sexual violence or intimate partner violence feels like a "survivor." if we want to approach this issue in a "survivor-centric" way, then we can't impose the same strong, recovery, survival narrative on every person impacted by sexual violence/ipv. every survivor/victim is different, navigates their trauma differently, and has different perspectives on justice and healing looks like. in looking at the #metoo movement, i've seen a tendency to want to tell all stories the same way, without realizing that all survivors/victims have different intersections in their identity that a) impacts their likelihood to experience violence and b) changes the way experience justice and reconciliation with trauma. every survivor/victim is worthy of love, respect, and support. every survivor/victim is brave no matter how they choose to cope with their trauma. #art #artist #affirmation #illustration #drawing #draw #healing #heal #justice #metoo #feministart #endrapeculture #selflove #brave #torontoartist #feminist
.
[image description: light green background with a drawing of a brown hand holding a yellow rose with thorns on the stem. some of the thorns are cutting into the hand and there are tiny drops of blood. above the drawing are the words:
all survivors are brave
all victims are brave]
name: Trauma Informed LA

text:
today’s word: bravery

it’s hard to put into words the way my insides react when panic and fear take over. for those who have read my blog, more specifically ‘the final attack’, you may, just a little, understand. yesterday i tried to go for a solo walk, it was 7am, not busy, i almost had a full blown panic attack. i went as far as i could, not even as far as i wanted (just to the shops 400m away from the hotel). but, i promised myself i would try again. yesterday afternoon, i walked back to the shops. it was a little easier. then this morning, i decided to try again. it’s a little later so a little busier, then, i did it!! from the hotel to the three sisters bridge is around 1km. i walked there, sat there for around 15 mins soaking it up, trying to rest my heartbeat. then, a step further, i walked the extra 600m to the three sisters! i’m scared, i’m fearful, but also god damn bloody proud! as i write this i’m trying calm my heartbeat to be able to get back to the hotel. but, i did it! i pushed pass some of the fear, the panic. today, i feel brave!!! roundtrip= 4km
#believesurvivors #metoo #selfdevelopment #selfdiscovery #mypeakchallenge #journey #healing #selfhealing #ptsd #ptsdawareness #survivor #warrior #brave #bravery

text:
nyc and la!  i want to invite you to a free screening tomorrow morning.  it’s first come, first served. 
a message from all about nina director, eva vives: “when i wrote this movie i knew i wasn’t alone, but not much had been said publicly about the trauma and troubles that survivors go through. this week, despite the powerful #metoo movement, we continue to see the fight that women have to put up in order to be believed.

i am a survivor. i believe survivors. and i believe that having our voices and stories heard is important. i realize that a film might not be able to solve all the problems in the world but i also know that growing up, sitting in the dark watching stories unfold in front of me, i felt less afraid and more hopeful.

representation matters. i made this film for you.”
- eva vives

text:
so, i’ve been feeling pretty fired up this week about the politicization of these sexual assault cases. grouping one man’s guilt with another’s. bill cosby, someone i use to adore, went to jail rightfully so after 60+ women have accused him of being drugged and raped and was found guilty in a court of law. yet now, even those who believe that is justice, downplay that victory against sexual assault predators because others perceived to be a monster aren’t locked up yet. the memes abound. each case should be handled separately, investigated separately and judgements made separately. 
i say this because #metoo. this particular case this week has struck me bc though i’ve experienced sexual harassment and assault more than 1 time, the most impactful was when i was 15.  i’ve never ever talked about this publicly or even with some of my closest friends. when i 15, i was sexually assaulted by my 9th grade science teacher in a private christian school as witnessed by a friend. the reason i feel compelled to bring this up is because i have seen so many posts and articles blasting this accuser because she doesn’t remember all the details from when she was a 15 year old girl. i do not either. 
let me tell you what i do remember. i remember that it was spring. i remember what i was wearing. i remember the vulgar details about how he indecently touched me. i remember his breath in my ear. i remember look scared look of horror of my friends face who witnessed it. i remember the actual event in my mind vividly.  even though i told my husband about this incident when we were dating, i was so (unnecessarily) gripped with shame that it was a couple years into marriage before i could give specifics. 
what i do not remember is the exact date. i don’t remember if i had just turned 15 or if it was just before my 15th bday. i don’t remember much else outside of those few endless minutes. 
i told very few of my inner circle. 
a few months later, i received a call that this man had been arrested for far worse than what he did to me to a group of 11/12 year olds in his apartment complex. i received calls from classmates that i didn’t know even knew anything about it apologizing for

text:
— peace & place — from brazil to argentina to the united states to the world over — listen to women — via @stitching_for_the_masses —
"quisiera tener cosas dulces que escribir 
pero tengo que decidir y me decido por la rabia" (i would like to write sweet things, but i have to make a decision and i choose anger). the first line in guatemalan rapper rebeca lane's song "ni una menos" (not one less) sums up the anger that women across latin america have felt in regards to gender violence and impunity. this anger has led to the emergence of the ni una menos movement in argentina in 2015. 300.000 women (previously organized, but most importantly new to activism) marched in buenos aires demanding to end femicides, rape and other forms of gender violence. the movement soon resonated in other countries of the region like chile, perú, bolivia, ecuador, etc. where gender violence is also rampant. women across the continent are shouting an end to violence and the right to move and live freely, without fear. just to name some statistics: 1 in every 3 women older than 15 have suffered some form of sexual violence (un data), around 12 women are murdered every day because of gender violence in the continent (cepal & amnesty international data)...we have to stand up against sexist culture that dehumanizes and treats women as objects! we say ni una menos! .
.
.
.
.
.
.
#niunamenos #somosmanada #smashsexism #endgenderviolence #stopgenderviolence #vivasnosqueremos #metoo #sexism #socialist  #feminism #socialism #feminismo #machismo #sexismo #rebecalane #yositecreo #noesno #nomeansno
#handembroidery #stitch #stitching #embroidery #bordado #bordar. #bordadoamano #embroideryhoop #hoopart #hoop

text:
may all beings be free from suffering!
no exceptions.
if someone has harmed me, it is my job to not compound the suffering, but to practice equanimity.
cultivating compassion does not preclude having good personal boundaries that are firm.

text: it feels like a long time already since being in the mists of avalon and feeling and breathing in the land. i was lucky to find myself there when there was a heat wave in massachusetts. and with pluto going direct tomorrow it’s like another heat wave but of a different assortment. we have been in pluto retrograde for the past five months looking in the dark, peering into it, wondering what is real and true and what is truly power and what is powerlessness. and with pluto going direct the #metoo is getting a second wave. the heat is on. we have taken our time gathering the shreds of truth in the underworld which pluto rules, and we are exposing the threads one by one again. pluto’s truths are not pretty often on the surface but they are transformative. i was lucky enough to be in avalon a few weeks ago, which is both known as the land of apples and the land of the dead. seems an odd combination of feminine archetypal visions and pluto- has the fallen apple myth finally come back to haunt us enough to realize women were actually the keepers of the wisdom? with pluto going direct i choose to believe in her this time. hang in there everyone! let the truths be exposed. pluto direct will help it be so. #pluto #avalon #metoo #plutodirect #astroworld
name: Grace Harrington Murdoch

text: i posted this to my stories earlier, but i wanted to do it here too. i’m not trying to get too political on here, just wanted to state some facts. too many women have suffered. too many men have gotten away with it. can some of them repent, change their ways, and try for a lifetime to rectify their mistakes? yes. but kavanaugh is not one of them.  kavanaugh has made it clear he’s not repenting. he’s lying, he’s cheating, he’s doing whatever he can to rule over all of us. and i for one don’t think someone who’s acting like that deserves to shape the lives of millions of americans for years to come. #stopkavanaugh #believesurvivors

text:
real vulnerable moment and i think it's needed after this week in media...
...
in high school (03/04) i had a class where the teacher was inappropriate towards me. he would hug me, put his arm around me, comment on my clothing, rub my shoulders, etc. attention i didn't see him giving to any other students... and caused me to ditch the class as much as possible and come late to sneak into class and avoid contact...
...
one day he made a comment about me and my high school boyfriend in a beyond inappropriate fashion. that lead me to go talk to my school counselor...
...
what happened? i ended up being dropped from the class and had to ta for the nurse the rest of the semester!! i learned in this moment i wasn't believed! that they took the word of an older man over the one who was placed in a very uncomfortable position. a couple years later this same teacher assaulted another student, which could have been prevented if they listened to me! ...
i've had additional things happen to me (more violent and aggressive than above) that i've never reported as i learned early on i wouldn't be taken for my word. i'm encouraged by so many women coming forward today and reporting! i'm proud of the strides and know there is still so much work to do!
#metoo #believewomen #ibelievedrford #thankyoudrford

text:
“justice will not be served until those who are uneffected are as outraged as those who are.”
.
i love this benjamin franklin quote, it asks us to stand together. it asks us to be empathetic, to walk in someone else’s shoes and imagine what they’ve been going through. it asks us to be courageous and brave, to take on another’s discomfort and to rally.
.
this quote applies to so much right now. it applies to the epidemic of rape culture, where “boys will be boys” has gotten so many off the hook and left so many survivors to deal with their trauma alone. it applies to civil rights, where “i don’t see color” negates the fact that racism is institutionalized and even monetized in this country. it applies to gay rights, where “wrong” is a word used to describe someone else’s life and being. it applies to so much more... and i ask you. who can you stand with? look around you. who in your family, your circle of friends, your community, your country could use your support right now? because, while they have been fighting this fight without you, it’s better to stand together.
.
#believesurvivors #blacklivesmatter #loveislove #wecanchangetheworld

text: watching and processing as our government exemplifies how little they care about survivors of assault and their trauma is painful, triggering, and infuriating, but today felt a little more hopeful than yesterday. i am proud of the friends and acquaintances of mine who have shared their stories, and i am proud of those who have chosen not to. ❤️believe, stand with, and protect all survivors- women, femmes, trans and non binary individuals, men. ✊🏻✊🏼✊🏽✊🏾✊🏿 from a recent nyt article: “what seems an afterthought is that for millions of women, and men, who have endured this sort of violence, the toll is life-altering, even life-derailing, from the moment it happens. it’s trauma that doesn’t have a term limit.” (maya salam) remember to vote so we can start to someday change this culture of shaming victims and siding with abusers, and instead foster a culture in which justice is served because survivors are not afraid to face a corrupt system, and politicians will believe them. #marchtoendrapeculture #metoo

text:
por que #elenão? 
porque queremos que a violência deixe de determinar a experiência do que é ser uma mulher. porque queremos que a violência abandone nossos ossos.

porque não queremos um presidente que diga: “não vou estuprar você porque você é muito feia”. porque não queremos um presidente que diga que seus filhos não namoram mulheres negras porque foram “muito bem educados”. porque não queremos um presidente que defenda que as mulheres devem ganhar menos porque engravidam. porque não queremos um presidente que prefere que o filho morra num acidente de trânsito do que seja homossexual. porque não queremos um presidente que diga que os negros dos quilombos não servem nem para “procriador”. porque não queremos um presidente que defenda a tortura.

por que #elenão? 
porque não queremos que as mulheres sigam sendo vítimas. e votar nele é apertar a tecla de vítima mais uma vez.

porque ser mulher é também ser um corpo insurrecto. é ser um corpo que luta contra a opressão há milênios. mesmo com o risco de ser destruído pelo fogo dos inquisidores.
porque ser mulher é ter como passado grandes mulheres que lutaram pela liberdade e nos trouxeram até aqui fazendo do nosso corpo rebelião.

porque ser mulher hoje é ter feito a marcha das vadias, é ter gritado nosso corpo, nossas regras nas ruas, é seguir afirmando #mariellepresente. é ter feito #primeiroassedio. é ser #metoo. ser mulher é dizer que luto é verbo.

lutaremos. 
porque essa longa noite precisa terminar. e somos nós que precisamos barrar a violência colocando nossos corpos nas ruas. nós, unidas com os homens que também inventam um corpo que não se constitui pelo ato de violentar. corpos desejantes que se unem na luta também para recuperar a possibilidade de estar juntos sem violência.
o brasil tem que parar de construir ruínas, o brasil não pode mais ser um corpo em ruínas.

é com corpos que se recusam a ser determinados pelo ato de ser violentada ou pelo ato de violentar que podemos criar um outro jeito de ser e de estar nesse mundo.

por que #elenão?

porque #nóssim.

#épelavidadasmulheres

text:
went to my first domestice violence awareness rally to kick off dv awareness month in october! loved being able to stop in and chat with women who are there to help and also to hear how i can help those who have been, or are in the shoes i once wore before! i was even able to make my own little pins to wear! 💜.
.
if anyone is in any situation where they don’t feel safe, please do not be afraid to reach out to someone and ask for help! my inbox is always open as a place of encouragement, safety, and love! praying for those souls who never got to make it out, and for those who still feel stuck - it will get better. you’re stronger than you think! 💜.
.
#stopdomesticviolence #domesticviolenceawareness #metoo 💜

text:
circus life hack: this week has been hard, y'all. so fair warning, this is going to be a longer and more sombre #circuslifehacks post.

more and more these days, i am recognising and feeling the extent of inequity that persists in society. more and more, i find myself depressed, enraged, anxious, powerless, wanting change, and wondering how we can speed up the creation of a better world. i feel keenly the pervasive current of pain running through the world, and some days, it debilitates me. watching dr. christine blasey ford and so many others come forward this week with their stories of #metoo and #whyididntreport made me so upset i felt physically sick. 
so this is not the first time i've said or posted something along these lines, nor will it be the last, but... when you're getting depressed from the craziness and injustice in the world, and trying to find some way to manage the rage you feel at how women (and other minority groups) are treated, find some mastery over your descent into the deep doldrums by experiencing a different form of descent. a descent that you choose; one that is controlled. channel your rage into a series of stacked drops instead. 
the multiple changes of direction in this series suggested by @gabehildenreid during training this week echoes how i've been feeling lately with all that is going on in the world: emotionally whiplashed. (no, i don't actually get whiplash from doing this.) even though i had to pause and slow down the final drop in this sequence because i was cutting it too close to the ground to connect the entire series powerfully and seamlessly, being able to physically express my internal processes in an echo of movement helped me to feel better. even if only for a short moment.

#resist #believesurvivors #feminist #activist #copingmechanism #copingskills #circussavedmylife #circusismylife #circuseverydamnday #circusgirl #geekgirlintheair #aerialist #aerialistsofig #aerialsilks #aerialsilksdrops #acrobat #falling #courage #mastery
.
.🎪 sponsored by @alexander_aerial_acrobatics @aerialsilkvienna @nicetomeetme .
.
.🎠 hosted by @paperdollmilitia @sandraaerialist @sophie_skywalk @aerialena @agilethingss

text: i've been thinking about the #whyididntreport i had previously passed on the #metoo because it felt uncomfortable for me but i didn't report because i was young. i didn't report because i was in love. i didn't report because i didn't think i mattered. but i do. you do. every human being does.

text: this is why we march! savanna lafontaine-greywind was murdered by brooke crews and william hoehn. while crews will spend the rest of her life in prison, hoehn was acquitted for her murder. instead he will served no more than 20 years for kidnapping and providing false information to authorities in their investigation of savanna’s death. we also march for women like that alaskan native woman who was assaulted by justin schneider. after spending a year on house arrest, he was given a two-year sentence, with one year suspended. having already spent a year in home confinement, he stepped out of the courtroom with no more time to serve. anchorage assistant district attorney andrew grannik said, “but i would like the gentleman to be on notice that that is his one pass.” this is from the seattle women’s march last january. #metoo
name: Adam Sings In The Timber

text:
before and after shaving off the rest of my hair. sexual assault murders a part of you. i hoped cutting off all my hair would make me less approachable and less traditionally attractive. i hoped i’d receive less violating looks from men, that i’d be followed less, that i’d be catcalled less. that hasn’t really proven to be the case. i tried. 
but i’m still reclaiming my body one small step at a time. i’m feeling more free than i was before. here i am celebrating my healing and my power. 
#metoo #ibelieveher

text: shonda rhimes is an american screenwriter and television producer best known for her hit tv series scandal, grey’s anatomy, and how to get away with murder. hugely successful, scandal has often been credited as a catalyst in changing the broadcast landscape to include more diverse casts, while also unapologetically bringing depictions of controversial political issues to television’s prime time viewers. beyond her influential work on the small screen, shonda is an avid feminist. just yesterday, she gave the keynote address at the girls build summit in los angeles, a gathering of 10,000+ high school-aged women. she has been an early and integral member of time’s up and the #metoo movement and has contributed her thoughts on feminism to major publications like elle magazine. if that wasn’t enough already, rhimes signed a multimillion dollar contract with netflix in 2017 to continue to create original content that will no doubt be just as poignant as all that came before. tbh, what can’t shonda rhimes do?!
