text:
angie deboer and alexa luther, both 2021
.
jl two south and mather 2
.
are you guys new?
alexa: i’m a new 10th grader
angie: i’m a new 10th grader, too!
same! #welllastyearbutlikesamething where are you guys from?
alexa: i was born and raised in wyoming but i live in minnesota now.
angie: i live in chicago, illinois.
cool- very different places, how do you guys know each other?
both: *break out into laughter* we literally just met last night over domino’s pizza!
ohmygosh that is literally the best way to meet someone! #literally alexa, is this your hammock?
al: yes
do a lot of people do this where you’re from?
al: yes, it’s called ‘mocking’– like hammocking, so they’ll string a bunch of hammocks on top of each other in a park and it’s like this huuge thing. you’ll drive by parks on the weekends and just see all these hammocks.
woah, i think everyone should do that here! angie, are there any cool things like this where you’re from?
an: no, not really. but this is really cool! #agreed #letsstartamockingclub
so what are you guys doing right now? *thinks to myself: wow izzy you literally can see what they’re doing #obviously #they’re #mocking! but goes through with the question and hopes for a good answer*
al: we’re just waiting for the sports to start *laughs* #yay #futurecheerleaders
nice, do y’all have any homework yet?
both: *laughs* yeahhhh we probably ~should~ be doing that hahaha #dw #metoo
.
so has there been an instance this week where someone has been really nice to you? #gratitude
both: yeah!
an: i’m grateful for like lots of little things that people have done– like i was carrying cookies in the dhall and my sweater snagged on something so i dropped all the cookies but someone helped me and that was really sweet. i was walking in the rain and someone put their umbrella over me which was really nice.
al: last night, actually, someone said something very mean to me #thatsjustwrong #notokay #notamodelstudent but then a bunch of people just came and were very nice– which i think made up for that. everyone on my hall is super sweet. #mathertwo #theplacetobe #208 #heytalbot

text:
⬇ #whyididntreport ⬇
.
because i did report, after getting my face smashed by a 60 year old man that wouldn't stop grabbing my ass, furious when i asked of him to stop multiple times, to respect women, to respect himself, and have some restraint, in both english and tongan so he was sure to understand.
.
because after getting pulled away, he proceeded to threaten to kill me in front of countless teenagers that looked up to him, as head of the rugby league, as they laughed and hollered and cheered him on.
.
i knew his daughter, she was my age.
.
because i did report, and at the station, the police in tonga told me to leave, wouldn't take a statement, or listen to a word i said.
.
because when i went back with a medical report detailing blunt force trauma to the head and face, and a severe concussion, they tried to shush me, they didn't want to hear a word.
.
because it took the owner of the bar, a man of course, filing a report as well for the chief to take any consideration or action. listen to a woman? not a chance.
.
because i went to court multipleee times and the judge didn't show up or postponed the date each time, while the man so clearly paid off the judiciary system, making sure it wouldn't go to trial.
.
because after months of trying to get it to be heard, they tried to offer me money to close the case.
.
because this was not even the worst of what i experienced in that country, it was simply the breaking point.
.
and this was with countless witnesses.
sexual harrassment, assault, and death threats, and still nothing was done.
.
after all, women's rights in tonga are virtually non-existent.
.
#whyididntreportagain
.
so how are we to feel safe enough to speak up when most times, violation happens behind closed doors? with no witnesses, no one to back you up in a system that runs on keeping women suppressed and in silence?
.
⬇continued in comments⬇

text:
• i was too young to know that anything was actually wrong with what was happening. i was taken advantage of by a family friend, who was in his older years of being a teenager when i still hadn’t hit double digits yet, who nobody knew we shouldn’t actually trust. i was told by him that if i told my parents, i’d get in trouble, and he would get in big trouble, and i didn’t want to make anyone upset. so i kept it to myself for years, even when i realized what had happened to me, only telling a few close friends in middle school, and feeling so so so ashamed of myself. because i still thought it was my fault. in seventh grade, i saw that he was now a registered sex offender, that i wasn’t the only victim or the only one he’d hurt. i didn’t end up telling my parents until a few years ago, and by then, nothing could be done. it had been too long. he tried to contact me via facebook when i was around 12, trying to apologize, and i was so terrified that i deleted my entire facebook account. for a few years, he lived down the road from me with his girlfriend and i would see him walk by my house, only to have a panic attack and end up sobbing in my closet. to this day, i am terrified. to this day, i still have to remind myself that it wasn’t my fault, and most of the time i’m not all that convincing. it’s something i deal with every day of my life. it’s still something that keeps me up at night. i still wonder why this happened to me.
i guess now i feel a little less alone, and every day im a little less terrified.
#whyididntreport #metoo

text:
i stand in solidarity with women, who have been attacked by men, with sexual violence, abuse and inequality.

join us and contact you're legislature and let them know that you won't tolerate the degradation of our values. put the pressure on them. speak up. be heard. lower the axe on those that would not do their jobs. if they won't protect our women ...vote them out.

you can do this by calling 202-224-3121. this number will direct you to the capitol switchboard. when you call, ask to be connected to your senator or representative. the operator will direct your call to their office. a legislative assistant will answer the phone and take your info. don't waste time. get straight to the point.

here's a script you can use. "hello, my name is jane smith. i'm a constituent from ......., zip code ......... i don't need a response. i am opposed to ....... and i strongly encourage the senator to please oppose ........ thank you for your hard work!" #stopkavanaugh #ibelieveher #nov6

random portraits of strong cats that support women's rights from the man on the ethereal edge, oklahoma.

this is her journey. don't look down. don't fall off. much love, enlightenment and peace to you. ♡ૐ☮

commands your heart beat. ⠀
in the rhythm of your essence,⠀
in the darkness of your shadow,⠀
in the brightness of your light. ⠀
⠀
your are divine⠀
⠀
in your unanswered questions,⠀

⠀

goddess.⠀
⠀
rise.⠀
⠀

text:
food for thought before australia gets stuck into another grand final day! 🏉 🍺 😉

in my work it’s important that i hold awareness of my own privileges. i’ve got gainful employment and i get to do a job i enjoy. my body, skin colour and sexuality fit the (apparently “acceptable”) social norm. i can listen, learn and let those who aren’t afforded those privileges speak up; particularly in the body positivity space.

we can all do something to create equality. i think this week’s events in the us tell us that it’s really bloody important! 
what privileges do you have and what can you do personally to change things?

swipe for comments from #jacksonkatz , #eveensler and @mattmcgorry 👌

.
it's up to the rest of us now. ~62k are using #stopkavanaugh on ig, up from only ~19k one week ago. but is this really all on ig who are advocating in some way against his nomination?! .
.
please... speak... up... make calls to your senators on monday (and key senators flake, murkowski, manchin, collins, heitkamp) and say no artificial time limit on the fbi investigation!  please take action! #now  we need to keep the pressure up! 🔥🔥🔥 .

.

text:
i didn’t ever report. 
i was 15 he was 35.
i was 18 he was pretending to be a police officer. 
who do you tell? how many scenarios can i think up in my head where this comes out in my favor? how many people will question the validity? will i be asked what i was doing to bring it on myself? will people judge me? think i’m dirty? unwanted? easy? is there something wrong with me? what happens after i tell? do i relive this over and over while everyone asks me questions? am i sure it was rape?  oh my god, what if they gave me something? what if i’m pregnant? how do i explain this? 
just keep it to yourself. it’ll go away. out of sight out of mind. 
little do you know that bottling these things makes life worse. every relationship moving forward is skewed. every movie or book with sexual assault or a man being overly physical rocks you to your core. you have deep dark thoughts and can’t seem to escape them. but it’s been too long to tell anyone now. they surely won’t care or do anything now. what will it fix?

the guilt.
the pain.
the anger.
the sadness.
the suffering.
the confusion.
the depression. 
the silence is deafening. it is debilitating. so i’m done with it. i’m over holding these things inside me. i am not at fault. i am not broken or unwanted. i am beautiful and i will heal. maybe one day i will believe those words. but saying them out loud helps. 🖤
#metoo #believewomen

text: if someone is a good man, he does not argue, does not humiliate people and is generally nice, helpful and so on, but he has a hard time because the fate so wanted, family not necessarily good poverty or loneliness, i think sooner or later that someone it will bounce off, the fate will turn and it will be good. such karma a bit. today i asked myself a question. can a loser meet happiness? not always a "loser" is the worse time. sometimes life goes uphill and instead of climbing, you have to wait avalanche. apparently it can always be better. and as you can not do it yourself, you have to deal with it. at the beginning i write about someone who simply does not affect their lives, but still tries. then a loser appears. for me, there is a gap between the first and the second person. it seems to me that, above all, working on yourself should bring "something". to the top of each of us, far away, but how much each of us has behind us. karma is karma, but life eagerly kicks people who are nice to others. for example, what if they say that i am a cool man, helpful, etc., if it does not come back to me? it is true that i learned not to expect anything in return and it gives me some satisfaction, but it would be nice to get something from life. i am in the process of a general reconstruction of my life and maybe this is something i can give, but i know that some things have already been lost because of what has happened so far and is still happening. i think you are wearing scars after bad times, but it is not said definitively that one day you can not live with them normally. in total, maybe everyone can. my grandma always repeats to me that happiness is so often that we do not see it too often, we do not appreciate it too often. and apparently we can always create them. always. #ptsd #deppression #anxiety #therapy #mentalhealth #psychology #mentalillness #helpme #metoo #help #support #fight

text:
consent is ongoing. consent to sex does not mean consent to everything. you set your boundaries, if they are not respected - this is assault. 
it took me a long time to learn as a young teenager in a sexual relationship that i had a choice,  i was convinced by him that i was not fulfilling my duties as a girlfriend if i did not do the things he wanted.  i was taught and convinced my worth came from my role as "girlfriend", and was made to feel worthless by being called names and/or being treated like i didn't exist if i didn't do the things he wanted. 
performing sexual acts you aren't comfortable with, is not consent. if the person coerces you, this is not consent. 
#consentisnotcoercion #consentissimple #consentneedstobeongoing #checkin #assault #rape #rapeculture #goodgirlfriend #boundaries #feminism #metoo
name: The Mouthy Feminist

text:
this little heart of mine has been through the ringer & back. but i’m strong. and like dr. ford, i am a fiercely independent person and i am no ones pawn. this breaks my heart but fuels my passion to stand up for what i believe to be right. i believe that a heart is much more valuable than any amount of money. if the choice comes down between the two, i will chose the heart every time. hearts will bend and shift and take the worst of the beatings, but they always regrow a little stronger. the scars hurt, and sometimes never go away, but i’ll be damned if i allow myself to be silenced in times when my heart is screaming.
all week my social media feeds have been filled with women who have survived sexual assault. as a child. as an adult. in their home. in their place of work. in situations where they thought they were safe. in situations where they thought they could trust those around them. this happens everywhere. no one is exempt. woman. child. man.
it’s tough to admit when you have been wrong, but that’s the first step to correcting your wrong. stand up. speak up. you are strong ✊🏻✊🏽✊🏿
_
beautiful heart explosion by @rachelmariephoto
_
#heartopener #love #yoga #standup #metoo #thefutureisfemale #feminist #yourestrong #youreenough #youalwayshavebeen #speakup #selflove #sisterlove #womenempowerment #womensupportingwomen

text_retweet:
a major reason why women do not come forward about sexual assualt is because it reopens a very sensitive wound that never truly heals and women are often revictimized. i am not saying we should immediately ruin a man's life because every human should be innocent until proven guilty. though, if a women comes forward and puts her self in a vulnerable state, we should listen openly and not immediately jump to the conclusion she is lying. the state of culture really needs an overhaul of how we treat each other. no matter your sex, color of your skin, religion you practice, or whom you love, we all deserve to be heard.
.
.
.
.
#metoo #listen #bekind #repost @ilizas

text:
as a mother of a son, i promise to teach him about consent. i promise to teach him about respect for all people, but specifically women. i promise to teach him the power of the word “no” but also the importance of the word “yes”. i promise to educate myself about the best ways to educate my child and to always surround him with the highest quality role models. •
•
in the wake of larry nasser, bill cosby, harvey weinstein, matt lauer, kevin spacey, (it’s sickening how long the list goes on) and most recently brett kavanaugh, i’m continuously hearing comments about what we need to be teaching women. it’s true that in society today, we’ve had to resort to teaching women how to act to stay safe but i’m not so quick to accept this norm. the root of the problem is what we are teaching, or rather not teaching young men. •
•
i’m calling for a paradigm shift. let’s stop blaming women, even with small backwards remarks about what they need to be doing, and start taking each and every incidence of sexual assault seriously, holding men accountable for their actions, and raising young men to live by a higher standard. •
•
•
•
#metoo #rapeculture #consent #teachconsent #teachconsentearly #parenting #educateyourself #knowledgeispower #motherhood #uniteinmotherhood #motherhoodlens #babyboy #kidsofinstagram #kidsofig #babiesofinstagram #babiesofig #son #men #youngmen #momtribe

text:
there has been a lot of white supremacist internalized misogyny and white supremacist “feminism” throughout the course of the kavanaugh confirmation hearings.
.
white supremacist internalized misogyny is what i’ve been calling white women’s desire to maintain their racial superiority and power by supporting white male supremacy which includes the incredibly toxic, oppressive cisheteropatriarchy and misogyny inherent in white male supremacy.
.
those white women who are standing for the abusive & oppressive kavanaugh are unleashing internalized misogyny on us all. they are also the same white women who voted in support of another rapist, donald trump at 53%. the same white women who crushed the equal rights amendment. they constantly undermine women’s rights in order to be “good partners” to the white male in his project of supremacy.
.
on the other hand, you have the white women who reject their own oppression under white male supremacy but fail to acknowledge or outright attack & dismiss other vulnerable populations.
.
they recognize the sexism they face as white women. they consistently fail to note the specific cisheteropatriarchal oppression different intersections such as race, incarceration, lgb, gender non conforming (tgnc, nb, two spirit indigenous, hijra indian, etc), & disability create. (thank you kimberlé crenshaw)
.
the me too movement has ignored these groups despite being created by tarana burke, a black woman. the people seen as “leaders” of the me too movement are overwhelmingly these white supremacists. the divisions between women’s lived experience, oppression, & vulnerability exist but white women call raising these issues “divisive” to feminism.
.
so where the hell are the white women who do not support white male supremacy? where are the white women who do not support white supremacist “feminism?” where are the white women calling these women – the majority – out? well few & far between & all of us still have more work to do to unpack our internalized bullshit & be better. we have to talk about these issues more than we talk about ourselves and our issues.
.
we must do better.
.
[id in comments]
name: Meghan Pruitt-Steele
tweet_full:
there has been a lot of white supremacist internalized misogyny and white supremacist “feminism” throughout the course of the kavanaugh confirmation hearings.
.
white supremacist internalized misogyny is what i’ve been calling white women’s desire to maintain their racial superiority and power by supporting white male supremacy which includes the incredibly toxic, oppressive cisheteropatriarchy and misogyny inherent in white male supremacy.
.
those white women who are standing for the abusive & oppressive kavanaugh are unleashing internalized misogyny on us all. they are also the same white women who voted in support of another rapist, donald trump at 53%. the same white women who crushed the equal rights amendment. they constantly undermine women’s rights in order to be “good partners” to the white male in his project of supremacy.
.
on the other hand, you have the white women who reject their own oppression under white male supremacy but fail to acknowledge or outright attack & dismiss other vulnerable populations.
.
they recognize the sexism they face as white women. they consistently fail to note the specific cisheteropatriarchal oppression different intersections such as race, incarceration, lgb, gender non conforming (tgnc, nb, two spirit indigenous, hijra indian, etc), & disability create. (thank you kimberlé crenshaw)
.
the me too movement has ignored these groups despite being created by tarana burke, a black woman. the people seen as “leaders” of the me too movement are overwhelmingly these white supremacists. the divisions between women’s lived experience, oppression, & vulnerability exist but white women call raising these issues “divisive” to feminism.
.
so where the hell are the white women who do not support white male supremacy? where are the white women who do not support white supremacist “feminism?” where are the white women calling these women – the majority – out? well few & far between & all of us still have more work to do to unpack our internalized bullshit & be better. we have to talk about these issues more than we talk about ourselves and our issues.
.
we must do better.
.
[id in comments]

text:
last night our family went to the @mariners game. it was fan appreciation night, a tradition of our family’s each year.⠀
⠀
i want to share something with you that i said to someone on twitter yesterday; she was feeling real beat up by how clear it is that the traumatization of assault victims means nothing to those who benefit from the misogynist patriarchal system as it is.⠀
⠀
“i hear you and i agree. but also they have awakened a fucking warrior in me. at this point i’d gladly send every fucking gop senator on a spaceship headed straight for the fucking sun. i will fight those fuckers until i take my last breath—fuck this system.”⠀
⠀
here’s the thing—i meant it. we will crush the patriarchy. we will refuse to settle for inequality⠀
⠀
part of that includes living our lives fully. to have fun. to live our love out loud.⠀
⠀
and, for those of us who want it, to have children & teach them the truth. my husband & i have honest conversations about these things now, at the tender ages of 7 & 5, about the same things i say to you. ⠀
⠀
we adjust for age, obviously, but they don’t have the luxury of waiting. many of us have stories of sexual assault before age 10; additionally some children have become those who assault by that young age.⠀
⠀
to the parents: we cannot wait. let our black peers lead us on this. they cannot put off “the talk” with their babies about how to act around police officers. not when young boys playing in the front yard are seen as dangerous threats & accosted by those meant to protect them, where one wrong move results in death but the boy is completely innocent & so scared that he soils himself.⠀
⠀
they cannot wait. neither can we.⠀
⠀
this is part of how we #crushthepatriarchy. we raise children wide awake so that they don’t become those keeping it in place.⠀
⠀
one last thing: i know pro sports represent the patriarchy to so many. i also know they can be a part of the change. the mariners have a “women in sports” event & i think are truly leading the way in refusing to treat women as brainless eye candy. props to @angiementink & @talksportytome for leading the way here. 💪🏼
name: 🔥Freedom After Trauma🔥

text:
psa🎉:practice what you preach. it was an emotional and difficult week for me for a few reasons and today veered off course, but allowed me to dance and sing to the greatest showman soundtrack while i made pancakes and 🍳 eggs for the munchkins, get a workout in (so grateful for my bonus room!), stop in at the nail shop, have a sit down conversation with my mom (which as many of you know can go downhill quickly, but didn’t), snag a bike 🚲 ride with ollie 🐕in the basket and i’m going to take a 🛀🏾! self-care folks! it feels self-indulgent and you sometimes feel guilty. don’t! 
i have a smile and laugh throughout my day and it is genuine!!!! i find joy! but pain is there too and i choose to focus on my kids, god, my career (which i am passionate about💪🏽) and my dogs.  it keeps me going. i also have fantastic friends. stay strong if you are going through a rough patch and treat😉 yo self when needed. #metoo #liveyourpassion #selfcare yoga pants, nike gear, siesta key😍hat and bun day. #justdoit #nike #mixedgirl #ootd #falldecor #womensrightsarehumanrights

text:
i am a survivor.
•
he was drunk. 
it was his 30th birthday. 
we had been dating for 2.5 years.
i told him no. stop. time after time. i just wanted to sleep. yet he continued to climb on top of me, continued to pin my hands down over my head. hard. continued to hold me down and use his weight on me. i was prisoner is my own damn bed.
i fought against him. using all of my strength to validate my own worth. i finally pushed him off of me. only to me slapped off the bed, banging my head on the floor.
no apology. no words of endearment, or care at all. instead, words no humans should ever hear spoken about them, ever.
•
i ran out of my house, for no longer did it feel like a home. i called the police. for this was the only way i survived this life. i hid outside behind a tree in a neighbor’s yard, my feet freezing from the dew in the grass. never have i felt so scared, so much adrenaline pumping through my veins. i was shaking uncontrollably, fearful to have anyone touch me or console me. he was arrested. and i was flooded with the gates of relief. because i was finally free.
•
this is how i survived. i believe you, sweet love. your experiences, feelings, healing + trauma - it is so valid 💓💫 and you are never ever alone. #metoo #believesurvivors

text:
i wrote this for my husband in the past on facebook, but it got me thinking about the recent conversations i had with some moms. so mommajusers, remember, you deserve the best. you deserve support in breastfeeding and pregnancy and  everything... don't settle. life is too short! 
#partnersupportofbreastfeeding
#strongmoms #knowyourworth #metoo

somehow with all of life's challenges with the good and the bad, we seem to make it as a team. sometimes... a mildly dysfunctional team, but a team.... we put up with each other's wierd isms and manage to find the humor in it... someday when all the chaos, the poop, the messes, and the stress of having to be in charge of it fades, we will be able to say we did it together. we loved together, we failed together, and we learned together. i will never feel like i truly deserved you walking into my life, but i do know how fortunate i am. happy anniversary daddy piggy!

text:
🦁 this fierce warrior right here 🦁 
this man has honored and protected me for more than 20 years. so much so that when we’ve been out at public events i’ve been asked if i’m famous and he’s my bodyguard!
😂 #truestory 
there are days (and weeks, and months) when we get on each other’s last nerve. but you know what? no one is perfect, we’re all perfectly humanly flawed.
i’ll never forget that when sandelle was being born he never left my side for one second. to go to the rest room, get water, nothing. when she was born six hours later i looked at him and realized he still had his winter coat, scarf, hat and boots on. and i’m actually crying now, writing this. 😭

he’ll forget about the major hallmark events a lot of the time, but then randomly show up with the most unexpected gift on a wednesday night, just because.
❤️
if you knew the harrowing conversations this man has been through with me because yes, #metoo and i’m not talking any more about that part other than to say that this past week (and all the other weeks for 20+) years where something has triggered a trauma, he’s there. he takes my pain seriously, he checks in to make sure i’m ok. he keeps himself updated on the latest developments so that he can talk to me about solutions, good things people are doing and things that will make me laugh instead of staying stuck in that place.
and: he’s growing a beard because i love it so much and he has to give me my #blackbeardedmen fix!
😬
most of all, he has taught me that i need to love myself because he already loves me. richard, cheers to you my love, thank you for being one of the #goodones and living a fiercely loving life. and for pausing in your hard work today to pose for a picture for me. you actually are my hero.

#hero #myguy #fierce #warrior

text:
women deserve to be heard. women deserve to be believed. women deserve to be taken seriously.
•
these last few days have been nothing more than our government displaying its usual fragile misogyny, patriarchy, and white male privilege. it’s time to stop turning a blind eye to it all. 1/3 women worldwide will experience sexual trauma. about 73% of sexual assaults/abuse are made by someone the victim knows. the prevalence of false reporting is only 2-10%, while about 2/3 sexual assaults go unreported.
•
we are in the midst of allowing a man to serve on the highest court of our land who not only doesn’t exemplify the composure and professionalism to do so, but has 3 sexual assault allegations against him. call your senators. vote. do something. #stopkavanaugh #metoo #cancelkavanaugh #ibelievedrford & thx to @siennaludka for the sweater 💁🏾‍♀️

text:
events of a massive scale are taking place in our world as we have watched the dealings in the politics and courts of the us, and have prompted much conversation- both the divisive and the supportive. 
ready or not, there is a reckoning that has begun.

we cannot stay silent anymore, dear souls.  are you seeing it?  are you hearing it? are you ready to be a part of it?

the world needs your voice.  we need you to add your story, your thoughts, and your healing power to the reckoning.  we need to be ready to have the hard conversations without hate, dismissiveness, or pure defensiveness on the ends of our tongues.

it’s time to change the paradigm of being silent, of minimizing ourselves and our sisters.  for punishing them or ourselves by shunning and shaming when the only choice for survival was to be quiet.  it’s time to be a collective of “no more”, and to rise up and say, ‘let’s talk, let’s choose to be and act differently’. i am so deeply grateful to have been given the tools to break my own chains of silence, and rebuild my own life.  those same tools can be used by anyone.

i am so grateful to our thought leaders and to so many of our fellow humans from all segments, education, genres, and areas around the globe who are leading the way. 
they are speaking above their fears by telling their story and giving us the tools that can be used for change.  change in our own lives, and change for others lives. 
why does this this conversation matter and why does it matter now? 
it is because, those old habits and contrivances that kept us safe before are no longer going to work. it is because healing needs to take place.  it is because this is a world-wide conversation about human value. #metoo #speakup #justyouwait #braveenough #timesup #daregreatly #risingstrong #togetherwestand #humanity #beautifullife

me after researching the #drford case⛓⚖️☄️never forget that justice is a woman.

text:
“how do people find the courage to declare their personal truth in the public arena, knowing that when they do, they are likely to be punished in ways that range from ridicule to marginalization to the loss of their livelihoods? the answer, i think, is that these people have reframed the logic of punishment in a way that liberates the soul. they have realized that no punishment anyone could lay on them could possibly be as bad as the punishment they lay on themselves by conspiring in their own diminishment, in the denial of their own integrity. with that realization, the power of the human heart is liberated in a way that, properly disciplined and deployed, has the potential to change the world. this is the story of every great moment for social change.” ~parker j. palmer

#courage
#metoo #ibelievesurvivors #speak #daretobereal #thevulnerabilitychallenge

text: 🌞47 trips around the sun 🌞 this is me raw and unfiltered embracing my age and the wisdom that has come through years of journeying. i am old under the constraints of the patriarchy but young in my crone phase. as a woman i have lived through my years as a maiden, welcomed the years of mother, and own the power of being crone. black and white or in color my face is a map that marks the seasons of my life and all the emotions that have come with it🙌🏻happy birthday to me✨

text: reporting abuse is possibly the hardest thing to do as a trauma survivor. whether the abuse is fresh or years old, it seemingly never gets easier to talk about with people like police and other government officials. when i was 15, i remembered my father’s abuse that happened when i was just 3 years old. that’s another thing- the mind is an amazing machine, it can repress bad memories at will. i didn’t even remember the abuse took place until i was in my high school history class and had to get up and leave because i started having flashbacks. the next few weeks were a whirlwind. my mother took my sister and i (he had also abused her) to a sain interview at our local precinct where we had to sit and be recorded as they asked us grueling and invasive questions about the abuse. then when they decided they had enough evidence, my father was arrested. for the next two years, i had to go to court and write statement after statement against him. seeing him in person was the hardest part of court. i was so nauseated and angry i just glared at the back of his head. after two years of litigation and deciding not to go to trial so my sister wouldn’t be put on the stand and further traumatized (she was only 11), the court let my father make a plea bargain and two counts of indecent assault and battery on a minor under the age of 14 somehow got reduced to two counts of assault and battery, and we each got permanent restraining orders. what pisses me off about this whole ordeal is that even though i went through due process and did everything i was supposed to do to be a good “victim”, my father still doesn’t have to register as a sex offender. i don’t want this to dissuade anyone from reporting. that was in 2006, before sexual abuse was taken seriously and before millions of women started coming forward with their stories. it is extremely hard to face your abuser in court, but no matter the outcome, the important thing to remember is that you did the right thing.

text:
wow. 17 years ago. i sit here alone. crying as i post this. but free and unashamed. seeing the strong women in media tell their stories have inspired me to share mine. i grew up in a normal childhood and was taught that my body was my own. but that does not mean the men or boys who commit abhorrent sexual harassment or assault have the same perception. or grew up with tenets of mutual respect. you are the “lesser”. they see you as an object. conquest. dare. trophy. i remember being cornered in the edge of the pool for a brief second. their hands. their eyes and then their voices as they cursed me when i said “stop!” and “get away!” when i, a girl, knew it was wrong and they, men felt entitled and permitted. why report? it was a flash of harassment, that only was a brief moment in time. a inappropriate touch that escalated from the daily “catcalls” i endured at my teenage workplace that summer. it was so common place. and this was the worse of it. no harm. no foul, right?
.
wrong. 
i remember the pain and shame of feeling wrong when i was anything but that. i knew it was their fault but that didn’t change the fact i felt isolated, depressed and empty. but looking back at my years and migratory intrepid paths in dealing with the opposite sex i have gained insight, strength and wisdom. i wish i could tell my 17 year old self that times will change for the better...because they are! 
women are not putting up with this harassment as normalcy any longer. girls will not allow unchecked repugnant verbiage and inappropriate behavior. we. us. sisters unite in solidarity with our men who do support our bodies as our own with mutual respect and space. we won’t tolerate anyone in government who thinks or acts above the law with unbridled provocation over another person. the years of unchecked entitlement and abuse is ending. we are watching. we are strong. we will vote. ✊🏼🇺🇸
.
#timesup #metoo #novemberiscoming  #fudt #sistersinarms❤️ #stopkavanaugh #womensmarch #stopsexualharassment #fearless #standupforwomen #ibelievechristineblaseyford #ibelieveher #ibelievesurvivors #believewomen #rapeculture

text:
💞 turning ig black & white for #suicideawarenesssaturday with @in.ecstatic.motion & @sultryabyss 💕
.
👉 trigger warning (but the time is now):
- a few weeks ago a male friend asked if i would report a sexual assault to the police.
- his question was theoretical.
- he didn't know my answer was not.
- "no."
.
👉 he looked at me as if i was the problem.
- i understand where he was coming from... to a degree, i have been complicit in not speaking up.
- only, when i did speak up - for alas there was more than one occassion - i got disbelief... sidelined, ridiculed, humiliated, shamed & silenced in various ways.
.
👉 that shit got pushed down & churned inside me for years until another incident triggered a total breakdown when i was 22 yrs old. i thought everything would be better for everyone if i wasn't here anymore. i wanted to die.
.
👉 luckily, 'what everyone would think of me' afterwards (my social flaw saved my life 😂) stopped me. i reached out instead and finally found an ear to listen. that validation changed everything. if you have no one to talk to,  message me. i will listen 🙏 and then we'll find someone who can help you do whatever you need to do next to heal 💕
.
👉 seeing so many accounts with the-same-but-different stories... it's fucking heartbreaking.
this isn't a rarity, it's the norm in our society. ask your female friends, your mothers, sisters & daughters.
and then let's change it.
.
👉 first we have to understand. i don't care about naming and shaming individuals, i care about opening up a real conversation - safe space for all - to discuss the inherent rape culture in our society:
"women, make sure you're sexy but if you like sex, you're a slut."
"men, if she says yes, she's a slut and if she says no, see it as a challenge."
do you see it?
un-fucking-acceptable.
this is our culture. if you can't see it, you're not looking #endrapeculture
.
💞 and to that compassionate ear, i give my eternal gratitude - thank you 😊🙏💕
.
#yoga #yogaoffthemat #forwardfold #endthesilence #mentalhealthawareness #triggers #survivors #timesup #yourenotalone #metoo #imcomplicit #blackandwhite #believesurvivors #depression #anxiety #marbella #estepona
#andalusia

text:
yoga medicine all day everyday, especially today. although this week has been hella productive and positive for us personally, we can’t help but feel some deep pain for the situations happening in the world’s 🗺 eye 👁.
.
so today, we take the time to wring out our organs & our mind from the murky waters of the past. we find strength in the gifts & love given, & shown to us daily. we gather our courageous hearts in unity cleansed, free from the traumas of our past..
.

.

.

.

text_retweet:
❤️ this so much. if you don’t understand why it takes so much courage, healing & strength to speak up about traumatic events then please show some compassion, don’t degrade or try to make someone’s pain a laughing matter. practice empathy & some active listening skills without becoming defensive or making it about you. connections are built through understanding.
...
#repost @alex_elle
・・・
i wrote this a while ago to my younger self, but it seems fitting to re-share given the news this week. i didn’t speak up until i was 28 (earlier this year), and even then i couldn’t bring myself to disclose the entirety of the trauma, the hurt, the details. the women speaking up and speaking out deserve praise + camaraderie. and the women who have not yet found the words, deserve the same. we must rally around one another, be each other’s wings, lift each other up. it is essential that we be each other’s light, warmth, refuge, and raging courage. we will rise 10x over. standing with survivors. standing with people who’ve been victimized. standing together.
.
.
.
#ibelieveher #believesurvivors #nomore #speakup #compassion #empathy #understanding #healing #culture #society #lovingboys #stronggirls #smartgirls #womenempoweringwomen #bethelight #standstrong #wordsofwisdom #realbeauty #hope #liveauthentic #community #nurture #strength #bethechange #metoo #whyididntreport

text:
a cup of soothing tea & a safe place for those who need it... for so many the last few weeks have been triggering with reminders of experiences many of us worked hard to heal from. rising above it is never easy especially if you try to go it alone. please know that there are people out there that love you, believe you & will be there to listen or just sit & share a moment of peace. ☕️💕
.
.
.
.

text:
i've been wanting to make a post, but i've been having a hard time finding the right words. and that's just it. there are no 'right words'.
.
there are no words that will ever make this ok. there are no words that will undo what has been done to so many women, women identifying, and lgbtq people.
.
this issue is not a political one. it's not even just a women's and gender issue. it's a human issue. it's an issue that hits close to home for me and so many other women i love and women who have trusted me with their stories. sexual violence is never ok.
.
we have to do better. to all the women in my feed that are sharing their stories, and even to the ones who aren't but share a similar experience, you are so strong. you are inspiring. you are not alone.

text:
these past couple of days have been pretty rough. i am not one to complain about my past, i always just look forward, work hard and try to use my past for some kind of positive inner strength. i don’t feel sorry myself, don’t want anyone to feel sorry for me, my past has made me who i am today. a warrior, a survivor. for those out there who question why would someone would wait 30 years to discuss a sexual assault, well because you are terrified, scared death, ashamed and so traumatized. 
those who question dr. ford, i say “look at my face” in these photos. sexual abuse started in my life as sweet little 6-7 year old, no i don’t remember the dates, but i do explicitly remember the multiple occasions that the male babysitter would shove his fingers inside my little girl vagina, while sitting on my pink rug in my bedroom while i would look at the bunk beds (hoping it would all be over soon), all while being threatened that i would be killed if i told anyone. but you know, it is really just his word against mine and how could anyone trust such a young girls recollection. why didn’t i tell anyone??? because i was scared to death and afraid no one would believe me. 
the second photo is me in high school, during which i went through years of repeated sexual molestation at the hands of my older brother. did i tell anyone? yes, two friends in high school, we called a sex abuse hotline, without giving our names, but i never told my parents. i was scared to death of the devil living in my own house. i didn’t tell anyone until i was in my 20’s and then still kept it pretty much under wraps. 
fortunately i have grown stronger in life and my past is not a secret to most who know me. but i am still haunted everyday and having to listen to and read people saying they don’t believe dr.ford has been so painful. i truly hope your daughters or sons never have to experience such pain. and yes behavior of a 17 year old should absolutely be considered for someone wanting to sit as a judge on the highest court in land. 
ps - this is my truth. 
#believesurvivors #christineblaseyford #strongertogether #metoo

text:
this month marked two years since my last sexual assault by a man who exploited my disability and spent a year raping me in my drug induced sleep, stalking, and torturing me. it’s important i emphasize my disability here because i’m one of thousands of disabled womxn, gnc people, & men who have been made more vulnerable to assault by being disabled in this society. disabled women are ten times more likely to be assaulted. only 17% have not been assaulted.
.
this month also marked two years since i was assaulted by a friend i had come to for help in the aftermath. two years since i had been pushed into a psychotic break by hospital staff and police gaslighting and assaulting me. two years since i was locked in a “behavioral health center” in which my disabilities & assaults weren’t believed or treated and a friend was molested. two years since i had to have a pelvic exam after already experiencing a rape kit to check for damage from being raped on my birthday.
.
this month is personally momentous for me and last month on this year anniversary i was completely torn up and triggered. this year represents a radical change in me and it’s evident in how i managed to have an amazing, healing month and birthday rather than the sobbing non stop heart wrenching ones of the past two years.
.
this year i’ve begun to trust again. begun to reach out & really build a community. this year i’m focusing on a fresh start in a new non triggering home with refreshed goals. this year when the words of those who hurt me echoed in my head i knew in my heart it wasn’t my fault and i should not be ashamed.
.
healing doesn’t end & it’s not linear. i’ll probably have more bad times ahead. but i am healing and thriving. it’s taken everything i’ve had for well beyond two years of my life but i’m healing.
.
will, trey, bobby do not own my body, or own me. joe, lucia, javier, and nick did not forever break my ability to trust. david, paul, and countless other men will not have power over me. i’m healing and i’m going to help others heal and fix this fucked ableist white supremacist cisheteropatriarchy so there won’t be so many survivors.
.
[id in comments]
#metoo #sexualassault #timesup

text: “this one time, a man came in with his son. when i came to help them find what they were looking for, the father then smiled at me in a suggestive way and asked if i could help them with underwear. the father (in front of his teenaged son, who looked uncomfortable the whole time) began asking me about myself. in between he would comment on my hair, on my smile, how pretty i was. i was a retail worker and the customer is always right, even when they make you uncomfortable. finally he turned to his son and he said “that’s it, there’s that blush. a beautiful woman blushing is what men love” in this disturbing, sexual voice.” — katrina, 20 #nodickpics #timesup #metoo #endsexualharassment #nomeansno #instaactivist #nofilter #instaxphoto #feminist #wontstayquiet #wontbeavictim #iamasurvivor #iamasurvivornotavictim #breakthesilence #endsexualassault #endsexualabuse #sexualassault #sexualharassment #staywoke #activist

text: every 98 seconds an american is sexually assaulted, according to rape, abuse, incest national network (#rainn www.rainn.org). as a survivor of rape as a young girl and repeated child sexual abuse, i know first hand the shame and silence and the pain, some of which never goes away. i struggle with what's left of my self-esteem and fear of intimacy that's been the casualty of this war i never asked to be a part of. i know exactly how some memories burn in your brain, regardless of the number of years that have passed. i can remember like yesterday his hand over my mouth, and his fist above my face, even after 35+ years. all i have to do is close my eyes. i'm appalled and saddened by what i witnessed this week. how do i know my attacker? i can't forget. he said, after he crawled off of me, that's what you get for being a tease. i was 13 years old. i didn't even know what that meant. something like that happens every 98 seconds. i'm frightened for all the girls watching this who will think twice about coming forward when/if it happens to them...every 98 seconds. i'm sad for and identity with the women who have no reason to think their statements will ever be taken seriously.  as if it wasn't already hard to be taken seriously. i am also pissed off! mostly, about the blatent disregard of a credible testimony that, at the very least, should point to a thorough fbi investigation. if he is indeed innocent, why does be hide? if the republicans who so believe in him are so sure, why wouldn't they welcome a thorough investigation? if he is guilty, this rapist will have a life-long power in our justice system, the ultimate power, really, over the rights of the very bodies he so willingly violated. i have been silent for a long time about my experiences. no more. this is a war and i am a #warrior. #metoo #justice #ibelieveher #believevictims #believesurvivors #believewomen #christineblaseyford  #ibelievedrchristineblaseyford #thismeanswarmotherfuckers #drchristinblaseyford
name: AM Delk

text:
judith slaying holofernes by artemisia gentileschi, (c. 1614–1620), oil on canvas. 
artemisia gentileschi was an extraordinarily talented baroque painter (just look at that light) and is truly one of my favorite artists in all of art history. 
one of my favorite paintings of all time is her painting of judith slaying holofernes, which i’ve been thinking even more about recently with the recent news from capitol hill. artemisia painted herself as judith. the face of holofernes is the face of her rapist, agostino tassi, her former mentor, who was tried and convicted of her rape. i don’t even feel that i need to elaborate more about why this piece is so incredibly powerful. it has been speaking for itself for 400 years. i’ll let it do just that. 
i highly recommend looking up a large, high quality image of this painting and really taking the time to take in every detailed facial expression and every drop of blood. really sit with it for a while. there is so much to gain by observing this piece in great detail. we are all artemisia’s judith.

text: it was the vice president of a huge bank and that asshole still works there!!!! this was a job that had started as a temp job and within days, my desk was moved and then within a month, i was promoted! however the reason i was given a promotion was not because of my work!  i was moved so this asshole could stare at me and call me into his office 15 times a day then by “accident” grabbed my ass!  he then decided to move me to the fraud dept and then take a guess who is my direct boss now!!! it got worse!  i would get 50 emails a day from him! saying that he liked the way i looked in my dress! that my ass looked good today, and that my skirts are a little too short so if i don’t want him looking then cover up!  it got worse!  he then decided i was going to run and staff the company picnic and that meant i had to be in his office a lot!!!! when the picnic was over, i had to clean up and my husband had jordan so he took her back home and stupid me said , my boss can bring me home!  well that was a bad idea! he kept trying to stick his hands up my skirt over and over!  he then says, if you tell anyone this then i will lie!  we finally get to my apt and i wanted out! he then lunges at me and tried to pin me down! i slapped and kicked him then ran to my house! ran to the bathroom and locked myself in , then just cried!  the trauma was so bad that i miscarried the baby that i had no idea i was having.  i actually was let go the next monday!  my position was “eliminated”. he got away with it and i have no doubt that he is still doing this crap!  they fire the girl and move to the next!  i have never told this story!!! it’s time!!!! #whyididnotreport #metoo

text: #survivorsupporttip: when dealing with challenging situations, or not dealing with anything problematic at all, many #survivors are triggered when touched. it is a result of the trauma they’ve suffered as a result of sexual violence. think of it as if a soldier were to hear a loud bang and react as if s/he were back in the middle of battle. that’s what #survivors experience. however, this does not mean #survivors are strange, broken or frigid. they are like wounded sparrows; strong, beautiful, guarded and in the process of healing. you must proceed with care. just like you need to alter the way you would approach a wounded sparrow with its beautiful essence still in tact, approach #survivors with the same kind of loving care. ask the person if it is alright to give her or him a hug and say you completely understand if the person doesn’t want to be touched. let these magnificently beautiful souls know that you’ll sit next to them and just be present because you want to be there. then, listen for their response... and abide by their wishes! unless they’re going to harm themselves (immediately call 911 in that case), do what they ask which could be to sit there or leave. the goal is to be supportive in the way that the #survivor desires. #divaqueenprofapproved #metoo #metoomvmt #timesup #dontmess #believesurvivors
name: DrKim

text:
august 2013 i think... an older photo of my best friend, partner, and my inspiration. i think it's important to always remind ourselves of what we truly have, and never forget how much a person matters. so thankful to be able to listen and talk with my lovely lady everyday.

everyone should feel safe and be able to have a voice and an audience to listen.

take care.

#metoo

text:
this has been a hard week. for everyone, and especially for survivors of sexual assault and violence. today i left my newsroom, with a heavy heart thinking of all the things i wrote and all the stories people told. i decided to walk through midtown instead of getting right on the train, which i never do, and stumbled on this men’s group singing “you will be found.” i started crying right in the middle of the street. somehow, it was just what i needed to hear. i too have experienced what #christineblaseyford and so many other women have experienced. when a 17-year-old boy from the catholic boys’ school down the street tried to kiss me several times, i said “no” several times. so he picked me up off the couch, put me on the ground on my back, and pinned me under his hands and knees. at 16, i had no idea what it was he was doing, but i was confused and afraid. this week has brought that day right back to the front of my mind, but with a full and very real understanding of what he was doing. my heart has been heavy and listening to these men sing this song reminded me there are a lot of people broken on the ground right now. but i hope that they will be found and that they will rise again. i hope we will listen to these stories being told and we will all be better.
#metoo #youwillbefound #ibelievesurvivors #love #dearevanhansen #newyork #nyc #timessquare

text:
رومن پولانسکی فیلمساز سرشناس و جنجالی قرار است فیلم جدیدش را درباره مردی که می‌کوشد شهرت و حیثیتش را بازگرداند، کارگردانی کند. آنچه اغلب رسانه‌ها درباره این خبر برجسته کرده‌اند آن است که این نخستین فیلم پولانسکی بعد از آغاز جنبش #metoo و تلاش برای منزوی کردن و مجازات مردان متهم به آزار جنسی است.

پولانسکی سال‌هاست که به اتهام تجاوز جنسی از آمریکا فراری است و حتی چند سال پیش در سوییس دستگیر شد تا به آمریکا بازگردانده شود، اما نهایتا آزاد شد.

به گزارش هالیوود ریپورتر، او می‌خواهد فیلم «من متهم می‌کنم» را درباره زندگی واقعی سروان آلفرد دریفوس بسازد؛ یک سرباز فرانسوی یهودی که به جاسوسی برای آلمان متهم شد و محاکمه‌اش در سال‌های آخر قرن نوزدهم در پاریس به نقل محافل تبدیل شده بود.

ژان دوژاردن بازیگر فرانسوی برنده اسکار که با فیلم «آرتیست» مشهور شد، در فیلم پولانسکی نقش افسر اداره ضدجاسوسی فرانسه را بازی خواهد کرد که بعد از محکوم شدن دریفوس توانست ثابت کند او بی‌گناه است.

نام انگلیسی فیلم «رابطه دریفوس» اعلام شده و کمپانی فرانسوی لجند فیلمز آن را تهیه می‌کند. عنوان «من متهم می‌کنم» از اثر مشهور امیل زولا نویسنده فرانسوی گرفته شده است.

ایندیپندنت نوشته علاقه رومن پولانسکی به این داستان به شکل واضح شخصی است، چون شهرت او به عنوان فیلمساز زیر سایه اتهام تجاوز به یک دختر ۱۳ ساله در سال ۱۹۷۷ قرار گرفت و همواره زیر سوال بوده است. او در همه این سال‌ها کوشیده فیلم بسازد و برای «پیانیست» هم جایزه اسکار گرفت.

چند ماه پیش و بعد از ظهور جنبش مقابله با آزار جنسی در هالیوود، آکادمی اسکار عضویت پولانسکی را لغو کرد و او در واکنش تهدید کرد که درباره این اقدام پیگیری قانونی خواهد کرد.

stop_filter_tweet: رومن پولانسکی فیلمساز سرشناس و جنجالی قرار است فیلم جدیدش را درباره مردی که می‌کوشد شهرت و حیثیتش را بازگرداند، کارگردانی کند . آنچه اغلب رسانه‌ها درباره این خبر برجسته کرده‌اند آن است که این نخستین فیلم پولانسکی بعد از آغاز جنبش تلاش برای منزوی کردن و مجازات مردان متهم به آزار جنسی است . پولانسکی سال‌هاست که به اتهام تجاوز جنسی از آمریکا فراری است و حتی چند سال پیش در سوییس دستگیر شد تا به آمریکا بازگردانده شود، اما نهایتا آزاد شد . به گزارش هالیوود ریپورتر، او می‌خواهد فیلم « من متهم می‌کنم » را درباره زندگی واقعی سروان آلفرد دریفوس بسازد؛ یک سرباز فرانسوی یهودی که به جاسوسی برای آلمان متهم شد و محاکمه‌اش در سال‌های آخر قرن نوزدهم در پاریس به نقل محافل تبدیل شده بود . ژان دوژاردن بازیگر فرانسوی برنده اسکار که با فیلم « آرتیست » مشهور شد، در فیلم پولانسکی نقش افسر اداره ضدجاسوسی فرانسه را بازی خواهد کرد که بعد از محکوم شدن دریفوس توانست ثابت کند او بی‌گناه است . نام انگلیسی فیلم « رابطه دریفوس » اعلام شده و کمپانی فرانسوی لجند فیلمز آن را تهیه می‌کند . عنوان « من متهم می‌کنم » از اثر مشهور امیل زولا نویسنده فرانسوی گرفته شده است . ایندیپندنت نوشته علاقه رومن پولانسکی به این داستان به شکل واضح شخصی است، چون شهرت او به عنوان فیلمساز زیر سایه اتهام تجاوز به یک دختر ۱۳ ساله در سال ۱۹۷۷ قرار گرفت و همواره زیر سوال بوده است . او در همه این سال‌ها کوشیده فیلم بسازد و برای « پیانیست » هم جایزه اسکار گرفت . چند ماه پیش و بعد از ظهور جنبش مقابله با آزار جنسی در هالیوود، آکادمی اسکار عضویت پولانسکی را لغو کرد و او در واکنش تهدید کرد که درباره این اقدام پیگیری قانونی خواهد کرد .

text:
a short break from clay to say this...
this is me... in my dirty old converse, my favorite bell-bottom orange courderoys (spelling?), and one of my many t-shirts. so what? you say. 
for so long now i’ve struggled between conforming to the standard of what a 30 something mom, wife, woman, entrepreneur, should look like, dress like, and who i really am.
today, when i slipped into these comfortable, nostalgic lovingly worn clothes, i felt so good, so authentic, so me!  and i finally realized, i don’t care what anyone else thinks about it. i feel good, and that’s all that matters!
women as a whole need to move away from trying to please anyone other than themselves. whether that means finding your voice, to stand up for yourself in an uncomfortable situation or simply by doing whatever makes you happy without concern for how others will view you. times are a changing, we are here to serve yes, we are here to serve ourselves!
#metoo #authenticself #findingmyself #converse #bellbottoms #freetobeme

text: the relevance of this project has grown stronger in unexpected ways. this piece was rendered by my buddy dion long for my book open jar (still pending release because technology has been a dick to me). it turned into my ma thesis performance about the individual and social impact of sexual violence. so hello, #metoo and #fuckingkavanaugh, hello #pastpresentfuture #womenwhosavetheworld. hello to the asshole who threw tater tots at my car yesterday because my sex is mine to own. how do you stand on your soapbox and scream, "you're doing it fucking wrong! this is my boundary." brave ladies, stand strong against toxicity. we are destroyers, creators, givers of life and mirrors of love. "hey! i've got something i really really need to say!"

text: this is important. men, you cannot be passive in these matters. we must band together or this will continue. it is not enough to sympathize with us. we need your voice too. for all the times you kept quiet when one of your friends did something you knew wasn’t right. for all the times you  pushed something you knew someone else didn’t want. i could almost guarantee most men have experienced something in their lives they aren’t proud of or wish they could forget. now is your time to step up and join us. #ibelieveher #feminist #equality #imwithher #endrapeculture #rapepublicans #stopkavanaugh #trump #trumpsamerikkka #men #womensupportwomen #endviolence #chauvinism #misogyny #metoo #metoomovement

text: it’s been a tough week. that’s an understatement. it’s been a real motherf@&ker. the truth is, we are living in a “civilized” nation where rapists go on trial; not to determine whether or not they’ll go to prison but to determine whether or not they will be appointed to the supreme court and hold what is supposed to be an honorable position. based in strong morals and values and ethics. how did you cope this week? maybe you cried. maybe you watched the news nonstop. maybe you avoided it all. because the truth is we’re all doing what we have to do to cope. another truth is you don’t have to be a sexual assault survivor to be triggered by what’s going on in the news right now. if you need support reach out. call a friend, call your mom, or call @rainn ‘s national sexual assault hotline @ 1-800-656-4673

text:
this week has been really difficult. interspersed with writing my very first feature for a mainstream publication, i religiously monitored the progress of dr. ford’s incredibly brave testimony and the kavanaugh nomination overall. i came to grips only recently about my own sexual assault in my 20s – not the only #metoo moment in my life incidentally (so many of us have more than one) – and the events of this week kept taking me to a place i don’t enjoy reliving. but then i noticed something really cool happen: i got fucking pissed.
*
i turned 44 yesterday, and while i don’t make too big a deal about my birthday anymore, i’m learning as i age that my tolerance for bullshit is gone. for me to reveal something like this over social media is not comfortable at all for me - mainly because i know loved ones are hearing about this for the first time - but we need to talk about this stuff because it is rampant and needs to stop. i support survivors, i believe survivors, i am a survivor, and now i’m an angry gen x female voter. *
📸: thank you @sheilz capturing my badassery in this shot 😍 *
#ibelieveher #believesurvivors #believewomen #trymatriarchy #stopkavanaugh

text: so. this has been a long, awful week for many of us. and many have been asking how we can help raise up the next generation to do better. how do we teach consent from the earliest ages? it’s not as hard as it seems- and i know. this shit can feel overwhelming and big and exhausting. but it doesn’t have to be. allowing your child to say no to a hug or a kiss- even from grandparents or you- is huge. letting them know that they have a right to say no. noora knows she doesn’t have to give anyone a hug or a kiss or even a high five. my students have to verbally greet me at the door in the morning- but if they don’t want to shake my hand, that’s fine. and now- to make it even easier there is this lovely, accessible board book for even the smallest of children. written by @egm620 and illustrated by @fayeorlove - @cisforconsent is the perfect starting point for parents and educators who just don’t know how to begin this. so- everyone. go buy it. we have spent this week collectively exposing our traumas and pain and reliving our pasts in the hopes of educating adults on what this is like. let’s look to the children now. ❤️

text:
you can always find a glimmer of beauty in really messy things. 🔮
.
.
.
i’m lucky to be where i am in my healing journey. i’ve only named it as abuse within the past couple of years. i was afraid and ashamed for a long time. it’s very difficult, but i hope that they’re trying to heal, too. my heart can’t be heavy and angry forever. resentment was a poison that was hurting me more than it was hurting them. .
.
.
i want to give all other survivors a big hug today and the next day and the next day. healing is hard. but it is easier knowing you aren’t alone and that there is light on the other side. #whyididntreport #metoo #believesurvivors

.
.
i want to give all other survivors a big hug today and the next day and the next day. healing is hard. but it is easier knowing you aren’t alone and that there is light on the other side.

text:
this week was really tough, triggers were around every corner. i have never fully come forward with my truth, but i am a rape survivor.  i listened to coworkers and people i thought i could trust defend brett kavanaugh. i felt like i was being ripped apart and left exposed for all to see, reliving my personal nightmare over and over. i have never really come forward, and i’m not sure that i ever will, not fully. my personal journey is my own. but i stand with survivors, i stand with survivors that come forward right away, i stand with the survivors who come forward 20 years later, i stand with survivors that don’t come forward at all. i believe you, each and everyone of you. i believe you.
#metoo 
#ibelieveher
#istandwithsurvivors

text: what a weird week. i spend my days teaching my girls they can do and be anything they want. that they’re strong and their voices are powerful. that the world takes them just as seriously as it takes boys. then i watch the news and scroll through my facebook feed in secret and see that not all of that is true. the feelings and wants of men are constantly weighted as more important than those of women. how do you reconcile that? i guess all we can do is keep feeding them the stories of women and girls who have made a difference and make sure they watch us work to do the same.

#ibelieveher

text: we are individual medical students from the university of new england college of osteopathic medicine located in biddeford, maine and we are calling on senator susan collins (@sensusancollins) to vote no on the confirmation of judge kavanaugh. we believe dr. blasey ford. for those of us who are survivors of sexual assault ourselves, we see our own stories in her and aspire to her bravery. promoting brett kavanaugh to a seat on the supreme court sends a clear message to young men that girls’ and women’s bodies can be used at their disposal and that they have no need to fear of any consequences. it sends an even clearer message to young women: if something like this happens to you, you will not be believed. and it sends a message to survivors across the country that their pain and trauma means nothing when compared to a man’s ambition. #metoo #whyididntreport #assaultfreescotus #whitecoatsagainstkavanaugh

text:
lord, i lift up all survivors of sexual assault who have been triggered by the recent events in the news. cover them with your healing love. send your spirit to comfort them. set their hearts and minds at peace. you are the great healer jesus. help us encourage them to reach for the hem of your garment. let them hear your voice saying, “daughter, your faith has made you well”. i pray that the men of the church would allow their hearts to break for their sisters, and that we would all begin to walk together in your footsteps, obedient to your will and covered by your grace. heal the divisions between us as only you can lord god. our hope that a better world can exist for our children rests in you alone.  i ask this in the holy name of jesus christ, your son, who died on the cross for our sins and rose victorious on the third day. the great way maker and chain breaker. the god who is with us, even now. especially now. amen. .
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

text: i started (and stopped) reading this book so many times over the past year.  like many people, i use reading as a form of escapism, allowing me to step into someone else's life, even if only temporarily, to see and experience life from a different perspective. often for a cheerful distraction from my own life.  but sometimes, those perspectives are challenging, sometimes they grate at you emotionally, and sometimes they just make you outright angry. when i first started reading @zoe_whittall 's book a year and half ago, it was at the height of the #metoo movement. the women's rights movement in the us was full swing and their progressiveness sharply contrasted a government whose policies on women's issues verged on flippant and reckless. women's rights is not a new thing, it has been around for a hundred years, whispering around kitchens tables and at bookclubs and in gender study classes. it was there, marching respectfully in the streets, and lighting candles of rememberance, and writing letter of support. always there, but peripheral, somewhere between local news and the sports recaps. and then, out of what felt like nowhere, everyday women and girls stepped up. and women, as a collective, took a deep breath in and said, "fuck it, me too. me fucking too! i believe her". but in every collective there are outliers. those shadowy female voices calling out for empathy and compassion for the men accused. "men's rights, too!", they protested. i didn't understand. and then i picked up this book. it's the story of an  affluent family in small town america, responding and reacting to accusations of sexual assault. i know what position i'm supposed to assume:  believe the victim. and yet  almost immediately, i felt empathetic to the protagonist's family and started looking for clues that the accusers (see how quickly they transformed from victims?) were lying. the hard truth is, i want to believe that i am enlightened and progressive; and i really want to believe that i'm a feminist, but social conditioning is a hard thing to unlearn. sometimes, we don't even realize that we're following the breadcrumbs. so thanks zoe for helping me see. 4/5. #book #bookworm #reading

text:
young people everywhere are watching & listening to the doubt, discrediting, & degradation of survivors. they understand what's happening and what’s at stake. they get it and so do we. ☹️ i #believesurvivors because i know the fear & shame that victims face. telling your story is not easy.

now more than ever, we need to support organizations that tackle the difficult job of course-correcting the skewed & dangerous narratives around sexual assault. 1 in 3 young people are affected by dating abuse. one in three. think about that number. 😳 
@breakthecycle educates & empowers youth to create a culture without abuse. that means talking to them about consent, fostering compassion for victims, & changing the conversation about healthy relationships. they're in the trenches every day, pushing to make a difference. 
this is why i'm on the #breakthecycle board. because everyone deserves a healthy relationship. because there’s so much work to be done and so many important conversations to be had. and because when the world shows me its worst, i just work harder to support the people who are fighting the good fight. that's why i'm hosting this fundraiser to support break the cycle's youth programs & legal services.

there will be #bingo, #prizes, & fabulous #dragqueens. what more could you want in a #fundraiser? join us on sunday, october 14th at @hamburgermarysweho at 7:30pm. invite your friends & invest in the youth who will save us all. hope to see you there! ❤️ .
#letsbereal #loveisnotabuse #metoo⁠ ⁠ #believewomen #whyididntreport

text:
#whyididntreport (immediately). the first few months after i was date raped, i was in complete denial. i went to intensive therapy for depression, not knowing what the issue was. when i got sick of feeling horrible, i really concentrated and tried to figure out why i was so depressed. and it came to me. i was ready. i finally came to the understanding that what happened to me was rape. it wasn’t violent, but the state of my (un)consciousness at the time, and my inability to consent, or even move for that matter, is what made it rape. i knew i wanted to report once i was out of the denial (about 5 months after the incident), but i was afraid he or his friends would retaliate and i still hadn’t fully accepted or processed everything. i always thought i’d be the type of person to immediately call the police and get a rape kit. most people think they would. but until it happens, you don’t know. 
but why i did finally report? i want my record to be there for the next person. because that’s the only way a conviction seems to occur - multiple women coming forward. would i have gotten a conviction if i had immediately gotten a rape kit? maybe. but probably not. i mean, how many untested rape kits were there in detroit last year? 11,341? and that’s just one city.  swipe right to see some further statistics. 
this is a problem. the solution starts with us. believing your friends when one of them confides in you is a good start.

text_retweet:
i am far from perfect, and i'm well aware that i can be a complete prick at times (though those close to me have mentioned i've gotten better). but attack any of the amazing ladies i have in my life you better pray the police find you first.

#repost @freethenipple
• • • • •
thank u @mattmcgorry for posting this!!!!! brett kavanaugh is the symptom. rape culture and patriarchy is the disease. same with trump. same with the rapists outted by the #metoo movement (not to mention white supremacy, capitalism, etc). men, if you actually care...listen to women, and the women on the front lines of the anti-sexist, anti-rape culture, feminist movement and get to work. and if you’re a man, wondering if i’m talking about you, i can assure you that i am. you need to be a man that other men know stands against rape culture. that other men know won’t let this shit slide. that other men can come to you with their questions about what to do to be a part of the solution. we all have circles of influence, and we need to influence them. we don’t deserve credit for not being a kavanaugh, a trump, or a weinstein. the only way to change this world to make it safer for women and girls is to be preemptive and do the shit that you see almost no other men doing. when you see lots of women in your life re-posting an article or a meme about rape culture, but not men doing it, you do it. violence against women is *men’s* violence against women over 99% of the time. this is our job to fix. guys, next time you hear liberal men complaining about kavanaugh, ask “what are you doing to end rape culture?”

text: the past few days have been an emotional rollercoaster with all of the negativity and doubt for a victim's story. however, i have also seen the love and support shown to the brave women sharing their own stories of abuse. i saw a saying like this and thought i should do more with it. so i made this last night and half of the proceeds go to rainn, the nation's largest anti-sexual violence organization. there are shirts, stickers, and mugs to show support. link in bio.

text:
ariana grande hasn’t had easiest of years and following the recent passing of mac miller, it looks like she just can’t catch a break as pete davidson humiliates her yet again. 
in a shocking interview with howard stern, pete davidson admitted that he was in fact ‘proud’ of his fiancé, ariana grande after she was allegedly ogled by bill clinton during her aretha franklin tribute.

the snl ‘comedian’ didn’t stop there as he also said that he feels bad for the pastor who also allegedly groped ariana during the aretha franklin service and that he comforted the star by telling her that it just means she is ‘so hot’. -
naturally, pete revealed more details of his and ariana grande’s sex life by admitting he would often pleasure himself to the singer before they even met. as if that wasn’t tmi, pete gave hey to his secret to not finishing too early when being intimate with his fiancé. he claims he will picture his father, who died while firefighting in the 911 disaster, “i was just thinking of my dad being burned alive. that’s what i do. i just think of my dad seeing that fire coming toward me”. -

twitter since erupted in shock at pete’s interview claims and ariana’s fans have begun the #arianaleavepete challenge hashtag as they urge the star to reconsider her relationship with pete.

text: this explains a lot and is very enlightening. i filled this out for my pain clinic appointment tomorrow. no wonder i don’t get anything done, or very little, and haven’t in a decade or more. my average pain level is 6-7 which is “so strong it partially or completely dominates your senses, causing you to think unclearly about half the time. at this point you are effectively disabled. you cannot hold a job or maintain normal social relationships.” this is average for me, every single day even with a small amount of pain med like tramadol. it’s true i cannot function completely independently anymore. i spend most of my time and energy managing it. i am incredibly sad and also astounded to actually realize this. to actually have to say it, write it, makes it so real and impossible to deny or downplay anymore. here’s hoping the pain clinic can help. this is what too much trauma including sexual trauma & a life spent quietly battling & dealing with & being ignored by toxic patriarchy does to a body. i’m kind of amazed at and by my own resilience. which is fast evaporating at this point. #fibromyalgia #chronicpainwarrior #metoo #andstillirise #toxicmasculinity #toxicpatriarchy #smashthepatriarchy #listentome #mypainmatters #thisisreallydepressing #mypainisreal #lookatme #awastedlife #iwonderwhatitcouldhavebeen #sinceiwas15
name: psfrankel

text: i see women standing tall, vulnerable, raw, hand in hand, tears, pain, shared. in solitude. i see strength in numbers, i hear my healing in the stories of my sisters. i am proud to know you, to be one with you. i love your voice and your feelings, your anger, rage, your joy. i love your womb, and the miracle of life that you incubate. you are strength. embodied. thank you for your voice, thank you for your sex. for feeding the human race from your breast. for the community you create. for your desire to rise above circumstance. for your resilience. i’m hurt, but proud today. i love you, woman. i see you, woman. i feel the feminine roar, thunder brewing in your soul. your rumbling words will right these wrongs, bring ancient mountains to the floor. grace be yours as you rise to the call.

text:
seeking solace in the woods as an antidote to the black cloud of outage & despair that the kavanaugh hearings have brought. just when you think there is not a trace of humanity, compassion or ethics in the republican party, in comes ana maria archiles, activist extraordinaire, and through sharing her own trauma and all women’s (as who amongst us has not been the victim of  some form of sexual misconduct?), a heart was changed. this is the sun shining through the trees.
“never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.”
—margaret mead
#ibelieveher #metoo
#kavanaughhearings
