text:
i had a great time last night dancing my ass off at the @mustard_plug show last night! it's my second time making it out to see them this year at bells. i love the punk scene, especially skapunk. sad i couldnt push through sooner to see the mushmen again. one step at a time.  i truly am tired of living in fear. i had to go by pepperspray before this, but it was enough to help get me to go. divorced life isnt easy. doing so after a severely controlling, isolating, and abusive long term relationship makes it even harder. plus my other situations arising from standing with victims. especially if you speak your truth and fight back. but, i have amazing people in my life everywhere i go, and i know if i ever become unsafe they will help me out. i'm never going to make friends or deeper connections if i hide all of the time. it's also depressing to do stuff alone, but i'm learning to see this all as empowering. 
also, dont touch someone with out consent! idc how small and insignificant it may seem to you, it is never okay to touch someone, especially a female stranger, without consent! never. that's the other reason i dread going out. my ass was grabbed and rubbed against multiple times by different males. my hat was also something that they kept touching to try to get my attention. i had 2 guys who just kept following me everywhere i went on the dance floor. yet wouldnt say hi. if you arent going to work up the courage, then walk away, because that's how you get labled creepy. just saying. lol i'd really love to see more bands advocating for a safe space for all. like announce it and enforce it. it's nothing against any of the bands there at all. just something i've noticed as a female concert goer, when bands speak up and enforce it, it helps. women are not there for you to objectify. we are there to have fun. fun is not strangers groping and following us. 
#punk #skapunk #fun #punkrock #fun #womenofpunk #recovery #healing #lifetransformation #mustardplug #divorcedlife #divorcerecovery #abuserecovery
#domesticviolencerecovery #rapesurvivor #metoo #bebold #bebrave #beyou
name: Jessica Martin(Meier)

text:
we were out filming the other night and came across this american flag in downtown salt lake city. with the recent events involving kavanaugh, it has us thinking: how do we balance the laws of the land with validating others? we believe “innocent until proven guilty.” this makes sense, yet at the same time, how do we take survivors into account? even if there is no proof of abuse, how do we support and seek justice in those situations?
*
*
*
#docfilm #documentary #breakthesilence #saltlakecity #abuseawareness #metoo #timesup #mormonmetoo #indiefilm #doc #indiedoc #hushedones

text: i’ve been having a hard time putting into words my feelings on all the things going on lately in the news. the #metoo and #believewomen movements are so powerful and should be discussed and will be discussed. i have an odd time with the “hard things” in life, typically just putting distance between myself and those. but that’s not a good excuse. either way, my good friend aaron has said it well. so i’ll steal his quote.

text:
these screen captures are from an ongoing exchange that i had with a woman, a mother of a single child (a son). long story short, her argument is that without evidence, a sexual assault victim is lying.

i never imagined in a million years that'd i be thrusted into a national conversation about my experience with sexual assault when i was 16, and in addition, having to defend the way i handled the assault with absolute strangers who refuse to understand that each #sexcrime is unique and not all #survivorsofsexualassault come forward and, if/when they do, each is unique on a case-by-case basis.

while painful and uncomfortable, i want to thank the people who discredit and disregard our stories. the media has shone light on people (donald trump, brett kavanaugh, lindsey graham, many republicans and others) for who they really are; shutting victims down before they even get a chance to be heard. it is one of the main reasons that reports are not made in the 1st place.

i'm so angry that i've been pushed into a corner by online trolls, and have no option but to explain my experience from 18 years ago in attempt to argue my relating to dr. christine blasey ford. 
#whyididntreport #sexualassault #believesurvivors #stopkavanaugh #metoo #mystory #donaldtrump #brettkavanaugh #lindseygraham #lgbt #lgbtq #survivor

text:
i’ve spent this saturday training new volunteers at musc about the correlation between suicide & sexual assault. unfortunately that correlation is unsurprising. 💙 1 in 10 survivors will die by suicide.
💙1 in 3 will contemplate it. 💙94% of survivors will experience ptsd symptoms the first 2 weeks after an assault 💙factors that contribute to suicide amongst survivors include: being shamed, harboring guilt, being called a liar,  isolation, lack of support, self-blame, & mh symptoms of disorders like ptsd, depression & substance abuse
*⚠️how to help? start by believing survivors. advocate for them to seek help. check in on your loved ones. especially ones that have shown warning signs like withdrawing. volunteer. apply to crisis shelters. share the national suicide prevention hotline: 1-800- 273-8255 📲 and for gods sake #believesurvivors

text:
meet our d.c. fellow @monicasibri. she'll be taking over our insta-story tomorrow & give you the behind the scenes look at our voter registration efforts with @the.wing

monica sibri serves as our washington d.c. fellow.  in 2016 and 2017, monica was a part of ignite’s inaugural fellowship cohort, organizing hundreds of college women across new york city and planning the first nyc young women’s political leadership conference.  she currently serves as a close adviser to cuny dreamers, an undocumented student-led organization she founded in 2013 to help advance equal access to higher education and build a network of support for thousands of undocumented students at the city university of new york, the largest urban university in the united states. monica’s been featured in the new york times, the wall street journal, the guardian, huffington post, the voice of america, new york daily news, and many other local and international newspapers. as a powerful advocate, she works tirelessly to strengthen the immigrant movement by helping undocumented immigrants to access resources, services, and the support they need to succeed. monica earned her ba degree in american politics, policy, and advocacy from the baccalaureate for unique and interdisciplinary studies at the city university of new york. monica's current & future goals include pursuing a masters in political management at george washington univ &  to get more women elected into office – particularly, to get more women into the new york city council by 2021. email her at  monica@ignitenational.org
.
.
.
#declareyourambition #igniteinaction #representher #runasyouare #runforoffice #government #power #feminism #reflectus #womensrights #girlboss #thefutureisfemale #madampresident #genderparity #metoo #girlpower #genderequality #ignitealumni #womenempowerment #womeninpolitics #instagood #leadership #politicalpower #election2018 #vote #youngwomenrun #igniteindc

text: anita hill and dr. christine blasey ford are forever etched in my hippocampus. this week has triggered so many feelings. the victim shaming has been devastating to relive. but the ongoing caping of rapists has had a far greater detrimental effect than anticipated. i’m open to the discussion. but i won’t allow the silencing of voices who have long suffered for the comfort of the accused. #believewomen #metoo #imwithher #missmewiththeexcuses #itsnevertoolate #stopkavanaugh #anitahill #christineblaseyford

text: the events of this week reinforce the need for trauma sensitivity in yoga classes. our society perpetuates silence among survivors, such that even someone as heroic as dr. ford is ignored by the rich, powerful, privileged, white men, when speaking her truth. in order to turn the tide, change begins with us. we need to give survivors a voice, a place to practice saying “no,” a space to reclaim their body, a sense of control, and awareness of autonomy. yoga teachers have power when they guide a room, use it to support and help heal, instead of coerce and trigger your students. 🙏🙏🙏🙏

text:
found another “femme de dimeh” by @guate.mao in barcelona! i love this image of a strong woman, decked in tribal necklaces. she looks slightly reproachful. maybe she’s ashamed of the state of affairs and how women and people of color are treated. but you can tell she’s a fighter and that she will never give up. .
travelling and finding pieces of street artists that i know always feels special. i imagine them late at night around 2-3am installing their art. are they thinking about what we will all think when we see it? .
.

.

text:
i’m sorry that i haven’t shown up fully to the topic of #metoo and what’s going on in our world. i’ve shared in my stories and commented on other people’s feeds, but my main feed has been free of taking a stand or position... so, first off, i apologize. i’ve been afraid to say the wrong thing and maybe not be liked... how arrogant and privileged is that?! survivors are silent because they fear people may not believe them - and so many other very real reasons... and i recognize, acknowledge, and apologize for my bullshit privileged reason.
•
i’m here now, and i’m ready to fully step into this conversation. us men are a large part of the problem, and we are a very important part of the solution. thank you to all of you of wrote me and gave me this feedback that has me writing this and doing this video. i love that i’m safe here to get it wrong, so i can learn how to get it right. i’m humbled and open and curious. and to all of you who have demonstrated such bravery in sharing your story (and to all of you who are holding yours private), i’m inspired and i stand by you. no more fucking playing small. i’m roaring with you.
•
i will never be able to understand what it’s like to be a survivor and/or a woman, but i will do my best. i invite the men reading this and seeing this to stand up with me. #createthelove

text:
#metoo #whyididntreport #youareworthit #notbroken #stayloud #empowerment #zerojudgementpleasethankyou 
this is my story, whether some of you feel it is unnecessary or distasteful to share such intimate information...that is not my problem. my problem is when people do not take accountability for the pain and damage they forcibly placed on another human being. 
i am not asking for responses, nor am i fishing for "attention"...my intent with opening up and showing such intense vulnerability is to hopefully allow even one person who has had this burden placed upon their souls to be able to feel and realize they are not alone. 
if i am friends with/follow your abuser on any social media platform, please please dm/text me and i will promptly and anonymously remove them. 💪🏽🤟🏽
**some may think that it is inappropriate to share such an account of happenings on instagram, where my teenage son has an account and follows me - listen up...
my sons are young men entering a world of absolute chaos, misogyny, challenges, and pain. i would 100x over rather they were aware of what to not put up with, what to stand up to, and what not to do as men. abusers can be men and women of any age and any status...i'd rather my kids were aware that it is better and safer to speak up than to sit still in silence and do nothing.
name: Shauna Engström

#metoo #whyididntreport #youareworthit #notbroken #stayloud #empowerment #zerojudgementpleasethankyou 
this is my story, whether some of you feel it is unnecessary or distasteful to share such intimate information...that is not my problem. my problem is when people do not take accountability for the pain and damage they forcibly placed on another human being. 
i am not asking for responses, nor am i fishing for "attention"...my intent with opening up and showing such intense vulnerability is to hopefully allow even one person who has had this burden placed upon their souls to be able to feel and realize they are not alone. 
if i am friends with/follow your abuser on any social media platform, please please dm/text me and i will promptly and anonymously remove them. 💪🏽🤟🏽
**some may think that it is inappropriate to share such an account of happenings on instagram, where my teenage son has an account and follows me - listen up...
my sons are young men entering a world of absolute chaos, misogyny, challenges, and pain. i would 100x over rather they were aware of what to not put up with, what to stand up to, and what not to do as men. abusers can be men and women of any age and any status...i'd rather my kids were aware that it is better and safer to speak up than to sit still in silence and do nothing.

text:
ladies, let’s talk. this week has been rough, yes? emotional. triggering. infuriating.⠀
⠀
there are so many things i could and want to say, but i’m going to stick with this: take care of yourself, love. 💜 this news and these events are not more important than your wellbeing.⠀
⠀
set boundaries. take a bath. read a book. shut off your phone and tv. crank some music. take a walk/swim/bike ride. get a massage. paint. write. draw. build something. be still and meditate.⠀
⠀
whatever you need to do, do it! and, no matter what, please know you are loved, you are supported, you are believed, you are valued, and you matter!⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
#womenarethefuture #selfcarematters #ibelieveher #believesurvivors #metoo

text_retweet:
my best friend words it perfectly 💕🙌
#repost @lennonflowers ・・・
last night i drank a bottle of chardonnay & lit candles & cried because those in power did what those in power do & because the theory behind why i do what i do was challenged on a national stage because sometimes people tell their stories & it doesn’t matter & because #metoo and because a part of me once thought “that’s it?” because that’s all i’ve allowed myself to think & then i watched dr. ford’s testimony. because what if it wasn’t just politics, what if it was because the problem isn’t empathy & the need to humanize rather than politicize, what if the problem is that it’s easy to have empathy for people who are like you & that people will always find a way to unsee those who are not. because the problem is brett kavanaugh believes brett kavanaugh & men who are like him believe him too. because haha damn what a night guess we got a little carried away good thing nothing really happened just another party let’s silently agree to never mention it again until we both forget. and slowly all you remember about yourself is that you were captain & sure we drank a few beers & boys will be boys but look how hard you worked & see all the accolades you earned & look you even made time to coach the girls’ basketball team. and all of that is true. only she can’t forget because the sound of your laughter & the weight of your body & the feeling of suffocation as you silenced her scream is indelible in the hippocampus. because it’s not all monsters & sociopaths & serial abusers. because sometimes it’s good guys like you yes you because it’s endemic. because the bodies of women & people of color & every person who has been made to feel small aren’t worth noticing until you’re made to notice, and even then you refuse to see. because anita hill thought it would be different now and it wasn’t.
but. i drank that wine & lit those candles & cried in the company of men, men who’ve become my family. and i believe that the stories of 11 men on a committee obscure the real story: that what was endemic won’t be. 
to the friends & survivors for whom this week was brutal: may you never doubt your power. #believesurvivors

text:
on may 21st 2017 i was raped by someone i called my bestfriend. he was my exs "main homie"
i was coherent that night. i had some to drink but not nearly enough for me to be plastered or black out. i remember all the conversations we had that night.
i remember going to bed in clothes. i burrito wrapped myself in the blanket because something told me to. when people heard they took his side. saying "why would you stay the night? " "are you sure you wernt just drunk and dont remember" "what did you expect? you knew he wanted to fuck you".
but none of that matters. you knew my heart and body belonged to j. and i trusted you with my life and you took away my frredom.
i dont go out like i used to with my guy homies because what if it happens again? 
and the worst part? he's still living his life like none of that happened. he admitted to raping me and he's still living his life the way he wants. because the judicial system doesn't give a fuck. it has been almost a year and a half and i'm scared to go out at nigh still. i dont meet new internet friends because how can i trust them? when i couldn't even trust someone i thought i could trust with my life. and what's even worse? the house i live in is within a mile of where it took place. #metoo #rapevictumsdeservemorelightontheirecase
name: s-on-ya not s-own-ya ♡

text:
trigger warning: rape and sexual violence 
as a psychologist, one of the first things you are taught at university is to be neutral. patients and clients, naturally, build trust over time -  and trust engenders relationship. relationship is defined by sharing. and a therapist cannot share themselves...because then their communication ceases to be therapy. 
for this reason, i rarely write or talk about "hot topics". it, generally, divides people - which isn't useful or healthy in session. and so, likewise, i have shied away from it on this platform. 
and then this week happened. 
and neutrality seemed like a privilege few can afford. 
after watching dr blasey ford's heart-shattering testimony (and the relentless post-mortum of the most traumatic day of her life); after reading about a developing rape case in south africa, involving a 7 year old child in a popular chain restaurant frequented by many families; after rejoicing to read that the number of rape cases being charged by the crown prosecution service has plummeted to the lowest in a decade...only to realise that cps later admitted that this was because they were just dropping the "weaker" cases that ruined their track record; after this week. and the week before that, and the week before that, and the week before that: i grew weary. 
and i decided to risk neutrality and share my feelings on rape culture. because unless we start to talk about how this became our new normal, we cannot heal. 
and my feelings are this: it is no longer appropriate for "good" people to remain silent. we need to acknowledge the systemic feedback loops that allow for cases like these to be so prevalent. and admonish the idea that it's someone else's problem. 
rape, sexual violence and gendered violence are our problems. every one of us. 
and every member of our society is responsible for the way its most vulnerable individuals are treated. 
be kind. believe survivors. raise children who don't rape. keep adults accountable for their actions. claim a space for your community where sexual violence isn't normal. and, please, keep these hard conversations going. 
#therapy #psychology #rapeculture #metoo #instagram

text:
#whyididntreport #metoo 
i was young and he was an older friend of my boyfriends at the time. i trusted him, everyone trusted him and he was everyones friend.. we were with a group of friends and we were all walking home and it ended up just me and him and of course it started raining really hard and we were closer to his house and so we stopped there for awhile.
no one was home. it seemed ok because he was a friend, my boyfriends good friend. he let me change into some of his clothes since my clothes were drenched and he came in just as i was finishing getting dressed and he started kissing me. i mean it wasn’t a horrible kiss but he wasn’t my boyfriend and very unwanted but then he started things that i wasn’t wanting.. i told him i didn’t want to and that i was just going to go home and he continued. he was forceful and i was so shocked that all i could do was lye there. i felt hot and shocked by this sweet boy and just thinking how he could do this to me and i cried. that’s all i could do.. i then got dressed and went straight home just crying. i was afraid. i had huge bruises on my neck and legs to hide and a boyfriend i was afraid to tell and friends who admired him. i kept quiet as i let days go by seeing him.

i was young, naive and afraid

text:
the world is heavy today. i’m pulled in so many ways with everything happening in the supreme court. from getting into arguments that question “truth” with fellow ‘audience’ members of this whole show to wanting to scream in outrage with other women, and all the way to locking myself in my dark closet that hold my own stories of rape, assault, and work place misconduct that have all been brushed under the rug.
.
whatever we believe about this event, who’s telling the truth, who’s using who for political gain, or if anyone even cares, the one truth is is that this is the wound being open all over again. because no matter what happens here, we can all sit back and think about what it would be like to be told we were lying when we gave voice to who raped us, that we were asking for it when we trusted them to not grope us while offering us a ride or while enjoying a drink together, or to have to look our attacker in the face the next day at work because he was simply “talked to.”
.
however raw and bloodied this wound though, we’ve been hiding for so long, i do hope, as with all wounds, that when it’s exposed real healing will begin.
.
#survivor #supremecourt #kavanaugh #believeher #shessomeone #empoweredvictim #metoo #livefiercely

text:
🌸self-care reminder🌸
it’s been a hard time lately. you deserve to do something you love. take a bath. buy yourself some flowers. eat the whole thing of ice cream. play video games all day. do nothing all day. put your phone down and don’t look at it all day. 
take care yourself the way you tell your friends to take care of themselves. 
it’s important to recharge your batteries so you can keep fighting. we need you there and we thank you for all your hard work!! but now, rest a little while.

text:
this is a limited space event open to women from high school age and up.
join us to empower yourself. while we have taught these skills well before the #metoo movement, with the country's recent current affairs, we hope you can see the importance of empowering women to be strong, confident, and prepared.
this is a co-ed lead seminar in which you will learn basic proactive self-defense techniques. after learning them, you will have the opportunity to try them on a padded attacker. with our teaching process we're creating muscle memory for the techniques to assist with the flight-fight-or-freeze response women experience in real life situations.
please wear comfortable workout clothes.

register on facebook or email us at empower.venco@gmail.com.
suggested donation of $20 preferred.

text:
• • •
so here is where it’s at:
guess what. i don’t give a rat’s ass if suddenly men are worried about falsely being accused of assault, and they feel the need to walk on eggshells a bit to be sure it doesn’t happen...
because women worry every time they walk to their fucking cars. we go pee in groups so we won’t get groped in hallways. we hold each other’s drinks. we don’t go for runs at night when it’s cooler. we worry about going on dates. we worry about going to the grocery store. we worry about loosing our jobs and being able to feed our kids if we tell someone at work to stop touching us.
every. damn. day.
• • •
#stopkavanaugh 
#metoo
#believewomen

text:
i was followed by another plastic surgeon on ig yesterday. ⁣the boob kind, not the fix you from an accident kind.
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
that drives me absolutely crazy.⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
i don't care if anyone has plastic surgery. i have lots of friends who've been under the knife or injected and i'm happy they're happy. after nursing two kids, i totally get it. my boobs will never be the same. there really is no judgement from me about people getting something done.⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
if a plastic surgeon likes what i share--cool, follow along. but i have a real problem with ones who obviously follow mom hashtags for potential clients. i think it's predatory and sick to target people who likely have some body issues as they navigate postpartum life. i reject the implication that because i've had kids, i need surgery to fix me and make me like before. hopefully i get there on my own in the near future, but i'm not broken. if someone wants a procedure, let them find you. quit stalking mom hashtags.⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
it is always a male doctor that follows me (and eventually unfollows me), which drives me even crazier. from a marketing standpoint, this is totally tone-deaf for the #metoo world. just because this is a public space doesn't mean you have the right to tell women (or anyone) their bodies need to be better. ⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
i like the bump in my nose. i've recently realized that i have one eye smaller than the other and it's super noticeable in pictures. i totally have relief society arms and 30 pounds of baby weight still on me. my kids lift up my shirt and play with my belly. it's still a good body. and so is yours.⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
#rantover #everybodyisagoodbody #bodypositive #plasticsurgeon #bodyimage #confidence #morethanabody #womensupportingwomen #seemorebemore #momlife #momlifeisthebestlife #postpartum #workingmomlife #girlpower #truth ⁣
#momsohard #girlsquad

text:
ribbons in the sky gala empowering families and celebrating non-profits! "this year's gala will be highlighting selected non-profits: grow foundation, inc. aka girls recognizing our worth, with the founder ms. neisha himes.  g.r.o.w. is a non-profit organization providing resources and services to individuals and families affected by domestic violence, along with community outreach and awareness programs. 
also, @hopevizion organization, with the founder, lou "bowlegged lou" george, co-star of the movie 'house party' and recording artist from the musical group 'full force'. hope with a vizion provides support for visually impaired individuals; bringing them together with designated programs and services needed to empower their pursuit for quality of life. 
lastly, the dynamic divas of virginia, inc., with founder, danielle white aka @dynamicdivava1, provides resources, conferences, and workshops promoting self-worth, job readiness and financial literacy for girls and women in disadvantaged areas.”
get your tix today! https://ribbonsinthesky2018.eventbrite.com

text:
listen up! 
if you can’t understand that these posts are purposeful and respect my humanity and personhood as it exists in this turbulent place and time also known as the united states of america then kindly remove yourself. that simple.

text:
tw: why i didn't report...
because the first time it was a family member and he got away with only being charged with sexual battery and 10 years on a sex offenders list. 
in high school, it was my boyfriend and his friends still either dont believe me or dont care after i told them all of the things he did to me.
the second time, it was a teacher who asked me to send him nudes. i was a senior in high school and i didn't want to derail my education by reporting it to the school administrators. i also didnt want to ruin his family's life. his wife was really sweet. 
the third time, it was a friend in the passenger seat of his car and i froze and didnt know what to do. i scrubbed my whole body raw afterwards. i still have a hard time saying it was assault because i was lonely and still wanted him to be my friend even after he did it again. 
the fifth time, it was my ex boyfriend and when i pushed him off of me, he called me a crazy bitch and lied to everyone about what actually happened. 
sexual assault leaves a hole in the human spirit and sometimes the damage is irreparable. my heart goes out to anyone who has been affected by sexual violence and in these current events, it can be hard to see that there is support out there. i belive you. and there are other people who will too. we all need to stand together in these trying times.
.
.
.
art by me
.
.

text:
sept 23rd marked world daughters day. a day that is meant to celebrate all the wonderful, brilliant, beautiful, miraculous, strong, compassionate, smart, loving, caring, athletic, powerful, artistic, creative, gifted, and talented women in our circles, tribes, and spheres.⠀
.⠀
while at first, i thought it sadly ironic that world daughters day falls in the same week as the kavanaugh – ford hearings, i actually feel this is a fortuitous circumstance. rather than marring this day with hearings that continue to expose male privilege and power, world daughters day gives me hope – hope for the generation of girls that are watching, observing, taking note, and who will take action to change the world.⠀
.⠀
with the reality of sexual violence against women broadcast from news media across the united states on a daily basis, it is important to understand the scope of this problem.⠀
.⠀
according to the huffington post:⠀
.⠀
17,700,000 = the estimated number of women who have been the victims of rape since 1998. (that’s 885,000 women every year.)⠀
.⠀
99% = the percentage of perpetrators of sexual violence that will walk free.⠀
.⠀
13% = the percentage of female rape survivors who will attempt suicide. (that’s 115,050 women every year.)⠀
.⠀
it is important to understand that christine blasey ford is not speaking solely from her own experience...
.⠀
view full blog post here: 
http://bit.ly/2qln2eh⠀
.⠀
.⠀
.⠀
#worlddaughtersday 
#brettkavanaugh 
#christineblaseyford 
#women 
#fierce ⠀
#timesup 
#metoo ⠀
#silenceisnotspiritual

text:
written friday sep 28 (yesterday) at 4am, shared on my fb profile, wanted to share here too:
🔸
today history was made in our country (and rippled out throughout the whole world.) this moment will be forever recorded as an important turning point in the us  i felt something as the hearing was happening this morning and i definitely feel it now. do you? ✨
🔸
you are looking at a true hero in this photo. power rooted in truth, sensitivity, empathy, authenticity (soulfulness) confronted power rooted in control, dominance, selfishness, greed, entitlement (ego). and all of us saw the drama play out. christine blasey ford had such courage and faith to be able to do what she did today, providing a heroic example and a healing for the collective pain body.
🔸
feminine power (men and women have feminine power, this is not based on gender) is rising up against the patriarchy and the old world order based on ego. those who benefit from this old system are having a real tough time as this change of the ages happens. it is inevitable. these old selfish systems based on a hierarchy of power and control will crumble, they are crumbling right before our very eyes and it’s not pretty. ✨
🔸
this will be happening over years but it has begun and it’s happening already. the new world will bring with it systems of life and living based on sharing, empathy, equality, balance of power. are you ready to have this world?! we all have our role to play, let’s be brave like dr. ford and follow our inner directive too with faith, clarity and  love. we were born to be a part of this ascension of humanity, no one said it was going to be easy... but we all signed up lol (i’m talking about... that we signed up at the soul level whether conscious or not.)
🔸
guess i’m channeling my inner visionary tonight. peace and love always 😄✌🏼🔮💕, xo, tara
(to self: go get some sleep girl, ha ha, i woke up in the middle ot the night 3am to write this.)
*
thanks @tejalvpatel for sharing this awesome illustration by the talented @many_bothans ❤️👌🏼
*
*
*
*
*

text: i was triggered in a major way yesterday after watching a bit of the kavanaugh hearing. as someone who has experienced this type of assault and only told a couple people about it there’s a lot of emotion inside of me that’s all very confusing and heavy. “do i speak up? do i keep this to myself? what if i am blamed? what if this is happening to other women because i haven’t said something?” are all questions relentlessly swirling around in my brain. truth be told, i played a part in what happened to me. i showed up, i drank the booze, and i put myself in a very vulnerable situation. and because of my alcoholism, this wasn’t the first time i had done so. but you better damn well believe i haven’t had a sip of liquor since that night. but where does my blame end and my assaulter’s begin? it’s all very heavy and it’s all very confusing. but for the very first time, and thanks to very many strong willed women speaking up for people like me, i am starting to realize that it was not all my fault. yes there are things i could have done in order to prevent this from happening, but that doesn’t mean i have to take all the blame. what happened to me and countless other women is in no way acceptable regardless of the situation at hand. it’s not ok. ever. thank you to all the women and men who are speaking up for this largely silent population of women. you are slowly but surely empowering women to speak up about and heal from what they’ve experienced. i can tell my story when and if i want to. we don’t have to keep their secrets anymore if we don’t want to, and i hope every one of them is shaking in their boots right now. #metoo #itsnotoveryet #sacredfeminine #respect #honor #protect #speakup 📷 @laurie_jean_photography
name: ↠ Perri Ann ↞

text:
#webelieveyou. we are here for you. 
each and every woman we know has been effected by this weeks explosive testimony. we are in awe of dr. christine blasey ford. her poise during her testimony was exemplary. sadly, each and every woman we know also has their own story. our patients are enraged. they are in tears. we share their feelings. 
the practitioners at six fishes want you to know that we are holding a safe space for you. with an open heart, we will listen to your rage, your grief and your shame. we’re here to help guide you through this trauma. acupuncture is soothing to the heart and the spirit. now is the time for self-care. 
if your upset, if you’re not sleeping- however you’ve been triggered- please call us. our office is a safe haven and we’d love to help. 
#webelieveyou #webelieveher #acupuncture #herbs #ptsd #metoo #ustoo #womensrights #respect #feminism #strongertogether

text: “i stared in the mirror, examining my neck for bruises tears welling up in my eyes. i wasn’t afraid of the man i loved, but i was scared and concerned for him. he never remembered his night terrors and i couldn’t hold it against him. still, part of me was wondering why i stayed with him. the scared teen girl who had inadvertently fallen for this battered, bruised, crazy, beautiful, intelligent, mysterious, captivating, and troubled man. i stood there staring blankly a few more moments before sleep returned to my eyes and i headed back to bed. i climbed back under the covers, snuggled up to the now calmly sleeping man beside me and quietly whispered: “i’m still here. i love you.” he only moaned in reply, rolled from his stomach to his back and softly began to snore. i shuffled over away from him and turned my back as i wept softly into my pillow before settling back into sleep myself. it wasn’t the first time i’d cried myself to sleep in his bed, and it certainly wouldn’t be the last, but i’m getting ahead of myself here. let’s go back and start at the beginning, shall we?” to read more about becca and noah and their relationship be sure to check out the #linkinbio👉💻 and see what others are saying about candy apple butterscotch: #onsalenow via #kindledirectpublishing. also those with an #amazonprime subscription can check it out for #free via #kindlelendinglibrary for a limited time! #mentalhealthjourney #metoo #ptsdsurvivor #independentpublishing #authorsofinstagram #nonfictionbooks #bookreview #bookrecommendations #readforfreekindle #newbookalert⚠️ #whyididntreport
name: Rebecca MacCeile

text:
“they say this could ruin his life without realizing it has already ruined hers.
they say he was ‘just a kid’ without acknowledging that she was too.
they say it was just a few stupid minutes, without realizing that those few minutes changed all her years.
they say he doesn’t deserve this, as if she does.
they say boys will be boys without realizing they denied this girl her girlhood.”
they say all this and more and they are wrong. 
#ibelieveher #standwithsurvivors #metoo #mentalhealth #standtogether

text: #ibelieveher
name: Diana 🌙🏹
tweet_full: #ibelieveher

text:
clinging to the good moments and beautiful little things (like this guy’s innocence and love) after a week of exhausting emotional labor.
•
i rarely engage in political debates (because i become so emotionally invested i almost make myself sick) but after a local newspaper from my home in calgary posted an “opinion piece” essentially saying rape and sexual assault in highschool or college are silly mistakes and that the #metoo movement is going off the rails i had to use my voice.
•
i’ve spent hours talking to lucas (he’s been very open to listening and learning) and the men in my life, but mostly i’m left disappointed. how have so many men just gone about their week as if nothing is going on? women are a force to be reckoned with but we can’t do it alone. being a “good guy” isn’t enough: we need your voices, men. ask us about our experiences. learn about our stories. be empathetic. please be open to conversing with women in your lives. be a safe place. raise good kids. this has to get better.
•
now excuse my while i hide from social media and the news under the covers with this nugget. reminding myself: there is always goodness and light if you choose to see it. ✨🙏 #ourguysaunders
name: ✨ Nicole Breanne 📷

text:
this is for the brothers and sisters who are still reeling from the dizzying parade of triggering events monopolizing the news outlets this past week. 
_____
this is for the brothers and sisters who are discreetly nursing decades-old scars left where their innocence was violently ripped away.
_____
this is for the brothers and sisters who are building,
creating,
nurturing,
loving,
growing,
teaching,
lifting,
standing up and 
fighting for the next brother or sister because they understand that to do so is essential for 
their 
own 
survival. 
_____
this is for the brothers and sisters whose seemingly outward success is a masterful, silent alchemy of the broken pieces. 
_____
this is for the seeds they buried, not knowing how determined we would become to reach the sun.
_____
this is for the children of a god who has only forsaken us for a moment. 
_____
this is for a most beautiful truth that sees a lifetime beyond the place where we once ceased to exist. 
_____
this is for you. 
this is for me, too.
-eklektiksister7

#stopchildsexualabuse #metoo #survivor #breakthesilence

text:
men ask why women are so pissed off. even guys with wives and daughters. jackson katz, a prominent social researcher, illustrates why.  he's done it with hundreds of audiences: "i draw a line down the middle of a chalkboard, sketching a male symbol on one side and a female symbol on the other.

then i ask just the men: what steps do you guys take, on a daily basis, to prevent yourselves from being sexually assaulted? at first there is a kind of awkward silence as the men try to figure out if they've been asked a trick question. the silence gives way to a smattering of nervous laughter. occasionally, a young a guy will raise his hand and say, 'i stay out of prison.' this is typically followed by another moment of laughter, before someone finally raises his hand and soberly states, 'nothing. i don't think about it.' then i ask the women the same question. what steps do you take on a daily basis to prevent yourselves from being sexually assaulted? women throughout the audience immediately start raising their hands. as the men sit in stunned silence, the women recount safety precautions they take as part of their daily routine. •hold my keys as a potential weapon. •look in the back seat of the car before getting in. •carry a cell phone. •don't go jogging at night. •lock all the windows when i sleep, even on hot summer nights. •be careful not to drink too much. •don't put my drink down and come back to it; make sure i see it being poured. •own a big dog. •carry mace or pepper spray. •have an unlisted phone number. •have a man's voice on my answering machine. •park in well-lit areas. •don't use parking garages. •don't get on elevators with only one man, or with a group of men. •vary my route home from work. •watch what i wear. •don't use highway rest areas. •use a home alarm system. •don't wear headphones when jogging. •avoid forests or wooded areas, even in the daytime. •don't take a first-floor apartment. •go out in groups. •own a firearm. •meet men on first dates in public places. •make sure to have a car or cab fare. •don't make eye contact with men on the street. •make assertive eye contact with men on the street.” ― jackson katz, the m
name: hdangaran

text: usually my posts are sarcastic but lately it's been hard to find humor. every few weeks we're bombarded with another story of a man in a position of power assaulting a woman, negating their stories, diminishing them to nothing. it's hard to reclaim yourself when the world is moving at a pace you can't match. some days it feels like all you can do is keep appearances and it's taken a long time for me to learn that that's okay -- with all of the negativity in the news it's important to acknowledge that we're not asking for a witch hunt, we're asking to be heard. silence isn't working. allowing those with influence to be cloaked in invincibility isn't working. now is the time to reach out to those with pull and make sure they hear your voice -- sending all my love and support to the men and women who can't yet speak up, whatever the reason may be. #metoo
name: Nicki Worthington

text:
y’all ready for me? nah. y’all ain’t ready. at least not all of you. 
trigger warning. this is going to be my most controversial post. ever! that’s saying a lot. keep scrolling if you can’t handle me today. 
in the age of #metoo, and #believesurvivors, and #believewomen, we are neglecting an entire population of survivors. and neglecting to place blame or hold accountable and entire segment of abusers.

what about female abusers? huh? told you that you might want to keep scrolling... yeah i said it. what about step sis? what about auntie? either by blood or your mommas best friend? what about your older cousin? or even a best friend who said you have to do this to remain one of the cool kids? what about your babysitter? the afterschool caretaker? or your best friend’s mom? or the nun, the mother superior that always called you into her office and made you stay after school. holla if you hear me. 
sexual assault isn’t limited to just rape. it’s any unwanted touching, or even advances. anything that pressures you into doing things you don’t want to. we don’t even teach our kids about teachers. how many times have we seen teachers go to jail for having sex with their students?

we focused on that lecherous uncle, and aint teaching our kids that no one, no one at all, has the right to touch them.

someone is gonna come up in these comments and say some dumb shit cuz they were triggered. bih, i spoke nothing but truth here. you have a right not to be touched. i don’t care who it is. and if it’s auntie that did the touching, she needs to be called out. 
i haven’t seen one story yet calling out female assaulters. it’s time. #whyididnotreport

and this is not a gay bashing post. y’all worried about that gay nephew or uncle. and it’s the straight one doing the molesting cuz your eyes are on the wrong prize. 
new hashtag. #believechildren. then they won’t have to wait 30 years to tell their stories..... #kavanope #kavanaught #believewomen #believesurvivors

text:
existence has been particularly challenging this week. everywhere i (and people like me) turn there's bad news. it's not that it isn't obvious that the system doesn't care about us, but it's another thing altogether to have it rubbed in your face every minute of every day. honestly i am filled with anger and despair and have little to no hope of justice for myself or almost anyone else. 
i will survive. i have been surviving for almost 10 years now. i will hold on until better days come.

but for now, i am angry.

#metoo

text:
i can’t imagine what this must be like for women of color. the assaults of white women are always the focal point of the #metoo movement. she is blonde, white, slim, and pretty. she is everything they want and they are still dancing on her trauma. what chance does anyone else stand?
.
the only chance we have is calling, and even if we do that, and even if the investigation proves him guilty (which is a big if), even if all that happens, someone will be confirmed. that person will still be trump’s pick, that person will still be anti-choice, that person will still be a raging misogynist, because trump surrounds himself with people just as hateful as he is. i know this sounds bleak, but no matter what happens with scotus, we are setting a precedent.
.
** @sallykohn this only stops if we make it stop.  call your senators.  then call them again. 202-224-3121.  tell them to vote no on kavanaugh’s nomination.  then call anyone and everyone you know, especially if they live in these states — and tell them to call  lisa murkowski (alaska) and susan collins (maine) as well as jeff flake (arizona) and bob corker (tennessee). also call joe donnelly (indiana), heidi heitkamp (north dakota) and joe manchin (west virginia) — who are democrats in red states and need to be reminded of the right thing to do. ** 202-224-3121 ** #stopkavanaugh #delaythevote #cancelkavanaugh ✊🏻✊🏼✊🏽✊🏾✊🏿

text: (trigger warning: sexual assault) let me preface this by saying this is the one and only time i will ever talk about this outside of my therapists office. when i was 19, i was raped. by someone i trusted. i told him no. he didn’t listen. i never came forward because he used a condom, there was no evidence. i trusted him. i was and still am heartbroken. to this day, i will never tell anyone but my therapist his identity. because i don’t want to keep reliving it like i have this week. i don’t want to be asked what i was wearing or if i’d had anything to drink. i don’t want to be asked why i didn’t report it sooner. did you know only 3% of reported rapes are discovered to be false? did you know women are twice as likely to go to jail for falsifying a rape report than a man is for actually being convicted of a rape? i don’t share this for pity, i share this for awareness, my past will stay in my past. unless of course, the man whom i told no decides he wants to become something important. in which case, i will do as dr. ford has so bravely done and come forward. #believesurvivors #believewomen #metoo #whyididntreport

text:
we must undeniably, collectively and lovingly, work towards ending this global rape culture. 
we must come forth and support one another... you will find that it's not only females being sexually assaulted. this has been an issue for millennia and its end is near... keep being brave, keep speaking truth, keep supporting one another, keep reaching out, keep keeping on... you aren't alone, it was/is not your fault... seek help/support, stay afloat, thrive, find your light, grow, heal.

i know some folks hate their abusers but please understand that these people are sick and need help too... realizing this will make it easier to forgive... and forgiveness will bring healing to both. "darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that." -dr. martin luther king jr.

#metoo #solidarity #weshallovercome #mlk #forgive #loveconquersall #healthyself #heal #grow #lightworker #ethosoftheheart #loveculture #letgoandletgod

text_retweet:
#repost @thisisnothowmystoryends with @get_repost
・・・
abuse is insidious it creeps up on you and you don’t even realize it’s happening
.
mine started before i was married but i only recognize it now in hindsight - it was the comments about other women, insults veiled as jokes, the extreme jealousy and possessiveness that i mistook for love, the arguments that involved him cursing me out and apologizing later for his over reactions and reassurance that they are just meaningless words
.
the arguments escalated to rages where he would stand over me for what felt like hours calling me every vile name possible, threatening me, shoving, blocking me from walking away from an argument, restraining me, hiding my keys etc
.
i was always the woman that believed i was too strong to tolerate an abusive man but his abuse evolved so slowly while he chipped away at my self worth that by the time it became physical i wasn’t the self assured strong woman that entered the relationship - i am strong as hell now though and i will never let anyone hurt me again! 💜💪🏼
.
.
.
.
.
#domesticabuse #womenempowerment #staystrong #domesticsviolence #domesticviolence #survivor #sociopath #ifmywoundswerevisible #truth #domesticviolenceawareness #emotionalabuse #domesticviolencesurvivor #narcissisticabuse #metoo #npdawarenessandvictimrecovery #letshealtogether #narcissistsurvivor #psychopath #strengthtospeakup #isurvived #psychopathfree #nomore #domesticabuseisnotokay #healingishard #itcanhappentoanyone #youarenotalone #believesurvivors #women #theppitimes

text: i was 9 when it started. he was an uncle. he told me not to say anything. mom and dad liked him, i didn’t think they’d believe me. i was 12 when i learned it was wrong, and was able to keep my distance. no one ever asked why i wouldn’t go near him anymore. wonder if they ever thought anything. i trust very few people due to this abuse. i have a strong, thick wall that most don’t break through. he died at a fairly young age a few years ago. i wish, though that he’d been hung by the balls and left to die. #whyididntreport  #sexualabuse #fuckyou #ihatehim #notoverit #metoo #metoomovement #victimofsexualabuse #itsokaynottobeokay

text:
“so many women struggle in silence.” leah is a woman who has struggled in silence, although you would never be able to tell that about her. she is a guy’s gal, the kind of woman who has always been strong, active, and tenacious, for her to be overpowered in any manner was an experience she wouldn’t forget. ♥️
leah is a married mother of 3, and she, like many of the beauty within project participants, was hesitant to reach out to me. like others, she struggled with the belief that she could add value to peoples’ lives. however, as i hope each one of these beautiful woman finds, their stories of heartache and triumph are a wonderful gift, and many are blessed to hear it. ♥️
leah is a rape survivor. as a tough woman, she always felt like it could never happen to her. however, her time in the military would prove to be a significant challenge for her, and she’s not the only one. ♥️
“in 2016 the military had 6,172 reported sexual assaults, but the estimated rate in the military is more than twice that number — 58 percent of service members who reported an assault said they faced retaliation.
♥️
women in the military put their lives on the line on behalf of this country. it is a profound betrayal of their commitment to our nation that the greater threat they face is from fellow service members and from a military justice system that fails them, time after time.” (antonieta rico, time)
♥️
this issue has plagued our armed forces for years. the department of defense released their annual report on sexual assault in the military for 2017 on april 27, 2018, and it states: “sexual assault reports increased. the military services received 6,769 reports of sexual assault involving service members as either victims or subjects of criminal investigations throughout fiscal year 2017. this represents a 9.7 percent increase overall from the 6,172 reports made in fiscal year 2016. of the 6,769 reports of sexual assault, 5,864 involved service member victims. of those 5,864 service member victims, about 10 percent made a report for incidents that occurred to them before entering military service. in sum, 5,277 service members made a report of sexual assault ... (continued below)

text:
✨important announcement!!!✨ i don’t usually post on saturday. it is shabbat, the jewish sabbath. i choose to disconnect for 25 hours but i just can’t do it today. having read so many posts and seen so many videos by my friends yesterday, i feel compelled to do something now, rather than wait until tomorrow or monday as i had planned.
💥

so many posts about kavanaugh and how my friend had a similar experience. so many hashtags #metoo #whyididntreport #whyididreport i don’t have a similar story to tell. my story is different. i am passionate about this because i can help. i have a special gift for helping women clear sexual trauma. when i became a thetahealer, i began to experience the life changing results that thetahealing creates. i have worked with women and girls who have been molested, raped, fondled, touched inappropriately. i have seen what it has done to them and i have watched as their light would turn on after working together for just one hour. this is the fastest, simplest, easiest way to clear what happened and move forward. the change is instantaneous and permanent and it is the most rewarding thing i do. i want women to know that they do not need to continue to suffer. and the road back can be very fast.
💥

i’m going to do a livestream later today to talk about this. speaking is so much more powerful for me than writing so i hope you will join me for i what believe will be the most important livestream i have ever done. please turn on notifications as i will be announcing the time later. i am coordinating the time with one of my friends and clients who wants to come on and share her story. 💥

#thetahealing #thetahealer #theshoshanaleah #metoo #metoomovement #whyididntreport #whyididreport #survivor #rape #sexualassault #molestation #molested #sexualabuse #believewomen #tellyourstory #standupbeheard #womensrights #womanpower #nomoreslience #notyourfault #incest #childabuse #domesticviolence #daterape #womenstandtogether #togetherwearestrong #inspireothers #feminism #bethechange #warriors

✨impoant announcement!!!✨ i don’t usually post on saturday. it is shabbat, the jewish sabbath. i choose to disconnect for 25 hours but i just can’t do it today. having read so many posts and seen so many videos by my friends yesterday, i feel compelled to do something now, rather than wait until tomorrow or monday as i had planned.
💥

so many posts about kavanaugh and how my friend had a similar experience. so many hashtags    i don’t have a similar story to tell. my story is different. i am passionate about this because i can help. i have a special gift for helping women clear sexual trauma. when i became a thetahealer, i began to experience the life changing results that thetahealing creates. i have worked with women and girls who have been molested, raped, fondled, touched inappropriately. i have seen what it has done to them and i have watched as their light would turn on after working together for just one hour. this is the fastest, simplest, easiest way to clear what happened and move forward. the change is instantaneous and permanent and it is the most rewarding thing i do. i want women to know that they do not need to continue to suffer. and the road back can be very fast.
💥

i’m going to do a livestream later today to talk about this. speaking is so much more powerful for me than writing so i hope you will join me for i what believe will be the most impoant livestream i have ever done. please turn on notifications as i will be announcing the time later. i am coordinating the time with one of my friends and clients who wants to come on and share her story. 💥

text: sing it, sister! 🐔💕 when are people going to start to understand that bodies don’t belong to anyone except for the person who is literally living inside of that body?! it’s pretty simple. your body belongs to you. my body belongs to me. their body belongs to them. for those who are apart of this consent culture and who are offended by current events, please realize how hypocritical it is to put flesh and secretions from someone else’s unconsenting body into your mouth. we cannot cry injustice for ourselves and commit the same acts on the most oppressed individuals. leave their bodies the cluck alone! when we begin to understand this simple form of respect, we can then begin to live in peace. ✌🏻💕

text:
a very good friend of mine shared his #metoo story last night and it made me realize, i am a good friend with a big heart. i can count at least 5 times i've saved my friends from abusive situations or bad relationships. i love with a capacity that is not for me but for others. i just want others to feel okay and safe. i end up getting hated and misinterpreted, but others perspective of me doesnt change or define who i am and what i do. i'll defend the person getting walked on cuz i've been there many times in my life and sometimes all that person needs is someone to stand by them and say 'hey, i see you, i hear you, i understand where you're coming from, and i got your back.'
#rant #endrant #thoughts #lastnight #thismorning #spreadlovenothate #positivevibesonly #quote #quotes #words #wordstoliveby #yup #true #truth #dontbeapieceofshit

text:
elisabetta sirani. (1638-1665). timoclea kills captain of alexander the great, her rapist, by stuffing him in well. 1659.

yesterday marked 10 years since i was raped in a bathroom at a house party when i was a senior in high school. it was not the first time i was raped in my life. it was not the last. (the other two were women and if you want argue with me about women not being able to rape, then unfollow me) i am speaking openly about this because of the currents that have come down with the #metoo movement and the kavanaugh case that have seemed to open peoples eyes more. rape culture is real. it has been since the beginning of humankind. both men and women can be raped by both men and women. it doesn’t matter what you’re wearing or what you were drinking or anything like that. rape is about power and that’s a power we need to take back. if you can’t open your eyes and recognise these things then please just don’t ever speak to me, like my pictures, utter my name and unfollow me. these things are traumatic and they run our lives even after we think we have worked through them. i can not tell you how many times i have flinched at the thought of someone i love touching me because someone else stripped me of my power to consent, my own body, my own self worth. listen to survivors, you will never understand until you’ve been though it but i hope to god you never do. open your mind and open your eyes.

text:
i believe dr. ford. even if you aren't completely convinced by kavanaugh's accusers that doesn't mean they should be ignored. their claims deserve to be heard. republicans have been trying to push this nomination through as quickly as possible without fully investigating them. that is the main problem. kavanaugh was already an extremely poor supreme court candidate before the allegations arose though. his biggest claim to fame was helping to "legalize" enhanced interrogation (aka torture) under the bush administration. he is extremely biased and stubborn according to interviewers from the bar association who downgraded his rating twelve years ago. we saw that temperment during his questioning this week. he clearly had and may still have a drinking problem. there is still the question of thousands of dollars in debt over baseball tickets that has not been addressed. such a large portion of his records have been hidden from the public we know very little about his history. what we do know is very concerning. he clearly supports overturning roe and is opposed to the investigation of sitting presidents. he hesitated and refused to answer whether he had met with anyone from trump's lawyer's firm to arrange a deal in the event he has to rule on any future indictment or impeachment questions. so although the sexual allegations are the most serious and high profile problems with this judge they are certainly not his only disqualifying factor.

#trumpchicken 🐥

text:
all this week, #sarahpalin has been very active on twitter, fiercely defending #brettkavanaugh, a man accused of violently assaulting a woman. she has had many words for how badly she feels for him, and all other conservatives "falsely accused" of "anything.".
.
however, while she may have spent her week defending a man accused of assaulting a woman, her son has spent at least part of his... assaulting a woman. #trackpalin was arrested for domestic violence against a woman at his residence on friday night. this is far from the first time this has happened. palin was arrested in 2016 for punching his girlfriend in the face, his ex-wife has accused him of being both physically and verbally abusive, and he's also been arrested for assaulting his own father. 
palin is being charged with fourth-degree domestic violence, interfering with the reporting of a domestic violence crime, disorderly conduct and resisting arrest.
.
palin has said that her son suffers from ptsd, and suggested that this may be a reason for his violent outbursts. other veterans have pushed back against this, suggesting that their ptsd has never made them punch a woman. i don't know. if track palin does have ptsd, i feel terribly for him. but regardless of that, it is worth considering that maybe, just maybe, this is not a guy who should be around women. or the guns he is famously so fond of. .
as you may recall, the last time track assaulted a woman, palin -- while speaking at a rally for #donaldtrump -- suggested that it was obama's fault for not loving the troops enough.
.
well, obama is no longer president -- so what's the theory gonna be now? will she suddenly realize that her son's violent streak is, perhaps, not quite as dependent on the president as she had previously imagined? my guess is she'll find a way to blame colin kaepernick.
@sarahpalin97
@foxnews @foxandfriends 
#republican #conservative #christian #foxnews #cnn #maga #deplorable #trumptrain #trumpsucks #teamtrump #makeamericagreatagain #americafirst #womenshealth #metoo #momslife #relationshipgoals #familyvalues #noclass
#girlboss #girlpower

text:
14 year old emmett till was lynched by roy bryant & his brother  in 1955 after falsely being accused of flirting & making untoward advances towards 21 year old carolyn bryant, roy’s wife. 
decades later after till’s death, carolyn recanted staying that she had fabricated part of the testimony regarding her interaction with till, specifically the portion where she accused till of grabbing her waist and uttering obscenities, "that part's not true," bryant stated in a 2008 interview with historian timothy tyson.

both men were acquitted by an all white jury in 1956 & once they were protected from double jeopardy, admitted publicly they murdered this boy. 
this is what #metoo hysteria leads too. 
this is what lack of due process looks like. 
this is what happens when accusers are simply believed with no evidence. 
rape & sexual assault are heinous & serious crimes. accusations of such against another person should be treated as such.
i wish these metoo warriors had one iota of an inkling how much they're hurting actual crime victims. 
many, many women and children do not report sexual assaults because they believe it's their fault, they'll be shamed, embarrassed, whatever.  this sudden "everyone's a victim now" is going to set victims' rights back a hundred years.  when everyone's a victim, the shock and horror wears off, and eventually no one's to be believed and every report of assault is suspicious. 
far more crimes go unreported than are falsely reported.  this whole thing makes me sick.
i have read several accounts of this story, l believe she came on to him and became aggravated when he politely refused.

text:
i like silence. or, more specifically, the absence of human-made noise. especially lately, where it seems everyone is an expert and has an opinion. and refuses to budge on it, no matter what the facts and/or the reality say. there’s a whole lot of noise out there, but very little substance.

i planted myself in the middle of nowhere in south africa to get away from all of that. but i found that it’s an impossible task. it follows you.

i also don’t like being silenced myself. doubt i’m alone with that. plenty of people who have much to say and contribute are being silenced because we are uncomfortable with what they are saying. because they shine a light where we’d rather have darkness. or because they hold up a mirror when we’d rather not see. but that does not lead to a better world. it leads to suffering and status quo. i’m trying to change that. i hope you will too. 
here’s to facing the mirror, shining a light, and ending the silence. it’s about time we end the noise and bring back the substance. •
•
•
•

#southafrica #motivationalquotes #motivation @tswalu @wildtomorrowfund @wildwomansisterhoodofficial #femalenaturephotographycom #naturephotography #naturelovers #endthestigma #endthesilence #metoo

text:
rather than teaching our girls to be modest, protect themselves, carry mace, dress less provocatively, speak up, be righteous... we should be teaching our young men, to respect, revere, cherish, protect, speak up for, compliment, love our young women...acts of violation are never in any way the fault of the victim. a man/or woman that can’t sense a nonverbal “no”, or doesn’t seek explicit consent, can’t control himself, or show respect, is the sole perpetrator. period. 
i’m beautiful, and did not deserve my assaults. i will not hide myself to keep abusers comfortable and without temptation.
this shit has to stop.

text:
to men: this was my first conversation of the day. a male acquaintance wrote me in response to my ig story asking men why they aren’t speaking out against rape or #stopkavanaugh
💆🏾‍♀️
i share this post to not humiliate this person but to give possible insight on what other men may be thinking as a result of there silence.
💆🏾‍♀️
1) firstly, yes men get raped also 🙏🏾 but on a far different ratio then women. facts: every 98 seconds someone is raped in the u.s. 82% of all juvenile victims are female. 90% of adult rape victims are female. men 3%. so men please stop making that your leading argument. what are u trying to defend when u say that?
💆🏾‍♀️
2) if everyone (women & men) spoke out about rape & harassment then maybe less women and children would be violated and killed. maybe we wouldn’t have a president that thinks it’s ok to grab women without there permission. then maybe we wouldn’t have a known rapist in the supreme court because they knew they wouldn’t be able to get away with it. we live in a rape culture where we are saying it’s ok to have rapist in power (a big middle finger to women basically).
💆🏾‍♀️
3) men: u need to look past your privilege to the things that are happening in the world. be apart of the world community or else u are just another one of the problem 🙏🏾
💆🏾‍♀️
4) sorry, not sorry: u can’t claim ignorance. is this what men think? u feel u can’t talk about rape because u think it doesn’t affect u when in fact rape is a man problem that women have to put up with.
💆🏾‍♀️
understand that when u say “i don’t know about rape” to a woman it’s belittling. before u are ok with sitting in your complacency i encourage you to know. don’t say you’ve never heard the word rape before..
💆🏾‍♀️
of course u do.. now go learn more because it’s a bad look to say u don’t know especially when the #metoo movement started a year ago & evvvvveryone has talked about rape. are u reading & listening to your friends/families stories about how they have been raped or sexually harassed? do u care? how does it make u feel? we live in a rape culture.. you simply can’t say you don’t know...
💆🏾‍♀️
#rapeculture #toxicmasculinity #haveempathy #smh

text:
this is important.  right now is important.  taking action right now is one of the most important things you can do today.  most of us know that what is happening is not ok.  we see it, we feel it.  i have no doubt that is a factor in so many people around me currently struggling.  having to justify and fight for basic rights for all people is exhausting.  witnessing so many women be vulnerable and share their #metoo stories is heartbreaking.  i have those stories too, several.  every single woman i know has a #metoo❤️ story!!! how this is minimally ignorable, and frightenly acceptable, to anyone at all is beyond my comprehension and compassion.  knowing that, unless something drastically changes soon, my daughter will have her own story too... i have no words for the hard feels i have over this.  this isn't ok.  this is important.  right now is the time to do something.  what actions are you taking?

#takeactionnow #callyoursenators #stopkavanaugh #womensrights #believesurvivors #believewomen #imwithher #whyididntreport

text:
hello everyone,  everyday i have to remind myself to hold my keys as a potential weapon. look in the back seat of the car before getting in. carry a cell phone. don't go jogging at night. lock all the windows when i sleep, even on hot summer nights. be careful not to drink too much. don't put my drink down and come back to it; make sure i see it being poured. own a big dog. carry mace or pepper spray. have an unlisted phone number. have a man's voice on my answering machine. park in well-lit areas. don't use parking garages. don't get on elevators with only one man, or with a group of men. vary my route home from work. watch what i wear. don't use highway rest areas. use a home alarm system. don't wear headphones when jogging. avoid forests or wooded areas, even in the daytime. don't take a first-floor apartment. go out in groups. own a firearm. meet men on first dates in public places. make sure to have a car or cab fare. don't make eye contact with men on the street. make assertive eye contact with men on the street.
do you do that?
#metoo #timesup #speakup #hereweare

text:
🙌🏻 ok, this applies on so many levels guys! 🙌🏻
people pleasing is a curse - but remember, every time you put someone else first because you feel you “should” you are teaching yourself that you don’t matter so much and you should be further down the list. this can apply at work, at home and often with your life partner! i’m sure you can relate...😬
but this obviously can also apply to situations that make you feel uncomfortable, and specifically i’m talking about harassment and sexual misconduct here. as the #metoo campaign rages on, i feel too many women still aren’t able to find their voices in this area, and i get it, it’s scary and we are conditioned to stay small, to keep ourselves safe by not confronting behaviour that is completely out of order, but i implore you ladies to speak up. claim your voice, roar it loud and if the situation requires it shout fuck off at the top of your bloody lungs! enough is enough. and if you see one of your sisters struggling with this,  say it for them. 🖕🏻
.
.
.
.
#metoo #enoughisenough #femininerevolution #riseup #roar #speakup #courage #fuckoff #nothanks #pleaseyourself #strength #women #manyvoiceswillbeheard #unite #witch #energy #ki #expand #nomoremrniceguy #powerofthefemale

text:
i believe dr. christine blasey ford.

i've always found it tricky to use instagram as an outlet for social and political speech, mostly due to its photo-centric format. those who know me thru facebook or twitter know me to be more outspoken.

but this was a tumultuous, historic week, and what happened cannot go unacknowledged.

dr. ford's testimony was courageous, open, honest about what she recalled and what she didn't, and most importantly, credible. i believe dr. christine blasey ford, and am grateful to her for coming forward, despite the tremendous cost to herself and her family, and the obvious pain of reliving her trauma before the eyes of the whole nation.

the contrast between her testimony and kavanaugh's could not have been more jarring. kavanaugh was an exposed nerve of all the rage, entitlement, and indignant self righteosness of white male privilege confronted by the notion that a white man might have to be held accountable for his actions.

watching kavanaugh's self-aggrandizing, beligerant testimony i was struck by something; i think he believes he's telling the truth. not that i think he's innocent; i absolutely think he tried to rape christine blasey some 36 years ago. i think he believes the rules don't apply to him. 
his performance thursday was that of a man whose power and privilege have insulated him from consequene his whole life; a man to whom the idea that he might have to answer for his actions is an affront. rape and sexual assault are things bad people do, not entitled elitists like brett.  he's not bad, therefore it couldn't be rape. the allegations against him are unfair because they dare challenge his manifest destiny of a lifetime supreme court appointment. i bet he's heard that women shouldn't be believed, and that "boys will be boys" so many times in life that he's fooled himself. he believes his own lies. this is what rape culture looks like. 
kavanaugh has shown that he does not have the temperment to sit on the supreme court. his nakedly partisan language was shocking coming from a scotus nominee. the allegations are credible.  his presence would be a severe blemish on the integrity of the supreme court.

text:
sharing our stories is exactly like stripping off our clothes in a public park. it's vulnerable, scary af, and we wonder what others will think when they truly see us. but we can no longer be silent, meek, and scared. we must strip down and bare our souls so that we may all learn and grow. i've cried more in the last few days over memories that i thought were left far behind than i have in years. silence doesn't heal, fear doesn't heal, and hiding doesn't heal. the real practice of yoga requires going into the depths out of soul and digging around in the mud so we are no longer controlled by the things we can not see. i don't have a judicial committee to stand before, i have the technology of social media. both require a courage and strength that i never knew i had. while i may never be able to look my abuser in the eyes, i can make a stand for me and all those afraid to speak. •
•
•
•
#neverwasteagoodtrigger #nomudnolotus #feeltoheal #naked #vulnerable #metoo #fuckthepatriarchy #boyswillbeheldaccountablefortheiractions #takethepowerback #consentculture #gracemillsapyoga

text:
last night i drank a bottle of chardonnay and lit candles and cried because those in power did what those in power do and because the theory behind why i do what i do was challenged on a national stage because sometimes people tell their stories and it doesn’t matter and because #metoo and because a part of me once thought “that’s it?” because that’s all i’ve allowed myself to think and then i watched dr. ford’s testimony. because what if it wasn’t just politics, what if it was because the problem isn’t empathy and the need to humanize rather than politicize, what if the problem is that it’s easy to have empathy for people who are like you and that people will always find a way to unsee those who are not. because the problem is brett kavanaugh believes brett kavanaugh and men who are like him believe him too. because haha damn what a night guess we got a little carried away good thing nothing really happened just another party let’s silently agree to never mention it again until we both forget. and slowly all you remember about yourself is that you were captain and sure we drank a few beers and boys will be boys but look how hard you worked and see all the accolades you earned and look you even made time to coach the girls’ basketball team. and all of that is true. only she can’t forget because the sound of your laughter and the weight of your body and the feeling of suffocation as you silenced her scream is indelible in the hippocampus. because it’s not all monsters and sociopaths and serial abusers. because sometimes it’s good guys like you yes you because it’s endemic. because the bodies of women and people of color and every person who has been made to feel small aren’t worth noticing until you’re made to notice, and even then you refuse to see. because anita hill thought it would be different now and it wasn’t.

but. i drank that wine and lit those candles and cried in the company of men, men who’ve become my family. and i believe that the stories of 11 men on a committee obscure the real story: that what was endemic won’t be. 
to the friends and survivors for whom this week was brutal: may you never doubt your power. 
#believesurvivors

text:
photos caught this morning near a nearby university. the cops were called and the 2nd photo was taken by a 12 year old girl who was driving her by with her dad. . .
. .
"my neighbour was driving by with his 12 yr old daughter when the police were there getting it taken down. as they were leaving, the cops asked if she got the picture and smiled - they were happy she witnessed them getting their comeuppance."
. .
. .
#rapeculture #metoo #endvaw #believesurvivors #believewomen #froshweek #homecoming #whyididntreport #unfounded

text:
the reason i dont selfie a lot because i always wear the same shit, i always have the same face, the  same hair, make up blah blah it bore me. the reason i took this selfie is because of the print of my shirt and its relevance of whats going on recently. i made this shirt for the women's march and nobody notices it until yesterday at miejers when a woman came to me and said "i hope he's not gonna be confirmed" and i was like wowza finally somebody got it! we high fived and it feels good that someone paid attention.

#metoo

text:
{9.29.18} #calltoaction #scotus

disgusted by by the aggressive temperament, vengeful, and angry outburst testimony of #brettkavanaugh ? yeah, #metoo . and this is who is the nominee for the next supreme court justice seat, a position of power where the person should be unbiased, calm, and collected? no, i don't think so.

thankfully there is going to be an fbi investigation due to the strong survivors who confronted senator flake in an elevator yesterday...our voices have power. call your senators, especially the ones below who can swing to vote "no". stand on the right side of history: take action, rise up, resist...i'm not ready for @handmaidsonhulu to be our reality!
