text:
a poem i wrote while in foster care at age 16. ▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️
moving again
seems as if it will never end 
starting a new life 
where must i begin ▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️ counting my blessings 
wondering what god has in store
i think to myself 
i cannot take much more
▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️
every move is the beginning of a new life
sometimes there is indescribable strife
i become a new me 
i hope for the day that i will just be ▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️▫️
#fostercare #fostertoadopt #adoptionjourney #mystory #poetry #givemehope #longroadhome #movingagain #fosterchild #fostercareishard #adoptee #childhood #whereishome #livingoutofasuitcase #wheresmyfamily #overandover #metoo #overcomingobstacles #faith #triumphovertrauma #sojourner

text: we can choose to believe women or can choose not to. that’s the irony of this all, somehow we still have more of a choice than she does. we are not entitled to her body, nor her mind, nor her spirit, nor the recounts of the abuse or rape of those parts of her.  we are not the validation of a woman’s experience. we are not her judge or jury. i was drugged, locked in a car, and raped by a stranger. three weeks later, i was abducted by a friend of a friend and trapped in his apartment while he raped me. three months later, a friend i had known since my freshman year of high school took advantage of my vulnerability and raped me everyday over a weekend. i pressed charges on the man who abducted me. i gave my statement to two male officers, appealed for a wire tap warrant with a recount of every invasive detail to five men in a court room. the clothes that were ripped from my body were handed back to me in a brown paper bag after three months of investigation by the male district attorney. in a sealed file there lives naked pictures of my raped body next to the confession from my rapist. there will never be enough evidence for us to believe women. regardless, she and i will still carry our truths and we will wrestle with them and the understanding of their why’s for the rest of our existences. believe me on that. #metoo #rape #rapesurvivor #believewomen #imwithher

text: two years ago to this day (thanks fb for the reminder) i was sexually assaulted in my own home. i did not report the incident to police but choose to screencap his admission of guilt via text with his phone number. i felt my route was more successful because he was found out and put on blast. i wished him no physical harm regardless of the physical harm i had been caused. i felt my method was more effective in finding out his full name (the one he gave me was false) and scaring him in to never touching another women again against her will. had i gone to the police i would probably still be waiting for my day in court and reliving the nightmare. having my sexual history being dragged through the mud. the fact i met him through loose friends at a bar while drinking, and leaving with him at my consent playing against me. what happened after that was not consensual. some people tried to pressure me to go to the police. don't ever do that to someone when you weren't the one to experience it. the system is designed to work against the victims. to those willing to report i stand with you and to those who don't i also stand with you. #nomeansno #metoo #ibelieveyou #stopvictimshaming

text:
a crisis of modern masculinity
creeps in as men 
cry and scream
when a decade
of bad behavior
is dragged out 
of the dark 
and men shrug 
and men say
innocent
until proven guilty

and the same men 
see a woman unbroken 
by what they’ve done
and say she’s wrong  she’s a liar 
what a whore
. .
.
✶ poem by #ktorne
✶ follow @tornepages & turn on notifications for more .

text:
as a survivor myself, i know how difficult it is to navigate the path of healing from rape consciousness. i understand the courage it takes to speak up. 
but the speaking up part is only the beginning. even forgiving your perpetrator is the beginning. the lifetime journey of healing from rape consciousness involves forgiving yourself. 
the act may have only lasted for a moment but the shattered pieces of your existence take much longer to put back together. it’s not easy to put the gloves on, take out the trash bag of self compassion and begin the work of cleaning up your soul. it’s arduous at times. thankless. debilitating. i can’t sugar coat it. the journey to finding your way back to wholeness truly involves reconciling every heartbreaking moment, every moment of darkness and every traumatic memory by witnessing it with love. it doesn’t need to be fixed. it doesn’t need to be changed. it simply needs to be witnessed. 
how many of us have walked in brokenness for decades? how many of us have continued to let harmful people into our life because we didn’t feel worthy enough of healthy, human relationships? how many ways have we numbed ourselves because it was easier than facing the pain of our suffering? it’s been going on for far too long. 
your innocence can never be taken from you. it can only be temporarily forgotten. and maybe you have made a lot of poor decisions because you forgot. and that’s ok. blame isn’t going to work anymore. guilt and shame can’t save you. the only way to freedom is to look into that mermaid mirror and remind yourself that you are worthy and you are perfect and you deserve your fairy tale life. 
your soul may have chosen some really painful situations to learn from. it can be easy to stay in anger. it takes a revolutionary to forgive yourself for the past. 
can you forgive yourself for the insanity of others? can you forgive yourself for the choices you made in the illusion of unworthiness? by grace it’s not only possible, it’s your birthright. even in the darkness, you can trust in your divine perfection. you are a light who is lighting the way for others. and by your forgiveness you set the world free. 
www.meaganmermaid.com

text:
this isn't easy.  but i promised the real reel.  so, hands shaking and heart racing, here we go... #metoo
.
the year is 2007, i am 3 months past my 22nd birthday.  it is my 6-week postpartum checkup. .
i remember every detail of that dr's office.  i remember every detail of the nurse who was in the room.  but i cannot tell you a single thing about what the doctor looked like.  he was a fill-in, as my regular perinatologist was on vacation...
.
read the rest on the blog; link in the profile. .
.

text:
commentary on the kavanaugh hearing is everywhere i go. it is every other conversation. there is no escaping it. 
i’ve taken a backseat in the #metoo⁠ ⁠ conversation for months. i wanted to be happy and funny and cheerful. turns out, i can be all of these things and also be angry as hell.
i know how awful it is to hear the way people talk about survivors. i know what it’s like to realize how many people in your life are a part of the disease. i know how it feels to not be believed.
i know what it’s like to just want a break from it for 10 minutes.

i don’t know how to fight this. 
i know how to keep talking. i know how to love my sisters. i know how to believe, fiercely, that we can do so much better than this.

text:
many afghan women have an assault story.
most have chosen not to report.
they suffer in silence.

the recent nomination of brett kavanaugh has brought many questions including, why are these allegations coming out now? why not report before?

this news comes on the heels of women within the afghan-american community raising their own voices against abuse. the fear of discussing this without facing more consequences only adds to the trauma they are already processing. 
join us sunday evening (6pm pst/9pm est), for one of our most vulnerable conversations to date. we have suffered in silence, will we change the culture? visit bit.ly/silencetsn for more info.

text: it’s okay to stand out 💕 i saw this on a walk to the market in camden this morning and couldn’t help feel a little relieved to see some feminine flair. i’ve been watching the kavanaugh hearings in america from the british news perspective here in london. women in america are so brave and so tired and so strong and so unfairly treated by our political system. as samantha bee summed it up, “yesterday a bunch of super-powerful white dudes stood up and yelled at rape survivors for messing up their schedule.” sending love to whoever needs it today. you are not alone. you are valid. we care about you 💖

text:
#dearprofessorford,
.
i got my first non-seasonal, part-time job at a super market in late summer the year i turned 17. there was a man there, who worked in the deli, who would often make inappropriate sexual comments to me, and at one point went so far as to grab my ass during work (in spite of my being a minor and he being older than my father). i was constantly afraid that he would find me alone in the back and try something else. thankfully nothing ever went further than that, but it definitely made going to work scary. i didn't think anyone would believe me, though, and that's #whyididntreport.
.
this is nothing compared with what you faced, but i think it's important that people know - sexual assault, harassment, etc. are far more widespread than people like to believe. just so you know, #metoo.
.
#byme #bymepoetry #blackrabbitpoetry #sexualassault #ibelieveher #ibelievechristineblaseyford #stopkavanaugh #fucktrump #fucktrumpsupporters #christineblaseyford #bravery #notallheroeswearcapes #thankyoudrchristineblaseyford #innocentuntilprovenguilty #poetryofinstagram #sexualassaultsurvivors #bleedink #spilledink #poetryislove #poetryislife #poetryisnotdead #poetrycommunity #instapoetry #instapoet #stopkavanaugh

text:
there power comes from silence. 
there power comes from fear! 
but you have taken it all and we finally have woken up, realizing there is nothing to fear. what should you take from us?
you are just little creatures feeling bigger holding us small, feeling better making us less. 
we are wounded, and darling fear the wolf who stands with his back to the wall. fear the lion you have tortured until he forgets who he is. the king will always come back to remember and than my dear it’s yours to fear! 
we are many, we are standing together, holding the back one an other so baby it’s now yours to fear - time has changed and we will never be quiet again. you can’t kill us all, you can’t make us forget and you will see that you only harvest what you seed. 🥀 
#metoo #fear #shout #speakitout #stopthefear #lovewillrise #loveisbiggerthanfear #riseagain #recovery #mentallillness #narcsurvivor #narcmother #narcparents #narcissist #metoodebatte #abuse #abusedones #abusesurvivor #emotionalabuse #narcissisticabuse #standup #wearemany #wecare #itsourworld #itsourplanet #stopitnow #riseagain #growth #mentalgrowth

text_retweet:
narcissists are the ultimate sexual predators. detached from their conscience and craving power, control, and supply to feel alive; narcissists are known for their promiscuity. the more deviant and malignant narcissists will pathologically cheat on their partners, push boundaries in the bedroom, and may even force/coerce sex, engage with prostitutes, and/or child pornography. nothing is off limits to someone who lacks empathy and is detached from their conscience. beware! 💛🦋
.
#repost @melanietoniaevans ・・・
why do narcisissts cheat?

narcissists suffer from a poor self-esteem, always needing the acclaim and significance to allow their precariously empty false self to feel "alive". sex is one of the most powerful methods a narcissist has to procure narcissistic supply – the attention that allows the narcissist to know that he or she exists. the real reason ‘outside energy’ is so necessary to a narcissist is: because he or she is an inward spiralling black-hole that can’t sustain his or her own energy; he/she needs to continually suck life-force to emotionally survive.

this constant need for narcissistic supply is frenetically sought so that the narcissist doesn’t collapse into the empty oblivion of his or her own inner self.

sex is easy. it’s cheap and readily available, and a high source of narcissistic supply. it provides copious amounts of psychic energy granted by another, as well as secures people as an ongoing source of narcissistic supply.

narcissists are consummate liars, and have no issue in telling someone what they want to hear in order to hand over sex. narcissists are the ultimate sexual predators.

narcissists commonly have back-up supplies. they store sexual sources – akin to crocodiles keeping lumps of meat under rocks for a future meal.
name: Noble Navigation

text:
9/29/18, 1100: day 176. my #husband flew back to la the day of the hearing. his flight was delayed so by the time he got home, i was already in bed watching some cheesy netflix show, waiting for him to get home. i’ve been sick since last weekend so it’s been a long, cranky week for me with nyquil in tow. he walked into the bedroom carrying these in... my #favorite - lilies. “i’m sorry about today,” he said. “i #love you. we love you. the world loves you.” 💓 he said he wasn’t able to listen to the senate hearing but he was reading about it on the plane and he couldn’t believe what an asshole this guy is. “i just felt like i had to do something on behalf of all the good guys out there to show you that we believe you, we support you, we love you.” makes me emotional just thinking about this moment. i got a good one. the best one. one that i can be 100% myself with, one that understands when there are things that are triggering, things that push me to do my life’s work, things that are a part of my everyday like breathing and walking and talking. love this man so much. really #grateful i survived to see this side of life - the love, the #beauty, the humanity, the #possibility of a #successful, #healthy future. 💪🏽💖 #happysaturday friends. may your weekend be filled with #selflove and #selfcare because you deserve it. ❤️
.
.
.
.
.
#perveenmaria #thewaterwordsproject #rape365 #writer #nonfiction #poetry #writinglife #amwriting #creativewriting #littleaccountlove #flashesofdelight #thatsdarling  #mybeautifulmess #abmlifeissweet #rapesurvior #stoprape #aworldwithoutrape #metoo

text:
i have been traveling in asia since march 2018 on a frugal budget. i still read the conflicts occuring in the us, and they make my heart heavy. but i have also seen firsthand societies under similar weights - financial, social, political, cultural, and environmental. corruption, famine, institutional sexism, the shadows of genocide, the inheritors of oppression, and many forms of government. yet families i meet still find happiness in life, and children are the same all over. many characteristics of these places and these humans are inspiring and deeply admirable. their governments are not the chaos that westerners tend to assume. many aspects are superior to the us.

the core of what i want to communicate is this:

whatever your perspective and life experience - own it. live it. do it. push for the changes you believe in, with whatever tools and power you can afford to spare. do not internalize the traumas and struggles you face as unique. they are not. find the people who share your desire for a different path, who share your vision, and work with them. they exist in every culture, though they may be hard to find. with unity, there is hope.

do not be reactive, and do not allow yourself or your passions to be manipulated. just do the best you can, with where you are, and what you know. life is a difficult thing, for some more than others. integrate your trials as opportunities for insight, discover what you love, and be forceful in creating the world you want your children to live in. none of us are really alone, and the next generation really needs us.

going back to my dry hut. the photo is of me with a scooter in india. the scarf helps prevent dust. and yes, wear a helmet.

#traveler
#traveljournal #womantraveler #womanveteran #americanveterans #americantraveler #hope #philosophy #lifelessons #lifequotes #lifeisbeautiful #metoo #politics #government #usa
name: Scorched Ink
tweet_full:
i have been traveling in asia since march 2018 on a frugal budget. i still read the conflicts occuring in the us, and they make my heart heavy. but i have also seen firsthand societies under similar weights - ficial, social, political, cultural, and environmental. corruption, famine, institutional sexism, the shadows of genocide, the inheritors of oppression, and many forms of government. yet families i meet still find happiness in life, and children are the same all over. many characteristics of these places and these humans are inspiring and deeply admirable. their governments are not the chaos that westerners tend to assume. many aspects are superior to the us.

the core of what i want to communicate is this:

whatever your perspective and life experience - own it. live it. do it. push for the changes you believe in, with whatever tools and power you can afford to spare. do not internalize the traumas and struggles you face as unique. they are not. find the people who share your desire for a different path, who share your vision, and work with them. they exist in every culture, though they may be hard to find. with unity, there is hope.

do not be reactive, and do not allow yourself or your passions to be manipulated. just do the best you can, with where you are, and what you know. life is a difficult thing, for some more than others. integrate your trials as opportunities for insight, discover what you love, and be forceful in creating the world you want your children to live in. none of us are really alone, and the next generation really needs us.

going back to my dry hut. the photo is of me with a scooter in india. the scarf helps prevent dust. and yes, wear a helmet.

#traveler
#traveljournal #womantraveler #womanveteran #americanveterans #american notraveler #hope #philosophy #lifelessons #lifequotes #lifeisbeautiful #metoo #politics #government #usa

text:
he's voting on november 6th. are you? are you registered? where's your polling location? how are you going to get there? who are the candidates? when do the polls close? who have you encouraged to go vote? if you have a car, who are you giving a ride to the polling station, so they can vote? take the time to ask yourself these questions. this moment is too important not to. don't wait til nazis like bannon have shredded our #constitution. we, the people, have a voice. let's make it heard.

in conjunction with “damn you” we released another song yesterday called “time’s up.” i initially wrote the lyrics to this song several months ago in trying to come to terms with my thoughts and feelings towards disturbing allegations of sexual assault close to home in the entertainment industry in toronto. and given recent events, it seems just as timely to be releasing these thoughts to the world now. it’s been made very clear that while we’ve made positive strides in the #metoo and #timesup movements there is a lot of work to do and a lot to fight for. what i’m saying with this song is #ibelieveher, i stand behind my sisters and i believe we can find equality! listen to the full song, link in profile. @timesupnow @metoomvmt #christineblaseyford #breakthesilence .
.
.

.

text:
understand, if you have never been forced to deal with the ramifications of sexual assault, you possess a privilege that some women and survivors have taken their lives over. it is disgraceful and irresponsible to use a privileged and uninformed voice to overshadow and undermined the voice of a survivor. we as fellow women, survivors, allies and humans need to use our voices to empower each other not to discredit each other. intersectional feminism means fighting for the equality of every woman—black, lgbtq+, survivors, disabled, woc, immigrants, every woman! i believe women. i believe survivors. i hear you and i am here for you❤️
•
•
•
•
•
•
•
•

text_retweet:
#believewomen #believesurvivors #cancelkavanaugh #stopkavanaugh #kavanaugh #senate #feministsfightfascism #forwardtoafeministfuture
・・・
#repost @frizzkidart
・・・
today's affirmation art: all survivors are brave. all victims are brave. 💛 those who share their stories of surviving sexual violence/intimate partner violence are brave, but those who may not be able to share their stories or don't want to are also brave. no survivor/victim is cowardly and it's their choice what they want to do with their story. you may also wonder why i chose to include the word "victim." not everyone who experiences sexual violence or intimate partner violence feels like a "survivor." if we want to approach this issue in a "survivor-centric" way, then we can't impose the same strong, recovery, survival narrative on every person impacted by sexual violence/ipv. every survivor/victim is different, navigates their trauma differently, and has different perspectives on justice and healing looks like. in looking at the #metoo movement, i've seen a tendency to want to tell all stories the same way, without realizing that all survivors/victims have different intersections in their identity that a) impacts their likelihood to experience violence and b) changes the way experience justice and reconciliation with trauma. every survivor/victim is worthy of love, respect, and support. every survivor/victim is brave no matter how they choose to cope with their trauma. #art #artist #affirmation #illustration #drawing #draw #healing #heal #justice #metoo #feministart #endrapeculture #selflove #brave #torontoartist #feminist
name: AF3IRM Los Angeles

text:
*trigger warning ⚠️ * sexual harassment
- - - - -
a few days ago, my friend @purple.avocado got harassed and wrote about it. - - - - -
here i am having to write the same post about a dude who harassed me to - - - - -
1. make women know that they’re not alone and that they should speak up and that it’s ok if you’re not beating the sh!t out of the motherf*$&er who just violated you.
2. show men how often this sh!t happens. 
3. hope and call for our generation to raise better men and women with great confidence. - - - - -
i was taking photos while @zoro9483 waited for me. two guys approached us asking me for a selfie, as it happens regularly here in egypt. - - - - -
so i thought, ok no problem. - - - - -
but when this dude started putting my arm around him, i said: “no. stop it. too much here,” walked away from him, but he grabbed my butt. - - - - -
i yelled my heart out at him and several times i wanted to beat him but i couldn’t because
1. i was afraid he was gonna hit me back. 
2. i was afraid he would do something to osama. - - - - -
so i just pushed him away and kept yelling at him while he stumbled a fake a$$: “sorry. sorry.”
- - - - -
only after the guy left, i told osama what happened. - - - - -
then came the next idiot along, asking if i was ok with osama and if i wasn’t i should drive off with him. also he couldn’t leave his hands off me. nowhere inappropriate, but still - i didn’t ask for your hands on my shoulder?!
- - - - -
can we please raise the next generation of men to be more respectful?!
#reiseblogger #digitalnomadgirls #femmetravel #metoo #metoomovement #femmetravel #solotravel #femalesolotraveler #travelingsolo #girlsvsglobe #dametraveler
name: ✈️Jennifer Schlueter

text:
hey listen! #timesup all female panel @raindance 30th sept #sunday

an all-female panel discuss @timesupnow with guest speakers each providing their own perspective and expertise about the systemic changes we need to move forward.

50% of sales raised through public ticketing of this event will be donated to the uk #timesup movement charity, the justice and equality fund (rosa uk). you can donate at any time 
speakers

chair denise parkinson @telegraphgroup

#evegabereau is the founder and managing director of #modernfilms – a uk-based, female-led, social issues-driven film production, distribution and event cinema company. they launched in 2017 with the release of the film manifesto, starring cate blanchett in 13 different roles around which they also shot a short film about the role of art, politics and activism in contemporary life, as well as executive production on the now-#bafta winning and uk foreign language entry for the oscars #iamnotawitch by #runganonyoni. originally from canada, gabereau also holds a french passport. #women @wftv_uk  #femalevoices #womenontop #sheleadsafrica #womeninfilm #instawomen #femalepower #genderequality #ladyboss #woc #womeninhollywood #metoo #unheard #invisablewomen #female #womenboss #womenwholead #cinematographer #cinema #independentcinemaoffice #instagood #instamovies

text_retweet:
“believe women” does not mean “women never lie.”
.
“believe women” does not mean “false accusations never happen.”
.
“believe women” does not mean “we should have immediately withdrawn a supreme court nomination based on one confidential allegation from 36 years ago with no further consideration.”
.
“believe women” does not mean “all men are rapist liars and woman are clearly morally superior to men.”
.
“believe women” means: “listen to the woman, who despite tremendous risk and cost, is bringing (one of three, so far) serious allegations against a man who is interviewing for one of the most powerful positions in the world and who will, if confirmed, represent the moral compass of our nation. listen to her and believe her enough to implement a previously agreed upon best practice for a supreme court justice confirmation that includes a targeted, thorough, informed and impartial investigation for the purpose of understanding the truthfulness (or lack thereof) of said allegations because our sons and daughters desperately need to know and hear from the adults running this country that we care enough to give our best efforts towards uncovering the truth. they need to know that we can at least all agree that “boys will be boys” is a heartbreaking failure and disservice to the boys who we are charged with raising and that girls are not to be the collateral damage in their coming of age stories. they need to know that her past, whether it was last night or 36 years ago, is as important as his future.” repost @lizforkinbohannon

text:
you are dissecting us. 
slicing through layer after layer like our skin and wounds aren’t real if they are not bleeding, not real if they’re healed, as if all scars are visible. 
you cut through flesh and memories. 
you cut to expose our hearts to see if they’re still tainted with the bruises that violent hands left on our thighs, our throats, our souls.

you lacerate us with blunt words. 
piercing us with doubt, ignorance, distrust. not caring what you injure, not caring what you permanently damage to find us worthy is being listened to. 
it’s ironic that after all this exposed flesh, you still don’t see the violence done to us.

text:
🌴what would your dream life look like to you?
.
.
you know.. those things that you daydream about all the time that you believe you can't have.
.
☀you think...☀
🌊i can't have a life like that. 🌊that's just a fantasy not reality.
🌊 i'm too damaged. 🌊i'm too stuck in my ways. 🌊i can't change.
.
.
☀well if that's what you are thinking then you're right. you will never get that life if you keep that mindset.
.
🌴but in case you have an open mind today..
.
listen when i say that you can have that amazing dream life!! you deserve that amazing dream life! .
it's not just a fantasy.
.
it can and will be your reality if you decide that you want it bad enough❤
.
.

text: just incase you think your voice doesn’t matter! these two women held a us senator accountable for his vote to give a man credibly accused of sexual assault a job on the supreme court without an investigation into those allegations. text:
i had low level anxiety all day yesterday. i kept doing different things to try and figure out what was so upsetting me. it wouldn't leave. my mind would try and pin it on small distractions - easy ones. but my soul knew it was deeper. my heart knew what the real issue was.
a woman is recounting a horrific attack and, once again, forces are working hard to shut her up. 
their scared of us, do you see? terrified. 
inside my body, at my solar plexus region, i feel my own fear around it. i feel the old, familiar fear of being held down, paralyzed, my power cut away. every time someone contributes to predatory mindset (specifically around sexual abuse) my solar plexus takes a hit. the hopelessness of it all. feeling so small against a power so big... i can feel generations old pain. 
as i write this now i am crying. and i don't even know if this post will be coherent. but i decided last night that i had to write it and i woke up this morning feeling the same. so i am writing it.
my anxiety yesterday just wouldn't go away. i felt like i needed to cry. i very much wanted to dance - move the body! my mind tried to make it about something so small and inconsequential - wouldn't that be easy? a trick of the mind - it goes to the easy thing to face because the deeper truth is so hard to sit with. but, i know better. i knew this went deep.
and it does.
as soon as i let myself feel empathy for dr. ford, feel the familiar hopelessness around trying to get through to old, wealthy, white men who have so benefitted from the whole "boys will be boys" mindset that they can not let go of the death grip they have on it being right. they can not let their humanity come forward. they can't. their sense of self is far too fragile for that - to admit they have been very, very wrong. as soon as i let myself feel into these things and my own knowing of how that feels i began to cry. there it was. i hit it. the real issue up for healing - how many times i have not been heard, cared for, listened to, thought about, considered a human being who has feelings but instead "enjoyed" as an object for someone else's pleasure and game,.... and i am not alone. and that hurts me deep, too.

text:
solidarity with survivors vigil, tomorrow sunday september 30, 5 p.m., court square. come, let’s gather as a community, in support of one another! 
the senate will vote next week on whether to confirm a sexual predator to a lifetime appointment on the supreme court. today and every day, this campaign stands with survivors. we believe dr. christine blasey ford and the countless survivors like her who have been shamed, threatened, disbelieved, maybe even silenced for a time, but not completely. join us in bearing witness to and honoring the stories of survivors in our own community as we call on washington to do the right thing and #stopkavenaugh! 
#connectorganizechange #believesurvivors #metoo #stopkavanaugh

text:
my happy place: leisurely iced coffee with coconut milk. nowhere to rush off to.

reading a book or connecting on instagram and reading insights from the incredible people i follow, this morning @lisafabrega’s post on her dining experience in greece really resonated with me. thank you for sharing it, lisa.

silencing women is rampant, and it’s frequently perpetuated by other women. countless times other women have attempted to shame or silence me, and i later learned they wanted to “get in with the boys” or that they were triggered by my confidence and independence.

my experiences with men are 1000 times those with women, but it’s important to shed light on both, and i’m not trying to write a novel here.

the desire to make women small and quiet is so embedded in society that many people do it unconsciously and unintentionally.

that doesn’t excuse atrocious behavior, but it is reality in many cases, and exactly why we need more voices from all corners speaking out about their experiences and calling people out on their bullsh*t behavior. 
#believesurvivors #believewomen #ibelieveher #metoo #luladoescosta

text:
keep your center in the midst of chaos, no matter how unfair or unjust it may seem. not always easy to do when the wound is agitated, much less reopened. let it out. make sure to exhale 2 seconds longer than the inhale. take time for yourself to process. the truth always emerges. once venus goes retrograde in scorpio, darkness will be brought to light. justice will prevail. .
.
.
#justice #metoo #survivor #ibelievedrford #trauma #mindfulnesstechniques #center #awareness

text:
i didn’t want to say anything about the hearing this week because i keep my platform free of politics. plus i wanted to hear the testimony before i made a decision on what i believed to be true. after hearing the testimony of dr. christine blasey ford, i believe her. this is why: in her story, in her shaking voice i identified myself at 10 years old being violated by an adult male, a relative of a neighborhood friend. just like dr. ford, i convinced myself to not speak about it years later because, “he didn’t take my clothes off.” i still get nervous telling people about it even though i know it’s not my fault. after therapy and self-work, i have luckily moved on, but it still haunts me to this day. i was moved to tears listening to her testimony because she is me. she is many women. i applaud her courage.
.
.
.
.
#courage #believevictims #strength #christineblaseyford #bravery #hearing #testimony #theirstoriesmatter #metoo #endtheshame #abuse

i didn’t want to say anything about the hearing this week because i keep my platform free of politics. plus i wanted to hear the testimony before i made a decision on what i believed to be true. after hearing the testimony of dr. christine blasey ford, i believe her. this is why: in her story, in her shaking voice i identified myself at 10 years old being violated by an adult male, a relative of a neighborhood friend. just like dr. ford, i convinced myself to not speak about it years later because, “he didn’t take my clothes off.” i still get nervous telling people about it even though i know it’s not my fault. after therapy and self-work, i have luckily moved on, but it still haunts me to this day. i was moved to tears listening to her testimony because she is me. she is many women. i applaud her courage.
.
.
.
.

text:
this week was tough. i’m not quite sure what to say, so i’m gonna hide behind these flowers over here for a minute longer.
.
.
i’d invite you to do the same. to be extra kind to yourself this weekend, whatever that looks like.
.
.
flowers are strong. they grow from dirt- sometimes the conditions aren’t quite right, there’s not enough sun or maybe there’s too much. same with water. they pass through so many hands- they are cut down, packed up, and often shipped half way around the world.  and they remain beautiful.
.
.
we love them for their beauty, but we would never get to appreciate them if it wasn’t for their strength. 💐👊🏼
.
.
#flowersarestrongashell #believewomen #believesurvivors #thankyoudrford #metoo
.
.
photography: @victoriagoldphotography

text:
it’s time to stand up. the hashtags #metoo and #believewomen are more than just a trendy thing to post on social media, it’s a movement of individuals using their voices and demanding to be heard. i consider myself a feminist not because i believe women are superior to men (a ridiculous concept - men are awesome), but because i believe we are equally human and deserve to be treated as such.
.
my greatest passion in life is using my gifts and resources to empower girls and women around the world. we encourage them to use their voices, and it often takes years for them to start to understand their worth. “believe women” doesn’t mean all men are liars and rapists, just like “black lives matter” doesn’t mean that only black lives matter.
.
i’m fully aware that this post isn’t going to solve anything, but i will not be silent on this issue. to all the survivors out there... i see you. i hear you. i am one of you. and i will stand up for you. 🖤
.
photo from @ravenandlily // courage to speak up from @lizbohannon

text: yet again, i’m not surprised by the massive outpouring of brave, fierce, powerful stories of patriarchal abuse and violence in this another-#metoo moment. i’m moved, as are so many others, by all the empathy and tenderness and sorrow and strength being publicly shared, yes; surprised, no. and it’s hard to use the word “surprised” by the equivalent lack — the gaping, galling silence — of stories from all those who participated in and/or were willing bystanders to this patriarchal abuse and violence. it’s as if the #metoo stories only contain fictional characters in the role of someone who engaged in groping, grabbing, hitting, manipulating, controlling, emotionally and/or physically assaulting, raping, and/or all the ad nauseam list of deep wounds inflicted on others without consent. “believing” is a first, albeit big, baby step. there is also admitting, without defensiveness, without trying to excuse away, with humility and self-reflection, as equal first, albeit big, baby step. changing hearts, minds, and this whole rotten culture, while enormous steps, starts with making change in the places we can, collectively and in ways that don’t replicate a police-prison state. none of us have the answer to what a culture of care would look like, a “culture of nurturance” (to quote my friend @norasamaran), a feminist culture (as they are experimenting with in autonomous territories like the chiapas and rojava), a queer(ed) culture, all toward #aworldwithoutpatriarchy. but what doesn’t surprise and nonetheless always unnerves me is that it takes millions of people, in millions of seemingly everyday actions or lack thereof, to uphold any system of domination and violence. it takes millions of people sitting on the sidelines, keeping their mouths shut, not intervening, not shifting their own behaviors, backing up others, or hurting time and again, to make up what’s been called “the banality of evil” or “willing executioners” or simply the many people most of us know in our lives, including friends and family and loved ones, and maybe ourselves. where are those stories, equally brave and vulnerably honest, written by the “victors” of patriarchy? #youtoo? #patriarchykills

text:
in conjunction with “damn you” we released another song yesterday called “time’s up.” i initially wrote the lyrics to this song several months ago in trying to come to terms with my thoughts and feelings towards disturbing allegations of sexual assault close to home in the entertainment industry in toronto. and given recent events, it seems just as timely to be releasing these thoughts to the world now. it’s been made very clear that while we’ve made positive strides in the #metoo and #timesup movements there is a lot of work to do and a lot to fight for. what i’m saying with this song is #ibelieveher, i stand behind my sisters and i believe we can find equality! listen to the full song, link in profile. @timesupnow @metoomvmt #christineblaseyford #breakthesilence .
.
.
“time’s up” by @shainasb, @alisterjohnson, @wellsaid & @tim_abraham. produced by @alisterjohnson. .
.
.
.
.
.
#newmusicfriday #newmusicalert #feminist #thisiswhatafeministlookslike #womenempowerment #womeninmusic #buildherup #tearitdown #canadianwomen

text: i waited months before reporting my boss for sexual harassment last year.  i made excuses for his behavior before i shared it with hr. i brainstormed ways to move off of his team without putting his job at risk. i even took responsibility for his behavior, telling myself and others that i had been too open, too friendly, and it confused our boundaries. and what had me work to protect his reputation was a fear of what would happen to mine and to me, if he in fact did get fired. i was afraid of the retaliation that was already taking place, becoming worse. isolation, shame, blacklisted for any career progression, discomfort, disbelief, ridicule, retaliation. and, i was right to have those fears. while the company i was with did right by letting this person go, what followed was far worse than any photo i ever received. overnight i lost relationships, was taken off wedding invite lists, heard rumors about myself, was never spoken to by specific leadership again, received blaming and harassing text messages from the person who was fired, and was investigated for months by the hr department even after they claimed to support me. beyond embarrassment and isolation i was so ridden with anxiety every day of the week that i thought i would die in my sleep from the feelings i had. it’s now been a year, and i still worry everyday about bumping into the man who helped to create such hell in my life. im sometimes uncomfortable in my own neighborhood as i worry about the possibility of bumping into the women, once friends, who completely removed me from their lives to ensure their own career progression. i cannot imagine what ford feels right now. sharing truth can feel debilitating and freeing at the same time. and there are many people who do their best, men and women, to make it so. this woman’s courage is a gift to me. the women who spoke up last year, beginning the #metoo movement (just a month after my boss was fired), gave me a sense of community during a very dark time of isolation and sadness. we need to support each other. we need to believe each other. it is often a matter of life or death. #ibelieveher

text:
these are my dogs. .
that is a pizza.
.
pizza is their favorite.
.
my dogs won’t eat this pizza. in fact, they won’t even get closer than they are. i walked away from this, went to the bathroom to wash my hands, went to the kitchen to get a drink... all the while, they never got closer. .
why?
.
because i told them no. .
if my dogs listen better than you, you are the problem. .

text:
photo by @amivitale
she wrote in this time « today, @time magazine named the #metoo movement as the person of the year, a movement that has brought so many women forward to tell their stories in order to change the systematic #gender imbalances and violence against women across the world. this movement reveals how much further we have to go in eradicating them and also that we are making great strides in getting there. 
it's moments like these that i am reminded how proud i am to be a part of @rippleeffectimages, helping #empower women and girls world wide through education opportunities. if we can create a world with a truly equal playing field, we will have the power to change it.

this photo was taken during a #fulani baby naming ceremony and the girls put on lipstick for the special occasion. there were a lot of beautiful healthy fat babies there, despite this being a very dry and remote part of #benin. the women told me it was because of a solar irrigated garden and how much it helped changed their lives. »
#silencebreakers #women #whistleblowers #courage #speakup #womenarethefuture #thefutureisfemale #womenpower #womenempowerment  #africa #everydayafrica #photojournalism #amivitale @nikonusa #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador #nikond4s @thephotosociety

text_retweet:
if in the kent falls area, please visit the brewery.  this is for an amazing cause. #metoo 
#repost @kentfallsbrewing
• • • • •
today we will be donating $1 from the sale of every draft beer poured in our tasting room to @endsexualviolence_ct .
the alliance to end sexual violence in ct’s mission is to create communities free of sexual violence and provide culturally affirming trauma-informed advocacy, prevention, and intervention services centered on the voices of survivors.
.
statewide toll free hotlines:
english 1-888-999-5545
español 1-888-568-8332
.
to get in touch, learn more, come involved or donate please visit endsexualviolencect.org
.
we feel producing and selling alcohol for a living comes with certain responsibilities to our community. recognizing, discussing, and combatting the potential dangers brought about by alcohol consumption are among the most important and all too frequently overlooked. 
#drinkbeerdogood #endsexualviolence #craftbeer #beerculture #ctbeer

text: good men, please don’t sit idly by. all over the world we are crying out for you. humiliation, violence & rape know no geographic boundaries, no race, no creed, no class, no age, no religion, no political party. women’s rights are human rights. though we appreciate your “support”, it’s simply not enough. we need you to do better. we need you to raise your sons to respect us. we need you to believe us. we need you to stand by us. we need you to speak up against injustice. we need you to champion the cause of equality. we need your voice & your action! where the hell are you?! #metoo #believesurvivors

text:
evelyn nesbit was given the title of “the it girl of the gilded age.” at fourteen she became the primary income for her family, posing for artists and advertising. her face was used on coca-cola, face creams, tobacco, beer trays, pocket mirrors, and a wide range of other consumer goods. she posed for magazine covers and became an inspiration for charles dana gibson’s illustrations, known as the gibson girl.
at 16, evelyn was introduced to famed architect and new york socialite stanford white after a stage performance. white was not only known for his buildings that embodied the “american renaissance,” but for his taste in underage chorus girls. in his madison square apartment, white drugged and raped evelyn, beginning a dark and unstable relationship between the two until white’s attention eventually moved onto another girl. he appeared to take on a paternal role for a girl who had no father, and even helped her mother and brother financially. behind closed doors, it was a different story.
at 20, evelyn met harry kendall thaw, an heir to a railroad fortune. she denied his marriage proposal, saying she would not wed without a clear conscience and for the first time told someone about what white had done to her. an enraged thaw took evelyn as his prisoner and for two weeks would beat, whip, and rape her. afterwards, he would apologize, saying he didn’t know what came over him. four years later, in 1905, they were wed.
in 1906, thaw still had a vendetta against white for what he did to his now wife. on the evening of june 25, thaw shot and killed white at a rooftop theatre in new york. the couple divorced, and thaw was found insane by the courts.
#watercolor #blackandgrey #gibsongirl #evelynnesbit #metoo
name: Amanda Hinrichs

evelyn nesbit was given the title of “the it girl of the gilded age.” at foueen she became the primary income for her family, posing for aists and adveising. her face was used on coca-cola, face creams, tobacco, beer trays, pocket mirrors, and a wide range of other consumer goods. she posed for magazine covers and became an inspiration for charles dana gibson’s illustrations, known as the gibson girl.
at 16, evelyn was introduced to famed architect and new york socialite stanford white after a stage performance. white was not only known for his buildings that embodied the “american renaissance,” but for his taste in underage chorus girls. in his madison square apament, white drugged and raped evelyn, beginning a dark and unstable relationship between the two until white’s attention eventually moved onto another girl. he appeared to take on a paternal role for a girl who had no father, and even helped her mother and brother ficially. behind closed doors, it was a different story.
at 20, evelyn met harry kendall thaw, an heir to a railroad foune. she denied his marriage proposal, saying she would not wed without a clear conscience and for the first time told someone about what white had done to her. an enraged thaw took evelyn as his prisoner and for two weeks would beat, whip, and rape her. afterwards, he would apologize, saying he didn’t know what came over him. four years later, in 1905, they were wed.
in 1906, thaw still had a vendetta against white for what he did to his now wife. on the evening of june 25, thaw shot and killed white at a rooftop theatre in new york. the couple divorced, and thaw was found insane by the cous.

text:
so much rolls through my mind, my heart and my body with the trial this week. i admit: i’m triggered. triggered because i have my own dark stories that echo dr. ford’s and others. #iamasurvivor
.
despite the pain i think, oh but if we just treated one another the way we want/expect to be treated, these stories wouldn’t even be stories to tell. and you know what? we can.
.
yes, i’m talking about the golden rule.
.
some people tend to think of the golden rule in strictly “positive” terms – i.e., they think of it as only referring to good things, that we should do for others.
.
however, there is another aspect to the golden rule as well – a “negative”, or “prohibitive” aspect. in other words, the rule also applies to bad things, that we should not do to others.
.
it really would solve a lot of the world’s pain and problems. it’s really not that hard. or is it?
.
to treat another human, another life the way we want to be treated ourselves?
.
i know this post is a departure from my regularly scheduled business mindset, inspiration or productivity tips, but i couldn’t not share my heart about it, especially this week.
.
i don’t mean to be preachy. amidst the anger flying around this week, i wanted to speak over it a message that transcends the spirit of accusation.
.
a message of love.
.
what i want is for all of us to face one another and be honest. we don’t always live by this golden rule. if we did, we wouldn’t have done x to person a. we wouldn’t have said y to person b. we wouldn’t have acted z way towards c.
.
so let’s stop and take a moment to review the last week, the last month, the last year… heck our life. and ask god, how have i not loved, served, acted toward, spoken, thought of another in a manner i’d want to be loved, served, acted toward, spoken, thought of?
.
not because #karma. 
because love. let’s #chooselove.
.
.
.
#nationalgoodneighborday #thegoldenrule #goldenrule #standwithsurvivors #ibelieveher #metoo #femaleceo #femaleentrepreneurs #fempreneur #womenentrepreneurs #bossbabe #successfulwomen #ladyboss #propelwomen #mindset #ceomindset #socialimpact #womenempoweringwomen #startup #femaleceo #femalentrepreneur #risingtidesociety  #womeninbusiness

text:
"tell your story.
shout it. write it. 
whisper it if you have to. 
but tell it. 
some won't understand it. 
some will outright reject it. 
but many will 
thank you for it. 
and then the most
magical thing will happen. 
one by one, voices will start 
whispering, 'me, too.'
and your tribe will gather. 
and you will never 
feel alone again." -l.r. knost (author)

text:
our og partner in #leadership development, the wonderful @cyraperry, is releasing her anthology "the anatomy of silence" soon. the book featuring 26 voices speaking out loud about sexual violence "offers an unflinching account of how a culture of shame perpetuates a culture of violence against our bodies—and reflects on what it would take to create a world in which that silence, once broken, stays broken." ✨
. . .⠀
shout out to alums caroline numuhire & stephen hicks for sharing their stories. learn more & watch the trailer with @aishafukushima here: https://redpress.co.uk/pages/anatomy-of-silence ⠀
#genderequity #healthequity #voices #socialjustice #storytelling #thepowerofnarrative #metoo #timesup #abetterworldisonitsway

text:
just coming from the ‘photography & gender dynamics post #metoo’  discussion @thephotographersgallery where lee miller was represented on the panel by ami bouhassane her granddaughter and co-director of her archives along with panellists: photographer juno calypso, federica chiocchetti- writer, curator and director of the photo-literary platform photocaptionist, hannah watson - director of tj boulting gallery and publishing house, khairani barokka - writer, poet and artist and natasha caruana - artist. 
the outline of the discussion was around the increasing focus on the practise of and positions held by women in the past & present in photography, with the aim of addressing aspects of life and society beyond art and gender divisions, in our current #metoo climate.
was interesting to hear from the different fields and perspectives, reflect on the progress and awareness but there is still a way to go! 
@tjboulting  @junocalypso @photocaptionist @natasha.caruana #equalityforall #equality #photography #heforshe #womenphotographers #femaleartists #photographydiscussion #photographers #leemiller #leemillerarchives

text:
i didn't want to post this because i'm exhausted. i'm tired of trying to explain to people why women are angry. why the majority of women don't come forward after assault or rape. why they feel shame or blamed and often decide that their silence is the only thing they feel like they have control over after trauma. i'm tired of feeling like anytime a woman's experiences are questioned, i'm forced to think how a man's career is damaged instead of how the survivors life is unwillingly, dramatically changed. "occasionally i would discuss the assault in individual therapy, but talking about it caused me to relive the trauma, so i tried not to think about it or discuss it. but over the years, i went through periods where i thought about brett's attack. i confided in some close friends that i had an experience with sexual assault." -dr. ford

so many women, like me, can't watch the news. healing is not easy. as much as i want there to be a cultural shift that movements like #metoo has brought, i cannot fully participate. behind my anger is incredible hurt. there's a fear my words will never be enough to change the minds and hearts of people. in the past 2 years especially, i have experienced an ebb and flow of healing versus ptsd. i read a friend's story about assault today and cried unexpectedly. i am tired of reliving those nightmares, picking up the pieces, and then having a trial like this disrupt my sense of well-being and mental health.

i can't share my story with you all. i don't need to. you are owed nothing. i cannot have the weight of women on my shoulders. but at the same time, i cannot be fully silent. i can only show you what my pain and conflict looks like this morning, in the forms i know best: photojournalism.

text:
"i have been victimized. i was in fights that weren't fair. i did not ask for those fights. i lost them all. there is no shame in losing such fights. i have clawed my way to the stage of survivor and refuse to be held hostage by victim status. i look back with sadness rather than hate. i look forward with hope rather than despair. i may never forget, but through the gift of forgiveness, i need not constantly remember. yes. i was a victim. i am a survivor." 💜
#ibelieveher #thisisliving #thisis51 #soberaf

text_retweet: there are so many amazing women i could repost here today. i so appreciate these words from beth moore...and also @jenhatmaker @lisasharper @glennondoyle @brenebrown. and some of my very own warrior friends @jillstroud and @jenn.elrod and @heikaufema. it’s a scary and confusing time to be alive and also beautiful. there is bravery and courage on display in this uprising and i am here for it. i can no longer sit quietly by afraid of offending or waiting for the perfect words. #metoo #believeher #timesup #believesurvivors #downwiththepatriarchy

text:
so, a friend of mine tonight spoke some real fucking truth to me and compelled me to make this post. ⠀
⠀
for too long i have just been sharing experiences or statements of others. i do not mean that to negate their situations and experiences. i mean that in the way that i have never had the courage to speak about my own story that so many other strong, predominantly women, but men too, have been able to do. ⠀
⠀
so, #metoo. ⠀
⠀
i didn’t report each of the three times because i was afraid. ⠀
⠀
i didn’t report because i was afraid to tell my story. ⠀
⠀
i didn’t report because i didn’t think anyone would believe me. that anyone would believe that it could happen to a man. ⠀
⠀
i didn’t report because i didn’t want to publicly relate to another community that is so subjugated to judgement and unwarranted hatred and attacks. ⠀
⠀
but i am a part of this. i have been raped, as a man, not once, not twice, but three times. ⠀
⠀
it is time for me to speak out and join the so many other courageous women and men to do so before me. ⠀
⠀
i. support. survivors. ⠀
⠀
i hope that this may inspire someone else to open up. but just like “coming out of the closet,” it is your choice, and yours alone, to do so if and when you choose to. with that said, know that you will have a community to stand behind you and support you, more than likely beyond what you ever thought could happen. ⠀
⠀
to those before me, i hear you, i believe you, i support you. continue on. move forward. seek help when needed. persevere. you are not, and never will be, alone. ⠀
⠀
much love. siempre. always. 💜⠀
⠀
i. am. no. ones. pawn. ⠀
⠀
#noonespawn #speakout #gay #instagay #supportsurvivors #standwithdrford #notmypresident #moveforward #persevere

text:
professor christine blasey ford is pictured in an undated image shared to researchgate, a website that described itself as, "a professional network for scientists and researchers."
(photo abc news 25 september 2018)
*
christine margaret blasey ford (known professionally as christine blasey) (born november 1966) is an american psychologist and professor of statistics at palo alto university. widely published in her field, she specializes in designing statistical models for research projects. during her academic career, ford has worked as a research psychologist for stanford university's department of psychiatry and a professor at the stanford university school of medicine collaborative clinical psychology program.
*
on september 16, 2018, she publicly alleged that u.s. supreme court nominee brett kavanaugh sexually assaulted her in 1982, in what she described as an attempted rape.
*
personal life
ford lives in palo alto, california, with her husband russell ford, whom she married in 2002, and two sons. she is the aunt of actress and singer bridgit mendler. ford is a registered democrat. in 2017 she participated in a local women's march protesting trump and attended a march for science in san francisco to protest trump administration cuts to research. according to the federal election commission, she has made campaign contributions totaling $80.50, which included donations to the democratic national committee and friends of bernie sanders. ford considered moving to places such as new zealand if kavanaugh becomes a supreme court justice.
*
wikipedia
*

text:
brett kavanaugh submits revised high school yearbook page.
*
the daily show twitter 25 september 2018
*
christine blasey ford
sexual assault allegation against brett kavanaugh - part 1/3
*
in early july 2018, after judge brett kavanaugh was reported to be on donald trump's shortlist to become an associate justice of the supreme court of the united states, ford contacted both the washington post via a tip line and her representative anna eshoo. on july 20, after trump nominated kavanaugh, eshoo met with ford, becoming convinced of her credibility and noting that ford seemed "terrified" that her identity as an accuser might become public.
*
thereafter, eshoo and ford mutually decided to take the matter to senator dianne feinstein, one of ford's senators in california and the ranking democrat on the senate judiciary committee, which would deliberate kavanaugh's nomination. in a letter to feinstein, ford alleged that brett kavanaugh had sexually assaulted her when both were in high school, and stated that she expected her story to be kept confidential. in august, ford took a polygraph test with a former fbi agent, who concluded ford was being truthful when attesting to the accuracy of her allegations.
*
owing to her confidentiality commitment to ford, feinstein did not raise the issue in the initial kavanaugh confirmation proceedings. on september 12, the intercept reported (without naming ford) that feinstein was withholding a kavanaugh-related document from fellow judiciary committee democrats. feinstein then referred ford's letter to the fbi, which redacted ford's name and forwarded the letter to the white house as an update to kavanaugh's background check. the white house in turn sent the letter to the full senate judiciary committee.
(to be continued)
*
wikipedia
*

christine blasey ford
sexual assault allegation against brett kavanaugh - pa 1/3
*
in early july 2018, after judge brett kavanaugh was repoed to be on donald trump's sholist to become an associate justice of the supreme cou of the united states, ford contacted both the washington post via a tip line and her representative anna eshoo. on july 20, after trump nominated kavanaugh, eshoo met with ford, becoming convinced of her credibility and noting that ford seemed "terrified" that her identity as an accuser might become public.
*
thereafter, eshoo and ford mutually decided to take the matter to senator dianne feinstein, one of ford's senators in california and the ranking democrat on the senate judiciary committee, which would deliberate kavanaugh's nomination. in a letter to feinstein, ford alleged that brett kavanaugh had sexually assaulted her when both were in high school, and stated that she expected her story to be kept confidential. in august, ford took a polygraph test with a former fbi agent, who concluded ford was being truthful when attesting to the accuracy of her allegations.
*
owing to her confidentiality commitment to ford, feinstein did not raise the issue in the initial kavanaugh confirmation proceedings. on september 12, the intercept repoed (without naming ford) that feinstein was withholding a kavanaugh-related document from fellow judiciary committee democrats. feinstein then referred ford's letter to the fbi, which redacted ford's name and forwarded the letter to the white house as an update to kavanaugh's background check. the white house in turn sent the letter to the full senate judiciary committee.
(to be continued)

text:
to the women in my life... wooow there’s a lot going on in the world trying to tell us who we are. wow. well, we know who we are. we are stronger than steel. we #love deeper than the ocean floor. in fact, the way we love is what makes us so #strong. the world is #wakingup to this truth. and woof... #shifting & waking up is hard. for us personally, & for our culture. but it’s happening. so let’s lean in to each other, & this collective #awakening. and let’s #holdon. #showup. love hard. keep #rising. #shineon. stay #grounded. #takecare. share our truths - which takes an #aweinspiring amount of #courage. ladies, i honor you. i am beside you. i feel you. i’m with you. #ibelieveyou. we can do this 🙏🏽💜.
.
#believewomen #trustwomen #metoo #tellyourstory #youaresoloved

text:
the contrast between the yearbook and the way that brett kavanaugh speaks about his high-school experience has accentuated the judge's reflexive inability to be candid about his own life.
the new yorker twitter 26 september 2018
*
christine blasey ford
sexual assault allegation against brett kavanaugh - part 2/3
*
on september 16, 2018, after media reported  anonymous allegations and reporters started to track down her identity, ford went public. ford had wrestled with the choice to make her identity known, weighing the potential negative impact it could have on her, but ultimately spoke to the washington post, alleging that kavanaugh had sexually assaulted her in the summer of 1982 when she was 15 and he was 17.
*
she said that, with another boy watching, kavanaugh, intoxicated, held her down on a bed with his body, grinding against and groping her, covering her mouth when she tried to scream and trying to pull her clothes off. she recounted escaping when the second boy jumped on them both and they all fell.
*
as corroboration of her account, ford provided the post with the polygraph as well as session notes from her therapist written in 2012. the therapist's notes do not name kavanaugh but record ford's claim of being attacked by students "from an elitist boys' school" who went on to become "highly respected and high-ranking members of society in washington". the therapist's notes also say four boys were involved, which ford attributed to an error by the therapist; ford said in 2018 that four boys were at the party but only two were involved in the incident. ford's husband recalled that she had used kavanaugh's last name in her 2012 description of the incident. kavanaugh has categorically denied ford's allegations. ford retained civil rights lawyer debra katz to represent her in the process of going public with her statements about kavanaugh.
(to be continued)
*
wikipedia

text:
my fear will not hold me back from testifying," brett kavanaugh accuser christine blasey ford tells lawmakers.
abc news twitter 25 september 2018
*
christine blasey ford
sexual assault allegation against brett kavanaugh - part 3/3
*
on september 18, ford's attorneys sent a letter to senate judiciary chairman chuck grassley requesting that the fbi investigate the incident before the senate holds a hearing on ford's allegations to "ensure that the crucial facts and witnesses in this matter are assessed in a non-partisan manner, and that the committee is fully informed before conducting any hearing or making any decisions". the letter additionally noted the significant public support ford had received, but also severe harassment including death threats, forcing her to leave her home. the same day, a crowdfunding campaign was created to defray ford's security costs, surpassing its $100,000 goal in less than 24 hours.
*
on september 21, president trump tweeted about ford, saying that if ford's allegations were true, either she or her parents would have reported them at the time of the event. fortune called the tweet an attempt "to undermine her allegation" and senator susan collins (r-me), considered a key swing vote on kavanaugh's nomination, said she is "appaled" by trump's tweet, calling it "inappropriate and wrong". trump issued several more statements, including a tweet alleging ford's claims came from "radical left-wing" politicians and lawyers.
*
wikipedia
*
